title: Director, Risk Consulting
description:
**Company Description**

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) drives tangible, impactful and financial results for Visa’s network clients, including both financial services and merchants. Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, data analytics, brand management, marketing, operational and macroeconomics, Visa Consulting and Analytics solves the most strategic problems for our clients.

The US Consulting Practice within Visa Consulting & Analytics provides consulting and solution services for Visa’s largest issuers in the United States. We apply deep expertise in the payments industry to provide solutions to assist clients with their key business priorities, drive growth and improve profitability. The VC&A team provides a comprehensive range of consulting services to deliver solutions that address unique challenges in areas such as improving profitability, strategic growth, customer experience, digital payments and managing risk.

The VCA team seeks a Director to join our Risk Practice and play a role developing and delivering high-impact projects for Visa’s clients in North America. The Risk Practice advises Visa clients and ecosystem partners on core risk management areas for card portfolio management, including originations strategies, underwriting, fraud, authorizations, credit line management, and disputes. Our team also partners closely with other parts of Visa to bring best-in-class guidance to clients on a variety of risk-related topics. The selected candidate will lead a new service line within the Risk Practice organization focusing on Cyber Risk advisory for North American clients.

The Director will identify/develop new client opportunities, manage projects within the practice, and serve as a thought leader to promote sustainable and profitable growth, thereby ensuring that Visa is both the preferred brand and unique business partner.

**Essential functions include:**

* Lead the Cyber Risk advisory service line within North America, including the identification and hiring of new team members as the business grows. Work with leadership to establish revenue targets and own the delivery of annual financial goals. Maintain strong client satisfaction for all projects delivered within the service line.
* Build new project frameworks that identify areas of client exposure to various cyber risks, resulting in net-new engagements that can be commercialized by the consulting organization.
* Participate in the sales process to qualify opportunities and, using a consultative approach, guide clients to the correct engagement type to address their needs.
* Lead consulting initiatives and contribute to closing engagements by identifying potential opportunities with clients.
* Proactively engage with Visa teams in regular strategic & planning discussions
* cultivate and manage a pipeline of work across our core consulting segments.
* Deploy frameworks, approaches, solutions and recommendations that effectively and efficiently address the most impactful opportunities and challenges.
* Build solutions and actionable insights that will help clients to manage risk in their portfolios
* Partner with peers in other functional areas (e.g., Visa Risk, Digital Practice, Strategy Practice) and across global regional teams to execute projects in ways that leverage the breadth and depth of Visa’s resources
* Produce insights, analyses and recommendations to improve client performance, boost growth, drive understanding of client issues and provide strategic guidance for client priorities across the verticals and segments
* Develop and deliver client-ready presentations in collaboration with junior and senior resources on the team

Applicants should be self-motivated and highly energized. Successful team members are detail-oriented individuals who deliver strategic thought leadership, problem diagnostics and high-impact solutions to clients grounded in recent and relevant industry expertise. Candidates must be able to develop enduring, strategic relationships with internal and external clients and across the Visa organization.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

 **Qualifications**

**Basic Qualifications**

* 10 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 8 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters/ MBA/JD/MD) or at least 3 years of work experience with a PhD

**Preferred Qualifications**

* 12 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6+ years of work experience with a PhD
* Qualified candidates will have demonstrated industry expertise in common security frameworks and standards, having delivered cyber-defense or certification services to financial institutions in North America.
* Demonstrated experience in client-facing consulting roles, with an emphasis on cyber risk management. Expert-level knowledge in one or more of the following areas, with a focus on delivering services to financial institutions:
  + Crisis response plans
  + Social engineering defense
  + Cybersecurity workshops
  + Maturity assessments for cyber risk management
  + Vulnerability tests / assessments
* Ability to converse with client leaders who own individual risk functions using empathy, industry-standard terminology, and knowledge of recent industry trends
* Entrepreneurial attitude as demonstrated by a willingness to take on a mixture of high-profile and lower-level tasks in support of the strategic business objectives of the Risk Practice
* Highly collaborative nature with experience working with geographically distributed teams
* Comfortable leading client interview sessions and crafting compelling presentations
* Experience working with financial indicators to measure business performance. Significant focus on impacting ROI
* Strong analytical skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor
* Self-motivated, results oriented individual with the ability to handle numerous projects concurrently
* Knowledge and understanding of risk management, with an emphasis on fraud
* Excellent communication, story-telling and presentation skills for executive audiences
* Team-minded

  
**Additional Information**

**Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

**U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is $143,700 to $220,850 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.**

title: Front Desk Agent
description:
Front Desk AgentDenver, COEasy ApplyEasy Apply

**Pay Starting At: $19.50/hour**

**Overview:**

The Front Desk Clerk is responsible for assisting guests with check-in and check-out, answers and processes all phone calls received, plus handles all special requests for services or information, in accordance with standard policies and procedures.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Key Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Resolve guest complaints, ensuring guest satisfaction.
* Anticipate guests needs, respond promptly and acknowledge all guests, however busy and whatever time of day.
* Maintain positive guest relations at all times.
* Resolve guest complaints, ensuring guest satisfaction.
* Maintain complete knowledge at all times of: a) all hotel features/services, hours of operation. b) all room rates, special packages and promotions. c) daily house count and expected arrivals/departures. d) scheduled daily group activities.
* Obtain assigned bank and ensure accuracy of contracted monies.
* Keep bank secure at all times.
* Answer department telephone within 3 rings, using correct greeting and telephone etiquette.
* Process all guest check-ins.
* Verify registration card information with the guest.
* Obtain back-up information for guest credit/payment method and input into system; collect cash when designated.
* Direct Bell Person to escort guest and transport their luggage to the room.
* Handle overbooked or walked in guests.
* Accept and record wake-up call requests.
* Monitor, send and distribute guest faxes.
* Communicate pertinent guest information to designated departments/personnel (i.e., special requests, amenity delivery).
* Resolve discrepancies on the room status report with Housekeeping.
* Match the bucket check to in-house guest ledger report; report discrepancies to Manager.
* Process all check-outs.
* Process adjustment vouchers, paid-outs, correction vouchers, miscellaneous charges.

**Education and Experience:**

* High School Graduate or General Education Degree (GED).
* One year previous experience in a similar position in a hotel.
* Basic computer skills required.

*Crestline Hotels & Resorts is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender, identity, or disability status.*

From basic benefits to added advantages, **Crestline Hotels & Resorts** does what it takes to take care of our Associates—both in and outside of work. Benefits include: Health and Welfare plans to include Medical/Dental/Vision options, Competitive Paid Time Off, 401k Savings Plan with Company Match, Volunteer Opportunities, Educational Assistance, Travel Discounts, and more! \\*Benefits may vary depending on location.

*\\*No application deadline. All positions posted on on-going basis until filled\\**

title: Restaurant Shift Manager - 12948
description:
Full-Time  
Hourly

As a Shift Manager of our Popeyes location in Seymour, IN, you must assist the  
restaurant manager in profitably and operating the restaurant within the practice and procedures established by Company Operations. This position is responsible for cost control, customer service, restaurant and employee appearance, building sales, maximizing profits, and employee development.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

1.Maintain the highest level of quality, service, and cleanliness in all work assignments.  
2.Train team members on policies, procedures, and standards, as well as continually observing their work ethic and customer service proficiencies. Complete Learning Hub Program and have the knowledge to train team members.  
3.Execution of the guests’ food orders in a friendly and timely manner.  
4.Awareness and adherence to food safety and safety procedures(holding times, temperatures, code dates, walk-in, etc.). Complete HACCP logs.  
5.Knowledge of receiving, rotating, and stocking of food and supply orders in accordance with proper procedure.  
6.Knowledge of all menu items and current pricing.  
7.Project a professional presence in the restaurant community by being active in the community.  
8.Adhere to company ethical cash handling procedures. Responsible for counting starting shift’s registers and safe. Create bank deposits.  
9.Responsible for all voids and cancelation transactions. Maintains and controls register key for all transactions. Issue comps, discounts, and coupons. Maintain store keys for opening and closing restaurant.  
10.Responsible to document and sign-off of all sales, voids and transactions during your shift.  
11.May assist with coaching, and counseling issues as outlined in the Company policies and procedures. Issue Corrective Actions when policies and procedures are not followed.  
12.Ability to demonstrate sense of urgency to get the required job done in a timely manner. Verify that prep process and job duties have been completed before team members are released from shift.  
13.Ability to demonstrate teamwork skills with other employees.  
14.Ability to demonstrate a positive outlook and attitude toward management, other employees, and guests. Properly handle customer complaints, deferring to highest ranking manager in store.  
15.Ability to demonstrate punctuality and adhere to attendance scheduling. Assign positions for team members on each shift. Check and issue meal breaks for team members.  
16.Any other duty to include daily and weekly projects which management deems necessary to the smooth flow, goodwill, and operation of the restaurant.

**Qualification/Requirements:**

To perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above and below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

**Education and / or Experience:**

At least 1 year in a quick service restaurant/fast food industry. Preferably in a leadership position.

Language Skills: Ability to effectively communicate in the English language enough so as to be able to work as a team with other employees to get the required job and essential functions accomplished. Spanish speakers encouraged to apply.

Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out simple one or two step instructions. Ability to make decisions that are beneficial to the guest as well as other employees and the restaurant operation.

Must be at least 18 years or older and adhere to a background check.

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Paid training

Shift:

* Day shift

title: Marine Technician
description:
**Attention prospective marine technicians!**

We're thrilled to announce that our company is expanding, and we're offering aggressive incentive-based pay plans to qualified candidates. Located at one of the most established marinas in Pensacola, we represent several new boats lines and offer marine services to our customers with Yamaha, Mercury and Suzuki outboards.

Call today to be part of our exciting growth and opportunities!

**Compensation Plan is based on performance and proficiency of work performed. Our tiered pay structure is based on relatable experience and qualifications in Marine Outboards and Marine systems.**

L&M Marine Florida is looking for a career-driven marine technician with growth potential in a fast-paced service department. Previous outboard motor experience is preferred. Certifications are a huge PLUS!!

**Types of services:**

* Troubleshoot and diagnose mechanical, electrical, and marine components.
* Perform preventative and corrective maintenance on boats and motors.
* Test and perform maintenance on various boat components.
* Repair functions, including engine and electrical work.
* Document and communicate repairs to the service manager.
* Check and complete service bulletins.
* Maintain knowledge of current marine diagnostic technology.
* Knowledge of marine parts and equipment.
* Ability to complete repair orders timely and efficiently.
* Install extra components like Power Poles, trolling motors and marine electronics.

The service technician is a key component in the service department and this role is vital to the success of the department as a whole. Work rendered by the technician plays a direct role in the experience the customer has while their boat is in service. Not only does work performed impact the department, but it impacts the dealership as well. The position of service manager, service advisor, and technician are a direct representation of the service department and the dealership.

title: Assistant General Manager
description:
**Call it a launchpad for your management career**

Call it HoneyBaked boot camp. Call it real life business school. Whatever you call it, you’ll find our multi week training program to be both a challenge and an opportunity. Unlike most companies, we don’t take a sink-or-swim approach to management. HoneyBaked believes in growth and development and you’ll have experienced trainers to help you develop sales, leadership and core management skills. We’re not hiring you to make sandwiches. We’re hiring you to make decisions, so it’s only fair we give you the tools to do the job.

Our Assistant Managers are full-time, salaried positions that oversee production and assist with store operations including achieving overall performance goals with sales, customer service, product quality, and staff development.

**Our Ideal Candidate:**

* Is a current ready-to-advance Assistant Manager OR Supervisor from a retail or restaurant environment who is passionate about personal, hands-on service for their customers
* Can show how they’ve grown in previous roles
* Would never compromise on the quality of the products they serve/sell
* Is someone who understands how different costs affect the profitability of a business and how to control those costs
* Wants to build relationships in the community and increase sales for their store
* Is a great coach who can identify and develop awesome talent (experience hiring seasonal workers a plus!)

**What Makes US Different?**

We’re a 65+ year old brand with uncompromised quality…but we’re #notstuffy

We believe in balance. We’re closed on Sundays, and, other than four or five weeks a year, managers typically work about 50 hours per week.

Our managers have full accountability of their store operations.

Our Values – yeah, every company says that. We really mean it.

* Love What We Do
* Serve Others
* Aim High
* Do The Right Thing
* Keep It Fun

**What Can We Offer You?**

* Competitive pay and benefits, including a 401(k) with a great match
* Better balance in your life – our operating hours mean minimal early mornings and late nights
* A leadership development program to grow the best of the best. We’re proud of the many people who’ve moved from store associate to senior leadership…and even to franchise ownership!
* An environment where you’ll see the impact you make

We're proud of our company and to be an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for employment are considered without regard to race, sex, color, citizenship, national origin, religion, age, marital status, disability, military/uniformed service, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or any other protected class under applicable federal, state or local law.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

* Driver's License (Required)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

title: Property Manager
description:
Responsibilities:  
- Oversee the day-to-day operations of properties, including facilities management and property maintenance.  
- Manage tenant relationships and address any concerns or issues that may arise.  
- Utilize a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to track and schedule maintenance tasks.  
- Negotiate and manage contracts with vendors and service providers.  
- Conduct regular property inspections to ensure compliance with safety and maintenance standards.  
- Handle tenant inquiries and requests, providing excellent customer service and resolving issues in a timely manner.  
- Maintain accurate records of property-related activities, including data entry and documentation.  
- Implement strategies to maximize occupancy rates and upsell additional services to tenants.

- Strong customer relationship management skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with tenants and address their needs.  
- Proficient in using office software applications, such as Microsoft Office Suite.  
- Excellent phone etiquette and interpersonal skills.  
- Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management abilities.

As a Property Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations of multi-family properties, ensuring compliance with Fair Housing regulations and maintaining high standards of customer service. Your core skills in property management and leasing will be essential in managing tenant relations and property maintenance. title: E Billing Specialist
description:
The E-Billing Specialist position supports the billing and collection process by ensuring invoices are successfully submitted electronically according to client requirements. E-Billing staff should possess knowledge of, and experience using, various legal vendor electronic billing websites in order to fully support the revenue staff. Primary responsibilities include vendor/client/matter setups, monitoring the ebilled inventory statuses, and assisting revenue staff with resolving rejections.

* Assist Billing and Collections in accurately setting up matters in 3E according to client guidelines, including matter IDs, time increments, timekeeper titles and task/activity codes.
* Work with clients and ebilling vendors to complete onboarding process, confirming that all prerequisites have been met in preparation for invoice submission.
* Configure new client setups within BillBlast to comply with client billing requirements.
* Proactively monitor status of ebilled inventory for rejections and delayed client approvals.
* Collaborate with Billing and Collections team to identify rejection reasons and assist in troubleshooting, resubmission, and appealing of invoices.
* Establish relationships with our clients’ financial/ebilling teams and maintain effective & open lines of communication to assure assistance in expeditious payments of our invoices.
* Respond to client inquiries/questions in a timely manner and escalate issues as needed to Supervisor, Manager, Director or other firm management as needed.
* Communicate and effectively work with attorneys and other administrative departments within the Firm to provide a solution oriented customer service experience.

* Confirm compliance with the firm’s accounting, billing and collection policies, and ensure integrity of the firm’s financial and operating information.

* Prepare various reports and analyses, as requested.

* Provide coverage during absence of other team members.

* Other responsibilities within the billing/collection function as they may be assigned from time-to-time.

· A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is recommended; preferably in Accounting or Business.  
· 3+ years’ experience in a large law firm billing department or comparable industry.  
· Proficiency in Elite Enterprise or 3E preferred; experience with Design Gallery, ARCS, Target\\*Cash, Intapp Open and Intapp Time is a plus.  
· Experience with BillBlast, eBilling Hub and E-Billing vendor sites preferred.  
· Proficiency in MS Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point.  
· Strong written and verbal communication skills.  
· Ability to work independently and with a large team, and meet strict deadlines; detail oriented.  
· Flexibility with overtime when necessary.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $93,000.00 per year

description:
**Job Title:** Guest Services/Front Desk ***(Only PM Shift)***

**Reports To:** Front Desk Manager/Operations Manager/General Manager

**Position Summary:**

To create 100% guest satisfaction by providing efficient and effective front desk service.

**Responsibilities:**

● Creates 100% guest satisfaction by providing fast and friendly genuine hospitality and by exceeding guest expectations

● Gives personal attention, takes personal responsibility and uses teamwork when providing guest service

● Listens, apologizes with empathy, finds a solution and follows through when resolving guest problems

● Assumes the responsibility to notice when the guest is not satisfied and uses their best judgment as to when it is appropriate to use the 100% Guest Satisfaction Guarantee

● Performs other duties as required to provide fast and friendly genuine hospitality

● Provides guests with assistance at the front desk during the check-in and check-out processes and throughout their stay.

● Greets guest and processes hotel registration

● Keeps current on hotel accommodations, services and area attractions

● Responds to customer inquiries for information

● Arranges for services requested by the guest by working with other departments as appropriate

● Stays current with developments in the hotel by reviewing and updating the communication log

● Maximizes revenue and cash flow by promoting hotel services and adhering to credit and inventory control processes

● Offers guests updated rooms and promotes hotel amenities, food and beverage outlets and services

● Makes reservations in accordance with hotel’s yield management practices

● Processes customer credit at check-in in accordance with hotel policy

● Identifies and records special billing instructions and notifies accounting

● Obtains appropriate approvals and signatures

● Follows hotel policy on cash banks

**Prerequisites:**

● Focus on the Customer: Seek to understand the guest, internal and external customer and meet and exceed the needs of both the customer and the company.

● Attention to detail: Ensure that work is accurate, thorough and to the highest standards.

● Take Responsibility: Demonstrate personal ownership of tasks and follow through to get the required results.

● Build Strong Relationships: Foster trust and cooperation among coworkers, customers and suppliers; develop and sustain personal contact in order to provide mutual benefit.

● Foster Teamwork: Work well in a team environment and motivate teams to sustain exceptional levels of performance.

● Communicate Effectively: Clarify and provide information so that coworkers, customers, and suppliers understand and can take action.

● Technical Service Skills: Demonstrate understanding of the technical service skills for assigned area (i.e. food & beverage service, housekeeping, etc.)

● Point of Sale: Skilled in utilization of point of sale systems and/or other back-of the house systems.

● Upselling: Know the available products and services and suggest alternatives.

● Reservations Process: Understand the reservations process including the role of the Reservation Center, distribution channels and reservations flow.

**Competencies**

● Strong organizational skills.

● Must be able to work independently.

● Able to multitask and work under varying conditions.

● Excellent people skills

● Must meet/exceed the team expectations

● Energetic personality

**Work Environment**

● Continuously reach, bend, lift, carry, stoop and wipe required throughout the entire shift. May lift and carry up to 50 pounds.

title: Part-time Doorstep Waste Removal
description:
**About Trash Butler**

**Who We Are:**

Trash Butler is the sustainability expert and revolutionary doorstep valet trash service and recycling solution designed for multi-family apartment communities. We currently service over 250,000+ units across 35 states in the country and have been voted one of the top amenities by residents and property managers. Trash Butler has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, TIME Magazine and on CNBC. We pride ourselves on providing stress-free service and professional employees who make a difference every day. We are committed to providing a culture that embraces our four Core Values which include: Building Leaders; Always Branding; Listen, Fulfill and Delight; and Create a Fun, Safe, and Winning Team.

**Who You Are:**

Ready to make an impact? As a Trash Butler team member, you'll be the face of our nightly doorstep trash and recycling collection, playing an important role in our apartment communities we service.

We are looking for aspiring and energetic individuals eager to contribute to the success of Trash Butler, offering a positive attitude, strong work ethic, and a commitment to delivering excellent doorstep valet trash services.

No prior experience? No problem! We provide all the training you need to excel.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive Pay: $1,600 per month. Paid out semi-monthly.  
  + Incentive Programs:
  + Employee Referral Program
  + Performance Incentive Bonus Program
  + Sales Lead Referral Program
  + Next Day Pay Option
* Available Sunday through Thursday evenings.
* Available to work from 7:00pm (Sharp) until finished (approximately 2 hours on average).
* Growth Opportunities: Be a part of a growing company with a reputation for excellence.
* Experience the excitement of an exclusive benefit offering convenient next-day pay option.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Ensure satisfactory completion of nightly doorstep trash/recycling collection during service evenings.

* Utilize the assigned trash tote or cart to collect bagged trash from each resident doorstep.
* Utilize Trash Butler's cutting-edge field app for efficient timekeeping, check-in/out, and reporting.
* Safely transport collected trash from your open-bed pick-up truck or cart to the designated dumpster/chute on site.
* Maintain daily contact with the supervisor/manager to ensure a streamlined and effective workflow.
* Work quietly and efficiently, minimizing noise to avoid disturbance to residents.
* Adhere to the company's core values: Building Leaders, Always Branding, Create a Fun, Safe, and Winning Team, Listen, Fulfill & Delight.
* Undertake any other duties as assigned by the supervisor/manager.

**Minimum Requirements:**

  

* Lift up to 25 lbs. and use hands and arms repetitively.
* Climb stairs in apartment buildings.
* Work outdoors and be exposed to various weather conditions.
* Own an open bed pick-up truck (required at most properties).
* Possess a valid driver’s license and auto insurance in your name or listed as an authorized driver on the insurance (mandatory for properties requiring a truck).
* Have a cell phone (Smart Phone) to download and use the company's app.
* Demonstrate self-motivation and reliability.
* Ability to work independently.
* Work efficiently without sacrificing the quality of service.

**Education & Experience:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Customer service experience is a plus.

**Apply Now!**

Join a team where your work makes a daily difference, not just to our clients but to the environment. Be part of Trash Butler - where your career, growth, and service all come together. Apply today and embark on a journey with a company that values you!

**Offer of employment is contingent upon the candidate successfully passing a pre-employment criminal background check and clean driving history.**

*We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are using E-Verify and are a participant in Right to Work.*
company_description: Founded in 2013, Trash Butler is a nationally recognized Doorstep Pick-Up service focused on creating Job Opportunities and Building and Maintaining a World-Class Culture.

title: Sales Director
description:
The Sales Director is responsible for leading and executing the sales strategy at RD Industries across all markets, channels, and customer segments. This role provides visionary leadership to the sales team, drives revenue growth, ensures exceptional customer engagement, and plays a critical role in strategic business planning. The Sales Director oversees account management, business development, sales operations, and customer service performance, ensuring alignment with RD Industries’ overall growth goals. The ideal candidate is a hands-on sales leader with strong business acumen, a proven track record of managing high-performing teams, and the ability to balance strategic planning with daily execution. This role requires cross-functional collaboration with Product, Marketing, Engineering, Operations, and Finance teams.

**This role is located in Omaha, Nebraska and is 100% on-site.**

**Essential Functions**

* **Strategic Sales Leadership**
* Develop and execute the company’s sales strategy aligned with business objectives and market dynamics.
* Establish and manage annual sales goals, forecasting processes, territory plans, and performance metrics.
* Identify new market opportunities and lead initiatives to expand into emerging verticals and geographies.
* Ensure alignment between sales objectives, product initiatives, and customer needs.
* **Team Development & Performance Management**
* Lead, coach, and develop a multi-level sales team including field sales, inside sales, account managers, and support staff.
* Set clear performance expectations, manage KPIs, and conduct regular 1:1s and team meetings.
* Drive a high-performance, accountable sales culture focused on collaboration, continuous improvement, and customer success.
* **Customer Engagement & Market Development**
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers, distributors, and channel partners.
* Serve as the executive sponsor for major accounts and critical negotiations.
* Attend trade shows, customer meetings, and industry events to represent RD Industries and support sales initiatives.
* **Sales Operations & Execution**
* Oversee the sales pipeline from lead generation through close and post-sale support.
* Ensure effective use of CRM and sales tools for pipeline visibility and forecasting accuracy.
* Monitor pricing strategies, discount structures, and margin targets to protect profitability.
* Collaborate with Marketing and Product teams to refine messaging, campaigns, and launch strategies.

**Work Conditions**This role operates in a professional office and manufacturing environment. Occasional PPE use may be required during facility visits. Regular travel (domestic and occasional international) is expected, up to 30%. **Qualifications:**

* **Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Strong strategic thinking with the ability to execute at both macro and tactical levels.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a focus on influencing and negotiation.
* Demonstrated ability to lead, inspire, and hold teams accountable for performance.
* Proficiency in CRM platforms, forecasting tools, and sales analytics.
* Strong financial acumen and understanding of margins, pricing, and profitability levers.
* **Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (MBA preferred).
* 10+ years of progressive sales experience, including 5+ years in sales leadership roles.
* Proven track record in B2B sales, preferably in packaging, dispensing, or industrial components.
* Experience working across international markets is preferred.

**RDI Benefits:**

* Medical, dental, vision benefits package
* Short-term and long-term disability
* Paid vacation time
* Paid Sick time
* 8 Paid Holidays
* 401K Retirement
* Employee Referral Program
* EAP (Employee Assistance Program)
* PayActiv Wallet- Access your earned pay on demand

Additional Information: This job description outlines the general nature and key responsibilities of the position. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties. RD Industries reserves the right to revise or assign additional responsibilities. Reasonable accommodations may be made for individuals with disabilities.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Esthetic Practice Coordinator
description:
**About the Role:**  
We are seeking a seasoned and licensed esthetician for a unique hybrid opportunity that blends hands-on treatment room expertise with front office coordination and business development. This is not your typical esthetics role—it's designed for someone who wants to remain dedicated to their craft while expanding into the business side of patient care and aesthetics.

This position is based within a thriving dental practice and plays a vital role in both clinical delivery and administrative leadership. You'll work closely with the Practice Manager to elevate the patient experience, contribute to the growth of the esthetic program, and help shape the standards of excellence in an integrated healthcare environment.

**Who We’re Looking For:**  
An experienced esthetician who thrives in a dynamic, team-based setting and is looking to grow beyond the treatment room. You should be passionate about patient care, have a sharp eye for detail, and be eager to take on both administrative and clinical responsibilities. This role is ideal for someone who wants to step into a leadership-minded position while continuing to do what they love.

**Key Responsibilities:**  
*Clinical & Treatment Room Duties*

● Provide esthetic treatments with professionalism, consistency, and excellence

● Educate patients on skincare, products, and treatment plans

● Support medical professionals during clinical services

*Administrative & Coordination Duties*

● Greet and assist patients, ensuring a welcoming and high-touch experience

● Schedule and confirm appointments, manage daily calendars, and minimize no-shows

● Promote wellness and beauty solutions through informed retail recommendations

● Follow up with patients post-treatment to ensure satisfaction and retention

● Lead front desk operations including phone handling, check-ins/outs, and patient inquiries

● Collaborate with the dental and medical teams for seamless service integration

● Assist in inventory, marketing initiatives, and maintaining organized patient records

**Qualifications:**

● Current state esthetician license required

● 1–2 years minimum experience in an esthetic, dermatology, or plastic surgery setting preferred

● Professional demeanor with excellent customer service and communication skills

● Strong organizational and multitasking abilities

● Proficiency with basic office technology and EMR systems

● Interest in business development, leadership, and marketing is a strong plus

**Why Join Us:**  
You’ll be part of a supportive and innovative team within a respected dental practice, working under the leadership of a dedicated Practice Manager. This role offers you a platform to evolve into a true practice leader while continuing to refine your craft in esthetics.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Industry Relations Manager
description:
**UNITED DAIRY INDUSTRY OF MICHIGAN**

American Dairy Association of Michigan

**Job Description**

**Industry Relations Manager**

**FUNCTION:**

The Industry Relations Manager executes projects and tactics within the United Dairy Industry of Michigan’s Industry Relations plan. The position supports the work of the Industry Relations Team in establishing and maintaining positive relationships among dairy producers, the dairy industry and the checkoff program. The Industry Relations Manager also works collaboratively with the UDIM Team to protect and promote the image of dairy foods and dairy farmers.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Create strong relationships with Key Influential Farmers and independent milk shippers, built on two-way communication to ensure understanding and support of their promotion investment.
* Build and maintain positive working relationships with industry partners including dairy producers and other dairy/agriculture organizations to grow support of checkoff throughout their organizations and the farmers they serve.
* Manage and lead Farmer Relation’s engagement across specified DMI business units as assigned (e.g. Sustainability liaison, F.A.R.M., etc.)
* Effectively communicate the value of dairy checkoff to all dairy farmers, dairy cooperatives and other targeted dairy agribusiness organizations, through face-to-face meetings, written communications and electronic communications.
* Plan and host dairy promotion 101 meetings/events.
* Represent the organization and farmer funders at industry meetings.
* Use the UDIM Project Management system to develop and implement cross-functional team projects.
* Contribute to the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database.
* Share farmer insights and feedback with UDIM leadership. Continually monitor and respond to rapidly evolving industry, co-op and farmer needs. Gather farmer sustainability and animal care best practice stories and share with communications team.
* Provide ongoing counsel and support of and help recruit more participation in UDIM programs and events (e.g. board mentor program, consumer events, etc.)
* Manage dairy producer grant program.
* Assist with communication trainings for dairy farmers, industry members, students, etc. using the Telling Your Story modules.
* Other duties as assigned by the Chief Executive Officer or Director of Industry Relations.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

**EDUCATION**

Bachelor’s Degree in Ag communication or other related degree. Associates Degree with work experience will be considered.

**EXPERIENCE**

The Industry Relations Manager should have:

* Knowledge of dairy farming practices and the dairy industry and demonstrated interest in on-farm sustainability.
* Work experience of three to five years in business or communication.
* Prior experience in relationship management, account management, project coordination and time management.
* Must possess strong work ethic.
* Dependable and a self-starter to follow through on meeting personal and organizational objectives and mission.

**PERSONAL**

Qualities necessary are creativity, inquisitiveness, honesty, integrity, initiative, dependability, sound judgement, and the ability to work in a friendly, cooperative and flexible manner with staff, supervision, stakeholders and business contacts.

**POSITION REQUIRES**

* Must have the ability to make dynamic and informative public speaking presentations.
* Strong leadership and project development skills.
* Organizational, analytical, problem solving and financial skills.
* Skill of developing and maintaining positive working relationship with internal team, stakeholders and external partners.
* Must have sufficient computer and technical skills necessary to perform assignments.
* Must have a valid drivers’ license and be willing to travel using various forms of transportation. Work responsibilities may require overnight, or weekend stays or attendance of business meetings several days in duration.
* Must be willing to carry smart phone to keep in contact for emergency situations and keep up to date with email communication.
* Must be able to perform physical requirements which may include: ability to lift over 35 pounds, sitting for long periods of time, using hands to handle or feel, reaching with hands and arms, talking and hearing. Employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, climb or balance and to stoop and kneel. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

**REPORTS TO**

Director of Industry Relations

Revised 2/21

Pay: Up to $27.00 per hour

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance

* Flexible schedule

* Vision insurance

title: Forever Fit Coordinator
description:
The Forever Fit Coordinator is responsible for running Forever Fit - our exercise and fitness programming within the community. This position teaches exercise and fitness classes to residents living in Independent Living, Assisted Living and/or Memory Care communities. Our Forever Fit program addresses the physical, mental, and social needs of our residents. The Forever Fit Coordinator works with patience and compassion to engage residents and meet their unique needs. Additionally, this position works closely with in house therapists to facilitate one-on-one sessions with residents. The Forever Fit Coordinator reports to the Life Enrichment Manager and is a part of the Life Enrichment Team. They educate our residents on leading a healthy lifestyle and encourage them as they go through fitness challenges and achievements. The Forever Fit Coordinator enjoys being on the go across the community and building meaningful relationships with our residents.

Our Life Enrichment Department offers engaging activities and programs that encourage our residents to explore their interests and expand their horizons. Residents participate at their own pace and shine through dynamic activity involvement. They keep activities fresh and innovative, understanding that our communities thrive from the diversity and creativity of our residents. Our goal is to build programming that enhances our residents' quality of life and is enjoyable and beneficial to their well-being.

Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities:

* Provide instruction for all Forever Fit exercise and fitness programming.
* Travel to provide fitness programming to multiple sites.
* Lead and participate in wellness presentations or health talks with residents.
* Work closely with in house therapists to understand and accommodate any resident needs related to fitness and exercise. Provide one-on-one sessions and therapy daily.
* Forecast and assess fitness needs and provide the Life Enrichment Manager with a calendar of fitness classes for all areas of the community.
* Work with Resident Care department to communicate any health changes they see in residents during activities. Notify Life Enrichment Managers and Resident Care Managers if there are changes.
* Review resident charts to determine if they are appropriate for exercise.
* Assist residents in getting to any activities going on in the community.
* During downtime, assist Life Enrichment Managers with any other activities.
* Ensure proper upkeep on the fitness center supplies and equipment.
* Build relationships with recreation centers and senior centers to facilitate combined exercises or opportunities to utilize space/equipment we do not have within the community.
* Utilize creativity and problem-solving skills to increase fitness programming participation.
* Assist with all other duties as assigned by the Life Enrichment Manager.

At Waltonwood, we are all a part of a team who are here to serve the residents living in our communities. Our residents count on us every hour of every day. First and foremost, we expect our associates to have regular attendance; defined as being on time and present to all scheduled shifts, for the entire shift. Our associates need to value the importance of timeliness, punctuality, and dependability, and how the lack of these critical elements affects others in the workplace and the overall community operations. We expect all associates to be willing to lend a helping hand to co-workers, direct reports, and supervisors, whether it is one of their typical job responsibilities or not. This includes welcoming new associates and residents into the community, and making them feel at home. Associates need to keep the best interests of the residents and other associates in mind, and be an active participant in accomplishing team, community, and company goals.

Competencies:

* Customer Focused - Dedicated to meeting and exceeding the needs of the customer by establishing and maintaining effective relationships as well as gaining trust and respect of customers.
* Detail Oriented - Pays attention to the smallest details in a situation, and truly cares about them. Understands the importance of all aspects of a given task, no matter how trivial they may seem. Values the importance of gathering all relevant information before making a decision.
* Empathetic and Compassionate - Genuinely cares about people, and is concerned with their well-being. Sympathetic to the plight of those less-fortunate. Has the ability to understand and feel what others are thinking/feeling.
* Passion for Seniors - Feels strongly about working with the senior population. Has a drive to go above and beyond for seniors. Typically, this comes from a personal experience or prior work experience in a senior citizen setting.

Job Requirements:

* Minimum of 1 year of previous experience with teaching exercise classes, preferably to seniors.
* Degree or coursework in exercise science, athletic training, physical therapy and/or a certified trainer is strongly preferred.
* Senior Fitness Instruction Certification a plus.
* Certification in Yoga, Tai chi and Zumba are preferred.
* Previous experience working with seniors is strongly preferred. Previous experience working in memory care preferred.
* Ability to read, write and communicate effectively in English.
* Ability to work independently with a high degree of integrity, honesty and good judgment.
* Exercise patience, respect, understanding and compassion at all times.
* Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and stay organized.
* Ability to motivate individuals to participate in events/activities.

Physical Requirements:

* Constant use of manual dexterity, auditory and visual skills and gross motor skills with frequent use of bi-manual dexterity and fine motor skills.
* Ability to follow written and oral instructions and procedures.
* Ability to reach, bend, twist, squat, kneel, push and pull.
* Ability to lift/carry up to 30 pounds.
* Ability to perform repetitive movements including simple grasping, pushing, pulling and fine manipulation.
* Occasionally sitting, with frequent standing and walking.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Emissions Stack Testing Technician
description:
If you are an independent person that enjoys working in the field with very little direct oversight and highly technical instrumentation this is your opportunity. An Environmental Stack Testing Technician at Slipstream provides excellent customer service in conducting emissions tests on natural gas engines in the oil and gas industry. You will excel in this position if you have the ability to recognize problems, walk through a methodical problem solving process, and have a passion for finishing what you start. You will be using specialized equipment in a mobile laboratory to demonstrate environmental compliance for our clients on natural gas engines in the midstream and upstream oil and gas business.

This position can based out of Carlsbad, MN or other Southeast NM location, requiring daily travel in the area and overnight travel roughly 40% of the year.

We are looking to hire immediately and willing to train. Slipstream has made no layoffs related to Covid-19 or low oil and gas commodity prices.

**Key Accountability:**

* Be Safe
* Conduct daily vehicle inspection
* Perform daily safety assessment
* Properly wear and use all required PPE
* Operate vehicles and equipment in a safe and responsible fashion
* Communicate well
* Professional internal and external communication is a must as you will be a face of Slipstream
* You will be working primarily independently, continuous communication allows for ready support and guidance
* Complete emissions testing on natural gas engines and turbines
* Use specialized laboratory equipment including FTIR Spectroscopy, paramagnetic oxygen analyzers, and portable analyzers to measure exhaust constituents
* Calibrate instrumentation according to ASTM, EPA, State, and manufacturer’s recommendations and requirements
* Support clients with troubleshooting emissions compliance challenges
* Support customers with flexible scheduling and variable work hours
* Process and analyze emissions testing data
* Maintain your laboratory for operation
* Perform periodic maintenance on labs, generators, and computers
* Prepare mobile labs for extended test periods
* Complete expense reporting and time tracking tasks
* Handle various projects and duties, as assigned, to meet business needs

**Job Requirements**

* Accountability to responsibilities
* Possess exceptional accuracy and attention to detail
* Must be punctual and flexible regarding work hours and shifts
* Willing to understand and read ASTM, EPA and State testing methods, requirements, and processes
* Ability to interact effectively with the Team, foster teamwork, and demonstrate professionalism
* Strong work ethic and ability to work with minimal supervision
* Ability to follow schedules and instructions from Managers to work at the necessary pace to complete all daily tasks
* Maintain positive work atmosphere by acting and communicating in a manner to get along with customers, clients, co-workers and management
* Ambition to learn new processes and suggest process improvements
* Understand the importance of safety and adhere to company policies and procedures
* Ability to maintain equipment and keep a clean, safe and orderly workspace
* Willing to travel locally daily and for extended periods of time (at least 15% and up to 40%)

**Qualifications**

* Preferred, 2-5 years of experience stack testing **and/or** natural gas compressor mechanic
* Preferred, Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Sciences
* Working knowledge of air-emission test methods
* Experience with air-emission sampling equipment
* Must have a valid driver’s license acceptable driving record

**Compensation**

* Full Time Work (Overtime is very common)
* Per Diem paid on travel days
* Vehicle and lodging expenses paid for while on the road

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $70,000.00 to $85,000.00 /year

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)

title: Satellite Technician - No experience/Paid Training
description:
At MasTec Advanced Technologies, your smile and customer service are in demand. Here you won’t just provide and install the most advanced home technologies around – everything from satellite dishes to home security and smart home automation – you’ll be the technician customers trust.

Your expertise and knowledge will help guide the customer to select the best technologies to meet their needs and you’ll ensure everything selected is in working order so our customers can use each product right away. At MasTec, your talent and your knowledge will make the difference.

**We are looking for individuals who:**

* Who are focused on customer service and safety
* Who are motivated to continuously learn and master the latest technologies
* Who enjoy multi-tasking and working independently, outdoors and in customer’s homes
* Who can advise and recommend the best solutions and products to meet the customer’s needs

**What we are offering:**

* Competitive wages – **performance-based compensation** and incentives (if you do more, you earn more)
* **Paid training ($18 an hour)** focused on safety, customer service, technology, products, and on-site sales techniques – experience not required!
* High quality tools
* Work van you can drive from home to work and gas card
* Highly independent work environment
* A clear promotion path to Field Technician Supervisor and Site Manager

**Interested? Here’s what we require:**

* Essential function of the job requires you to climb ladders. You must be able to meet manufacturer’s safety requirements on equipment used. Candidate’s body weight + 25 lbs of tools/equipment must not exceed 375 pounds.
* Be able to lift 60-80 pounds and climb 28–36-foot ladders
* Work could be performed in environments that are not heated or air conditioned, and work may be inside or outside, not dependent of weather
* Work could require kneeling, crawling, bending or other positions that may be uncomfortable
* A valid driver’s license
* Be able to work a flexible schedule that includes weekends or evenings
* **Available to start on 7/7**
* Willing to drive to **Evansville IN** for training. **(Hotel and expenses provided if your distance qualifies.)**

**Apply today for a conversation about the position! No harm in learning more.**

**About MasTec Advanced Technologies**

MasTec Advanced Technologies is the leader in last mile fulfillment services for the deployment and installation of technology and devices. We safely deliver, install, and support products and technology our customers want and need from TV, entertainment, and security to connected homes, facility upgrades and smart cities, creating a high-quality customer experience in every interaction. We are the “clean boot, white glove” service provider, with more than 2,000 full-time service professionals and technicians nationwide.

title: Purchasing Manager
description:
NELSON STEEL PRODUCTS, INC., a leader in sheet metal fabrication, has an opportunity available for a Purchasing Manager. We are looking for long-term, dedicated, good people, who are looking for a career with a great company!

**Extra Benefits to working at NSP?**

-Average tenure among all employees is 10 (plus) years!

-Available in-house training!

-Steadily growing company with steady hours.

-Solid, respectful managers.

- Quarterly Bonus Program

-Paid Weekly

-Regular reviews and growth opportunities

**Summary**

Under limited supervision by the President, the Purchasing Manager negotiates, manages and performs all activities regarding the purchase of materials, supplies, equipment and services used by the company. This position ensures that purchased product or material conforms to specified requirements and provide the best possible pricing for quality service.

**Essential Job Functions include, but not limited to, the following:**

* Negotiates best vendor agreements regarding pricing, quality and delivery based on specific budget and schedule requirements.
* Maintain mutually beneficial relationships with current vendors; seek and qualify new vendors to improve network of suppliers, reduce costs and improve or maintain quality.
* Ensure production has necessary raw materials and supplies to meet daily production necessities.
* Work with production and vendors to resolve any needed raw material quality issues.
* Monitor and control inventory turns.
* Works closely with receiving department to ensure proper supplies arrived.
* Create purchase orders for each purchase; enter prices at creation when possible.
* Monitor and control open purchase orders; troubleshoot differences between quoted prices and invoiced prices from vendors.
* Monitor special orders with suppliers; expedite orders as required to meet the needs of production and customers.
* Manage all returns to vendors, ensuring that company procedures are followed, timely return authorizations are received, and all credits are received.
* Report on monthly KPI’s.
* Maintain accurate vendor and purchasing files.
* Identify, manage, and assist in the implementation of improvement projects, which result in efficiency improvements and/or cost savings.
* Communicates effectively to employees, visitors, customers, and other departments.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Required Education and Experience**

1. Associates Degree in business and/or 3 years of related experience.

2. Three years of negotiations experience.

3. Strong verbal and written communication skills, plus analytical, organizational, interpersonal and problem-solving skills.

4. Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.

5. Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

* Day shift

title: Front Desk Supervisor for Physical Therapy
description:
**Job Overview**

We are looking for an experienced Office Manager for the Physical Therapy portion of our Practice. We are committed to providing exceptional patient care and maintaining a welcoming environment for all. As a key member of our team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring smooth operations at the front desk and delivering outstanding customer service to our patients. The ideal candidate should possess strong knowledge of out of network physical therapy benefits. They should have experience verifying insurances, and obtaining authorizations from commercial, workers compensation, and no fault insurances. This is a part time role, with the opportunity for it to blossom into a full time position.

**Responsibilities**

- Greet patients and visitors in a friendly and professional manner

-Manage the day to day physical therapy operations of the business.  
- Answer phone calls in a professional manner, schedule appointments, and manage patient inquiries

Grow your career with us - apply now to be part of our dynamic team.

Here at New Edge Orthopedics/ NEO Physical Therapy and Wellness, we pride ourselves on the vast growth horizon we offer our employees. This role will begin part time, with opportunity to grow into a full time position.

title: Medication Technician
company: Grace Village Assisted Living and Memory Care
description:
**Medication Aide- Assisted Living Facility**

**Job Summary**

**Medication Aide/Technician- Assisted Living**

**Grace Village Assisted Living and Memory Care** is seeking full and part-time medication technicians. Must possess a NC certificate to practice as an Assisted Living Medication Technician and a Personal Care Aide (PCA) or Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA).

**Nature and Scope**

Provide medication assistance for residents in accordance with state regulations and community policy including: pouring, preparing, assisting with administration and documentation as defined through community policies and training.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

**Essential Functions**

* Provide medication assistance for residents in accordance with state regulations and community policy including: pouring, preparing, assisting with administration, and documentation. Observe residents for changes of condition, communicate observations to the supervisor-in-charge or Resident Care Director.
* Assist in maintaining the medication cart and storage room in a neat and orderly manner.
* Accept responsibility for accurate medication counts and for security of the medication cart and medication storage room for assigned shifts.
* May be called upon to assist residents with activities of daily living, including bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, eating, transferring, and mobility as needed.
* Engage residents in meaningful conversation, socialization, and activity while providing personal care and medication assistance.
* Respond to all resident needs and/or requests for care promptly and provide or obtain assistance as necessary.
* Observe residents for changes in physical, emotional, mental or behavioral condition, unusual symptoms, medication side effects, accidents, injuries or unusual occurrence and reports immediately to supervisor.
* Complete all documentation such as medication administration records; incident/change of condition reports, and behavior documentation as requested and in a timely manner.
* Assist in the dining room during resident meal times as needed.
* Seek guidance as needed from supervisor and/or Resident Care Manager.
* Assist with cost control by utilizing resources efficiently and in a waste free manner. Ensure compliance and understanding of all regulations regarding residents’ rights.

**Other**

* Responsible for ensuring that all employees are providing excellent customer service to internal and external customers.
* Perform job duties for residents in a courteous and professional manner.
* Take initiative to ensure resident safety and satisfaction is a priority.
* Meet and greet visitors in a friendly, helpful manner (Visitors include anyone who visits the community; specifically, current residents’ families and friends, prospective residents and their families, referral sources, vendors and regulators).
* Answer phones appropriately, according to company and community standards.
* Communicate professionally and cooperate with supervisor and all community personnel.
* Attend training sessions as directed by supervisor.
* Follow and communicate community policies and procedures.
* The job description provides a framework for the job; other duties may be assigned as necessary.

**Qualifications and Skills**

**Minimum Eligibility Requirements**

* Minimum of one-year previous experience as a caregiver/resident assistant caring for the elderly in an assisted living or long term care setting.
* High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
* Must be 18 years of age or older.
* Successfully complete training as required in accordance with state regulations.
* Possess all required licenses and/or certifications required by State licensing authority.
* Ability to communicate effectively with residents, families, staff, and general public.
* Must have the ability to remain calm under stressful situations.
* Must have compassion for and desire to work with the elderly.
* Must demonstrate the ability to work responsibly as a team member and individual.
* Must be honest, fair and dependable.
* Must respect confidentiality and adhere to the rights and privacy of others in accordance with local, state and federal laws.
* Ability to read, write and speak English.
* Exceptional organizational skills.
* Must meet all health requirements.
* Must pass criminal background check and drug screening.

**Benefits**

Competitive wages and benefits are available.

Job Type: Full-time

An Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace.

**COVID-19 Considerations**:

To keep our care givers as safe as possible, we are following all CDC and NC Infection Control guidelines. Entry screening, monitoring, testing & a full array of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is available for all caregivers.

**Application Questions**

**You have requested that Indeed ask candidates the following questions:**

* How many years of PCA or CNA experience do you have?
* Do you have the following license or certification: NC Assisted Living Medication Tech Certificate?
* Do you speak English?

title: Property Manager
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Property Manager to oversee the daily operations of our residential properties. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring high levels of tenant satisfaction while maintaining property standards and compliance with relevant regulations. This role requires strong leadership, excellent customer service skills, and a thorough understanding of property management practices.

**Duties**

* Manage tenant relations, addressing inquiries and resolving issues promptly to ensure a positive living or working environment.
* Oversee property maintenance, coordinating repairs and improvements while ensuring compliance with safety regulations.
* Prepare and manage contracts, leases, and agreements in accordance with company policies and legal requirements.
* Utilize property management software such as Entrata for data entry, lease tracking, and reporting.
* Ensure compliance with Fair Housing regulations.
* Conduct regular property inspections to assess condition and identify necessary maintenance or upgrades.
* Collaborate with asset teams to promote available units and increase occupancy rates.
* Maintain accurate records of all transactions, tenant communications, and maintenance requests.

**Qualifications**

* Proven experience in property management.
* Strong customer service skills with the ability to communicate effectively with tenants, vendors, and team members.
* Familiarity with contract management and legal aspects of property management.
* Knowledge of Fair Housing regulations
* Experience in Class A wrap style or high rise required.
* Local knowledge and experience in Uptown Dallas.
* Affordable experience preferred but not required.
* Proficiency in property management software such as Entrata is a plus.
* Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail for data entry tasks.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

title: Production Manager
description:
**Role- Production Manager**

**Location- Owensboro, Kentucky**

**GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF POSITION**

This position is responsible for managing the production capabilities of the Company's generating assets, ensuring adequate generating capacity and efficient utilization of the assets and resources necessary to deliver power to Energy Services customers. Promote a safe, accident-free workplace by establishing a culture that recognizes safe practice as the norm and rejects unsafe behaviors.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

1. Plans, directs and controls operating activities so as to provide an accident-free workplace, and to ensure the safety of personnel working at the production facility. This duty is performed daily.

2. Investigates accidents, reviews accident reports and takes corrective action as required. This duty is performed as needed.

3. Directs the operation of the generating assets to meet system demands, environmental requirements and business objectives through the coordination and scheduling of unit outages, load restrictions, personnel scheduling and utilization of resources supplied by other departments and vendors. This duty is performed daily.

4. Ensures the safe and effective operation of equipment and ensures production interruptions are minimized Leads and directs all operational activities in a manner that supports a commitment to customer service. This duty is performed daily.

5. Develops leaders and employees by providing coaching, career counseling and developmental opportunities. This duty is performed daily.

6. Provide vision and serve as a role model for leadership throughout the organization. This duty is performed daily.

7. Demonstrates flexibility and commitment toward rotational assignments. This duty is performed daily.

8. Directs, leads and supports continuous improvement of operating practices and procedures to improve effectiveness and efficiency in the utilization of the generating assets. This duty is performed daily.

9. Assists in directing and controlling the development and implementation of the operational and investment planning process. This duty is performed weekly.

10. Ensures compliance with regulation, reporting requirements and permits at production facilities. This duty is performed daily.

11. Coordinates and reviews the results of testing programs for units, equipment and systems to determine optimal use and cost effective operating practices and procedures.Leads activities that continually improve the competitive position of production assets including cost and quality. This duty is performed daily.

12. Develops and review employee's performance evaluations. This duty is performed annually.

13. Takes an active role in managing and improving employee performance. This duty is performed as needed.

14. Directs the development of procedures and systems which monitor individual performance, establish goals for operating efficiency and effectiveness and manages attainment of these goals. This duty is performed monthly.

15. Ensures uniform application and consistence of Company policies and procedures for production personnel. This duty is performed daily.

16. Establish training objectives for the production personnel and provide opportunities to ensure production personnel are properly trained. This duty is performed monthly.

17. Perform any other related duties as required or assigned

**COMMUNICATION SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty mentioned satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**

High school or GED, plus specialized schooling and/or on the job education in a specific skill area; e.g. data processing, clerical/administrative, equipment operation, etc, plus 9 to 10 years related experience and/or training, and 5 years related management experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

title: Store Manager
description:
**Primary Function:**

Under the general direction of a District Manager, the Store Manager is responsible for the daily operations of the store. The Store Manager will ensure that company directives are implemented to maximize sales, meticulously manage store inventory, and provide the highest level of customer service.

**Principal Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Ensure inventory is properly managed by accurately following receiving procedures, point of sale procedures, and physical inventory count procedures.
* Ensure store compliance with all company policies and directives.
* Maintain sales floor stock levels and cleanliness to company standard.
* Administer performance reviews and participates in performance discussions with employees (where applicable, staffing allocted by location needs).
* Maintains open communication with the District Manager to address any issues requiring upper management intervention. Escalates issues when appropriate.
* May take and respond to emergency calls after hours.
* Must be able to lift loads of 50 lbs. unassisted and heavier loads with assistance
* Other duties as assigned.

**Preferred Education, Experience and Skills:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; college degree preferred but not required
* Must be at least 18 years old.
* Minimum of 3 years retail store management experience.
* Must demonstrate competence in the use of computers and software applications – especially Excel, Google Sheets and email clients.
* Must be skilled in the composition of emails in a professional setting.
* Good interpersonal communication and relationship building skills with internal team members and external customers.
* Ability to adapt to shifting demands and competing priorities.
* Strong problem solving, organizational and decision-making skills with the ability to drive results.
* Ability to train people on process, procedures, compliance and product knowledge.
* Commitment to providing excellent customer service.
* Must pass a post-offer, pre-employment criminal background check.

**Work Environment:**

* Store is open from 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM Monday - Friday (scheduled hours are 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM) and 8:30 AM - 2:00 PM on Saturdays (scheduled Saturday hours are 9:00 AM - 2:30 PM). Saturday hours are only applicable during the academic year when students are on campus, or for any special events that may arise where the school asks us to be open. The store is only open a few Sundays throughout the year for event weekends, such as Graduation Weekend, Family Weekend & Reunion Weekend.
* Labor Day Weekend is a required work weekend, as that is when the students return to campus for fall registration.
* Daily interaction with Supervisor, HLSC Home Office staff, employees, and customers (students of varying grade levels, parents of students, school alumni, and school faculty/staff).
* Stores are located on school campuses.
* May supervise hourly employees, depending on volume of store.
* Work is performed on a sales floor and in a stockroom, with a moderate noise level and regular distractions. Majority of time is spent standing and walking.
* Physical requirements include reaching, grasping, climbing, standing and bending and lifting loads up to 50 lbs unassisted, heavier loads with assistance.
* Some time may be spent in different areas around the campus when needed.
* May have to travel to another store within the company when/if needed for short periods of time, i.e. covering a shift or picking up transferred merchandise.
* *Minimum* of 40 hours per work week, more as required during busier times. *Minimum* of 45 hours required during the weeks surrounding fall school opening (*typically* mid August through early September).
* Able and willing to work extended hours and weekends as required.

**Impact:**

* Through strict attention to detail surrounding inventory control and daily reporting, this position has a direct impact on the financial results of the store and the continuous improvement of store processes and productivity.
* This position impacts our ongoing contractual relationship with the school whose cimmunity we operate within. This is acheived through the execution of superior customer service, maintaining a positive attitude toward all customers and colleagues, and a focus on detail and operational excellence

*Job descriptions are not intended as, nor should they be constructed to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with a job. They are intended to be accurate reflections of those principal job duties & responsibilities essential for making fair pay decisions about the job*
