title: Cable Technician with MasTec – Good Pay, Full Benefits & Career Path
description:
**Now Hiring: Field Technicians | Work Location: Elmira, NY | Paid Training in Amherst, NY**

Are you ready to take control of your future and launch a high-impact career in technology? At MasTec Advanced Technologies, we connect people to what matters — and we’re looking for driven individuals who are ready to make a difference.

Whether you're starting your career or seeking a fresh start, we provide the training, tools, and support to help you succeed. No prior experience required — just a strong work ethic, a willingness to learn, and a commitment to delivering exceptional service.

**Why Build Your Career with MasTec?**

**Competitive Pay with Performance Incentives**  
Start with a reliable base salary, and grow your earnings through bonuses that reward your results and reliability.

**Paid Training — No Experience Needed**  
You'll receive hands-on training in technical skills, safety protocols, and customer service — all while getting paid **$18/hour**, with **all travel and lodging expenses fully covered**.

**All Tools and Equipment Provided**  
We’ll equip you with everything you need, including high-quality tools, a fully stocked company vehicle, and a gas card — all at no cost to you.

**Flexible Scheduling**  
Evening and weekend shifts available to accommodate your lifestyle.

**Clear Career Advancement**  
Grow from technician to team leader — with defined paths to roles like Field Technician Supervisor and Site Manager. Your growth is built into our model.

**What You'll Do**

* Install and maintain satellite and cable systems to ensure strong, reliable performance
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues using advanced tools and techniques
* Deliver professional, customer-focused service during every visit
* Follow all safety standards and company procedures with accuracy and care

**What You’ll Need**

* Ability to lift 60–80 pounds and climb ladders up to 36 feet
* Comfort working outdoors in various weather conditions
* Valid driver’s license and ability to work evenings and weekends
* Willingness to travel to Amherst, NY for paid training (with all expenses covered)

**Your Career Starts Here — and It Starts Strong.**  
At MasTec, this isn’t just another job. It’s the launchpad for a meaningful career in one of the nation’s most essential, fast-moving industries. With top-tier support, structured growth opportunities, and the latest tools in the field, you’ll be set up for long-term success.

**Ready to learn more?**  
Watch our quick video for an inside look at what it’s like to be part of the MasTec team.

title: Transportation and Maintenance Specialist / Truck Driver Class A CDL Required
description:
**About Veruca:**

Veruca is a dynamic and growing mobile grocery delivery service, dedicated to providing fresh, high-quality groceries directly to our customers' doorsteps. Our innovative approach combines convenience with competitive pricing, ensuring that our community has access to the essentials they need—when they need them. Join our team and help revolutionize the grocery delivery industry!

**Position Summary:**

We are seeking a reliable and skilled **Transportation and Maintenance Specialist** to join our team. This essential role supports the operational efficiency and reliability of Veruca's fleet of mobile grocery trailers. You will be responsible for transporting our trailers between locations, assisting with warehouse operations, and performing routine trailer and generator maintenance.

This role **requires a Commercial Class A license**.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Fleet Management:** Perform basic maintenance on trailers, including oil changes, generator servicing, and minor repairs to ensure fleet reliability.
* **Trailer Transportation:** Safely tow 40-foot trailers using a full-size pickup truck between designated locations throughout the day.
* **Warehouse Support:** Assist the Warehouse Manager with restocking, inventory, and general organizational tasks as needed.
* **Logistics & Scheduling:** Ensure trailers are positioned at launch locations at the start of each day and returned to the warehouse at close.
* **Safety Compliance:** Follow safety procedures and maintenance protocols to ensure safe operations.
* **Team Collaboration:** Maintain positive, professional relationships with other team members and contribute to a supportive work culture.

**Work Schedule:**

* **Shift Pattern:** Alternating weekly schedule: 4 days on / 3 days off, followed by 3 days on / 4 days off.
* **Hours:** 12-hour shifts.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum 2 years of experience in vehicle/trailer maintenance, fleet support, or logistics roles.
* Clean driving record.
* Proven ability to drive and tow large trailers.

title: Senior Product Manager - Innovation
description:
**Company Description**

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**

Visa is seeking a Sr. Product Manager for the Innovation team within the Product, Money Movement Solutions team. This role is based in Miami & reports to the Senior Director of Innovation. Work experience with cryptocurrencies and/or foreign exchange is required. The individual plays a crucial role in developing and implementing innovative strategies and processes that drive efficiency and growth, including identifying and prioritizing ideas, discovery, inception, implementation, and product launch.

This role requires strong collaboration with stakeholders from technology, product, operations, legal, and compliance, with key relationships in London and San Francisco.

Ideal candidates have robust product management and technical experience, cross-functional team leadership, and excellent skills in communication, business analysis, problem-solving, coordination, and change management. A customer-first mindset is essential.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Actively research the latest developments, emerging technologies, and trends in the payment industry.
* Identify opportunities and their application within money movement, including crypto, stablecoins, blockchain, digital identity, AI etc.
* Propose innovative ideas aligned with business objectives and demonstrate the ability to defend your decisions with well-reasoned arguments, data analysis, and market research.
* Collaborate with business, product, and technology experts to define requirements, mitigate risks, and create estimates.
* Create detailed briefs and product requirements that clearly articulate the value to the business.
* Manage end-to-end delivery of projects, including technical collaboration, timely and accurate status updates to stakeholders, and proactive identification of potential risks and issues.
* Produce clear findings on experiments and proof of concepts with recommendations for implementation, required considerations, and next steps.
* Build relationships with key stakeholders based in London and San Francisco.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

 **Qualifications**

**Basic Qualifications**

* 8 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor's Degree or at least 5 years of relevant work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters/MBA/JD/MD) or a minimum of 2 years relevant work experience with a PhD

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Work experience across cryptocurrency, blockchain, and stablecoins and/or foreign exchange required
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience working with APIs – the ability to discuss and understand architecture specifications with technical teams.
* Excellent written and verbal communication, with a focus on developing product strategies and articulating progress and recommendations.
* Proven self-starter unafraid to get into the details, and work with ambiguity or frequent change.
* Bridge cross-functional perspectives to drive consensus-based, executable solutions.
* Expert at creating jargon-free explanations/documentation of intricate business and technical solutions.
* Expertise in global product development, end-to-end product lifecycle management, stakeholder relationship management, data analysis and validation, product testing, and developing go-to-market and pricing strategy.
* Strong networking and persuasive presentation skills.

  
**Additional Information**

**Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

**U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 135,200.00 to 196,300.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.**

title: Regional Account Manager
description:
**Company Description**

Clean Earth is a leading provider of environmental services in the United States providing remediation, disposal, recycling, and beneficial reuse solutions for hazardous and non-hazardous waste, contaminated soil, and dredged material. Our vast portfolio of technologies and services touches nearly every industry that generates waste including energy, infrastructure, commercial, industrial, retail, and healthcare markets.

Every day our teams across the country take a hands-on, dedicated approach to recycling and beneficially reusing waste that would otherwise go into landfills. We value our employees as our most important asset, and this is reflected in many areas across our company including recently being named a 2024 Most Loved Workplace ®. We are committed to creating a positive work culture that fosters growth and development while ensuring the health and safety of our employees

 **Job Description**

The Regional Account Manager will be responsible for expanding the Company’s business within pre-assigned territories. This position is accountable for achieving sales goals through the acquisition and development of new customers and expansion of the product line within the existing customer base.

Develop and target regional accounts and prospects in conjunction with the Director of Sales to achieve contract, revenue growth, account milestone objectives, and activity expectations within an assigned account/geography.

Primary Responsibilities (Essential Functions):

* Maintains current customers and acquires new customers by meeting or exceeding goals for territory revenue, growth objectives, account retention and customer service functions via telephone and periodic sales calls and presentations. This interaction includes the entire sales cycle from prospecting, maintenance, proposals, contracts, price increases, cancellations and contract renewals
* Builds relationships with current customers while growing the revenue and profits through service changes and price increases.
* Communicates regulatory compliance issues to customers.
* Implements sales strategies to maximize revenue and profits through maintenance and penetration of existing customers.
* Resolve problems and coordinate customer needs with Field Operations and/or Customer Service group.
* Works as liaison between customers and accounts payable department for collection of receivables when requested.
* Assists with coordination and implementation of Regional and National account sales activities.
* Sell in a highly consultative manner, with ability to articulate the company value-proposition and the benefits of working with Clean Earth brand over other traditional waste services companies and direct competition.
* Creates presentations for key sales customers and prospects.
* Coordinate the development of sales objectives, territory and account selling strategies and ensures their execution.
* Completes territory routing plans, territory forecasts and customer business reviews.
* Develop account specific strategies and plans - and execute against those plans - to win national and regional in the manufacturing and industrial market space.
* Provide management with information used to evaluate regional & national opportunities.
* Promotes customer brand loyalty by participating in or joining regional/national professional organizations that serve the regional marketplace and/or consumers.
* Make daily calls on new prospects within the targeted territory geography, along with identifying leads via a variety of internet websites, networking, key vendors and peers within local and national organizations.
* Monitor and communicate sales performance against goals through approved performance metrics.
* This is a combined hunter and farmer sales position, managing a BOB while driving territory growth through new business prospects.
* Perform other reasonably related tasks as assigned by management

 **Qualifications**

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Sciences, Marketing or Management.

* minimum of 3 years’ experience in outside sales & selling outsourced services to the manufacturing and industrial market or related industries.
* Minimum of 5 Years sales experience manage multiple accounts.

Preferred Qualifications:

* Knowledge of RCRA, DOT, DEA regulatory environment preferred
* Similar background/experience within waste management/environmental services
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint, Salesforce
* Experience in managing a territory while demonstrating a proven track record of sales success achieving or exceeding aggressive growth targets and sales quotas.
* Self-directed with the ability to work on multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines
* Demonstrates established relationships or the ability to rapidly establish relationships within the C-level, Regulatory Affairs, Quality, Procurement, Supply Chain, Operations and Marketing functions within the retail industry
* Demonstrates established relationships or the ability to rapidly establish relationships within the Environmental Health and Safety, Regulatory Affairs, Quality, Procurement, Supply Chain, Operations and Marketing functions within the manufacturing industry.
* Up to 50% travel by car to customers within territory & possible overnight & weekend travel.
* Must own reliable automobile, have valid driver’s license and maintain minimum required automobile insurance coverage.

 **Additional Information**

Clean Earth offers competitive benefits including health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance plans starting on the first day of employment; paid time off, wellness benefits, employee discount program, tuition assistance, and a 401k with company matching.

We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or genetics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

If you have a difficulty applying for any job posted on Harsco Clean Earth’s website because a disability prevents you from using the online system, Clean Earth offers the following alternate application procedure: Call toll free (833) 209-2659 and leave your name, phone number, city and state of residence. Clean Earth will arrange for an alternate method of applying and will consider your application together with all other applications received for the job. *This line is dedicated to disability applications only. No other inquiries will receive a response.*

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**  
The Warehouse & Logistics Operations Manager oversees the efficient and safe functioning of warehouse activities, inventory control, and transportation logistics. This role ensures smooth operations by optimizing workflows, maintaining compliance, and leading a high-performing team to meet business and customer demands.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Supervise daily warehouse operations, including receiving, storage, order fulfillment, and shipping.
* Maintain accurate inventory control, minimizing discrepancies and ensuring timely order processing.
* Implement and enforce safety protocols to uphold a hazard-free workplace and OSHA compliance.
* Identify process improvements to enhance productivity, reduce costs, and streamline logistics.
* Utilize warehouse management systems (WMS) and SAP for inventory tracking and reporting.
* Coordinate with transportation providers to ensure on-time deliveries and resolve shipment issues.
* Manage staffing needs, including hiring, training, scheduling, and performance evaluations.
* Monitor key performance metrics (KPIs) and prepare operational reports for management.
* Collaborate with sales and customer service teams to address logistics-related concerns.

**Qualifications:**

* 2+ years of experience in warehouse management, logistics, or supply chain operations.
* Strong leadership abilities with experience supervising teams in a fast-paced environment.
* Knowledge of inventory management, transportation logistics, and safety regulations.
* Proficiency in SAP, WMS software, and Microsoft Office Suite.
* Analytical mindset with problem-solving and cost-saving initiative.
* Forklift certification and hazardous materials handling knowledge (preferred).

* Monday to Friday

description:

**Job Title:** Project & Client Development Associate  
**Job Type:** Full-time  
**Location:** In office (Amityville, NY)

**Join Our Team:**

Are you a strong communicator with a passion for design, organization, and client service? Neureise Group is looking for a **Project & Client Development Associate** to support our growing team and help deliver exceptional stone and tile projects. In this dynamic role, you’ll play a key part in both project coordination and client engagement by working closely with project managers, clients, and internal teams. If you're detail-oriented, eager to learn, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

**What We Offer:**

* **Competitive Salary:** $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year (dependent upon experience)
* **Exceptional Benefits:** Comprehensive benefits package and support for your professional growth

· **Dynamic Work Environment:** Be part of a leading company in the stone industry with a focus on innovation and quality.

**About Us:** About Us: Neureise Group is a premier stone company based in Long Island, NY, known for our expertise in residential and commercial stonework. Since 2011, we’ve set the standard in craftsmanship, utilizing cutting-edge technology to deliver stunning stone projects. We serve the New York metropolitan and tri-state area with a commitment to excellence and innovation.

**Responsibilities:**

**Project Coordination**

* Assist with planning, scheduling, and executing stone and tile projects.
* Monitor timelines and ensure timely procurement and delivery of materials.
* Support communication between internal teams, clients, and vendors.
* Shadow Project Managers to gain hands-on project management experience.

**Technical Product Knowledge**

* Learn and maintain expertise in natural stone materials and fabrication processes.
* Confidently communicate product features, applications, and benefits to clients.
* Attend industry workshops, trade shows, and training sessions to stay informed.

**Customer Relationship Management**

* Build and maintain strong, long-term client relationships through consistent communication.
* Conduct regular check-ins to ensure satisfaction and identify opportunities for repeat business.
* Serve as a trusted point of contact, ensuring an exceptional client experience.

**Documentation & Reporting**

* Maintain accurate records of project milestones, sales activities, and client interactions.

**Team Collaboration**

* Coordinate with internal fabrication and management teams to align on client expectations.

* Supervise and support Assistant Project Manager

**Additional Duties**

**What We’re Looking For:**

· Bachelor’s degree in Business, Construction Management, Architecture, or a related field preferred.

· 3-5 years of experience in project coordination, sales, or a related role; experience in the construction or architectural surfaces industry is a plus.

· Proven ability to communicate effectively in client-facing and team settings.

· Strong sales aptitude, with the ability to understand client needs and offer appropriate solutions.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); knowledge of On-Screen Takeoff is a plus.

· Experience with estimating, procurement, or construction documentation is a plus

· Exceptional organizational, time management, and multitasking skills.

· Strong attention to detail and ability to follow through on tasks.

· Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.

· Eagerness to learn and grow technical knowledge through ongoing training and industry exposure.

· Comfortable attending client meetings, networking events, and trade shows.

title: Industrial Wastewater Operator
description:
**Industrial Wastewater Operator**
==================================

U.S. Water Services Corporation is a well-established and diverse water and wastewater utility organization specializing in utility maintenance, operations, engineering and construction services. Headquartered in New Port Richey, Florida, U.S. Water is rapidly expanding with a staff of over 700 employees in 19 states. U.S. Water's Industrial Group specializes in providing wastewater facility operations & maintenance services for clients in the industrial and private sector.

**Job Summary**
---------------

**We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Industrial Wastewater Operator. U.S. Water's Industrial Group operates treatment plants for its customers throughout the US. Each customer site is operated by an offsite project manager who works with a dedicated onsite Lead Operator and site operations team. This team is responsible for monitoring processes, adjusting controls, performing laboratory tests, maintaining equipment, replenishing chemicals, and maintaining good housekeeping.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Primary Responsibilities**
----------------------------

* Coordinates the daily operations and maintenance of wastewater treatment facility.
* Manages minor routine maintenance on equipment.
* Demonstrates good interpersonal skills.
* Applies a working knowledge of fundamental principles, terminology, and methodology in carrying out assignments.
* Understands and applies standard policies and procedures within specific discipline.
* Performs assignments with clear, specific objective which may require the limited exercise of judgment and decision-making skills.
* May operate facilities with computer or PLC controls.
* Monitors, regulates and adjusts chlorinators, chemical feed pumps, filter rates and other process equipment.
* Washes clarifiers, filter beds, contact basins, operates sludge handling equipment and other process unit equipment, as required.
* Collects samples and performs routine in-lab tests as required.
* Maintains a log of operations and maintenance activities and related records.
* Operates system to maintain compliance with permit requirements.
* Good knowledge of the practices used and the equipment required in the O&M of industrial facilities and ability to make routine laboratory and field tests for control of plant operations.

NOTE: This Job Description is not inclusive of all job duties.

**Job Requirements**
--------------------

* High school diploma or equivalent and 3+ years of relevant experience
* Valid driver's license
* Experience working in an industrial setting
* Applicable Health & Safety training
* Ability to read plans / drawings / specifications and interpret data
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Examples of Physical Requirements:
  + Lifting: must be able to lift and carry up to 50lbs
  + Standing: Position requires standing for extended periods, with occasional sitting"
  + Reaching/Climbing: Must be able to reach overhead and climb stairs and ladders
  + Environmental Conditions: Must be able to work outdoors in various weather conditions

**Compensation and Benefits**
-----------------------------

Pay is commensurate with experience and reflective of market. U.S. Water offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short/long-term disability, paid time off, holiday pay and 401(k) with company match.

U.S. Water offers competitive wages and benefits and is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.
company_description: U.S. Water Services Corporation is uniquely qualified to handle clients’ most complex water and wastewater needs and tackle their toughest challenges.

title: Health, Safety, & Environment Training Specialist
description:
*Health, Safety, & Environment Training Specialist – Field Safety & Compliance*

*Keystone Clearwater Solutions – Full-Time | Oil & Gas Industry*

**About Us:**  
Keystone Clearwater Solutions is a leading provider of water transfer services in the oil & gas industry. We support field operations across various job sites, offering reliable solutions and a strong commitment to safety, teamwork, and growth.

**The Role:**  
As the Health, Safety & Training Manager, you will lead and support Keystone Clearwater's commitment to Goal Zero—zero incidents, injuries, and environmental harm. This position is responsible for advancing company-wide HSE goals, overseeing environmental compliance programs, and driving the development and implementation of impactful training initiatives across the organization. You will supervise the Director of Health, Safety & Environment and Director of Human Resources to ensure programs are compliant, effective, and aligned with operational needs.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead Keystone’s HSE Management and Compliance Programs across field operations and corporate offices
* Develop, manage, and deliver field and management training programs, including compliance and professional development
* Oversee site-specific QA/QC audits, coach field personnel, and ensure compliance with all applicable regulations and customer requirements
* Support onboarding and initial employee orientation regarding HSE procedures and company policies
* Conduct and analyze training needs assessments based on incident trends, near misses, and observation reports
* Serve as a key resource during incidents, emergencies, or regulatory events, including on-call availability
* Maintain up-to-date documentation and reports for compliance tracking and regulatory requirements
* Monitor and report on key HSE performance metrics (TRER, TRIR, etc.) and correlate data to training effectiveness
* Stay current on industry best practices and emerging safety regulations, ensuring Keystone remains ahead of compliance standards

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Safety, Industrial Hygiene, or related field OR 5+ years of experience in Oil & Gas or a similar industry
* At least one current EHS certification (e.g., CHST, CSP, or equivalent)
* Strong working knowledge of federal and state environmental regulations
* 8-Hour Supervisor Training and SafeLand or OSHA 10 Certification
* Valid driver’s license
* Experience with Learning Management Platforms
* 3+ years of training experience, including designing and delivering corporate training programs

title: QC Technician - Cannabis Production
description:
About Green Dot Labs:

Green Dot Labs is a premier consumer cannabis brand, an industry pioneer, a leader in the Colorado adult-use market, and a soon-to-be leader in Arizona (entering in 2025).

Green Dot Labs was formally established in 2014, but its roots trace back to 2008 when husband and wife founders Dave and Alana Malone began their journey in the state's medical market. Since then, the Green Dot Labs team has tirelessly refined and honed its exceptional, ultra-premium cultivation model – marking its dedication to producing the purest reflections of cannabis’ abundant potential flavors, effects, and wellness benefits.

Green Dot Labs’ tireless work has paid off, earning the brand an obsessive following among the most discerning cannabis consumers. According to BDSA, in 2024 Green Dot Labs was Colorado’s #1 Selling Premium Brand, #1 Selling Independent Flower Brand, #1 Selling Concentrates Brand, #1 Selling Premium Pre-Roll Brand, #1 Selling Live Resin Brand, and the state’s #1 Selling Live Resin Vape Brand as well.

Green Dot Labs will begin offering its enormous, growing, world-class library of 200+ exclusive strains to cannabis lovers in Arizona in 2025.

Summary:

The QC Specialist works to ensure that Green Dot Labs’ (GDL) quality standards are upheld in our connoisseur-grade cannabis production facility as the final touchpoint before it is sent out to customers. The goal of this role is to ensure that quality and compliance are maintained throughout the production lifecycle while keeping an efficient flow of products. The QC Specialist will assist in recording maintenance and data collection, as well as compliance and regulations with inventory systems and with the city of Tempe and state of Arizona.

The position requires a self-motivated individual, strong attention to detail, organizational expertise, and the ability to work well with a team.

Production Responsibilities:

* Ensure all grammed product meets GDL quality and compliance standards including but not limited to labels, boxes and product specifications
* Review all compliance labels and ensure they meet regulatory requirements
* Maintain understanding of all current quality standards for all products and finishes
* Discern variation in product from standard and work with manager to determine cause
* Help create solutions to patterns in product variation with manger and team leads
* Communicate updates to process and quality requirements to team members
* Help team members refine skills and understanding of how to meet quality standards
* Develop, oversee and maintain packaging work orders
* Report on performance metrics weekly
* Maintain and upkeep of packaging equipment
* Other tasks assigned by management

Compliance & Record Keeping Tasks:

title: Medical Assistant
company: Community Health Center of Cowley County, Inc.
description:
**MEDICAL ASSISTANT**

**POSITION SUMMARY**

Under the supervision of the Reception Manager, the Medical Assistant performs duties in various programs of the Community Health Center. The Medical Assistant will perform routine clerical tasks and follow prescribed clinical procedures. The work experience is of an independent complex nature. Duties involve careful analysis and interpretation of data for the purpose of planning, developing and problem solving. Decision making is controlled by established guidelines set forth by the Medical Director and Chief Executive Officer. The employee in this position is responsible for and held accountable for maintaining patient/client confidentiality.

**PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITES**

*Achieve Results*

* Ensure the safe, productive, and efficient operation of the clinic assigned through timely and attentive administrative and clinical support (as authorized or licensed).
* Ensure all patients enjoy a positive experience, treated with the care and compassion expected.
* Ensure all patient records and related documents are managed and maintained timely, accurately, and consistent with all HIPAA and related regulations and requirements.

*Operational Excellence*

* Ensure all tasks provided and associated with patient care, patient administrative processes, and related duties complies with all regulatory and accreditation standards, as well as clinic policies and procedures.

*Relationships*

* Develop favorable relationships with all patients. Instruct patients and their family members training and /or information related to in-home care as appropriate.
* Establish favorable working relationships with all staff members associated with center operations, including administration, nurses, physicians and related staff.

*Stewardship and Professionalism*

* Uphold and consistently represent the values and mission of the organization at all times. Represent the organization in a highly professional manner at all times.
* Ensure compliance and attention to all corporate policies and procedures.

**PRIMARY TASKS AND DUTIES**

* Prepares patient’s chart prior to clinical exam.
* Prepares patient for clinical exam/visit, including the collection of typical patient vital metrics (blood pressure, temperature, height, weight etc.).
* Assists provider with clinical visit.
* Follows through with post-visit duties.
* Assists with office duties as assigned.
* Provides service in a manner that is appropriate for the patient’s age; demonstrates knowledge and skills necessary to meet the patient’s physical, psychosocial, educational and safety needs.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

· Read, write, and maintain patient records and related administrative documentation

· Knowledge and ability to use requisite tools, systems, technology and equipment in the collection of patient data

· Utilize computers in the collection, management, and reporting of patient records

· Ability to work with a diverse, sometimes difficult and demanding patient population

**POSITION REQUIRMENTS**

*Education*

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Successful completion of a medical terminology course preferred.
* Certification in office practice or enrollment in such a program is desired.

*Experience*

* Demonstrated success with clear thinking and ability to reorganize as needed.
* Demonstrated success in working independently, prioritization and problem solving.
* Demonstrated success in organization abilities.
* Demonstrated success in computer skills including ability to use computer for scheduling, word documents and reasonable keyboard skills.
* Demonstrated success in customer service/patient services or working with the general public, preferably in a medical care facility.
* Demonstrated success in managing difficult customer situations
* Significant knowledge of medical practices and procedures in a primary care environment.
* Demonstrated success and experience with direct patient services (e.g. phlebotomy) and the proper knowledge and use of medical devices and equipment.
* Bilingual in English and Spanish preferred.

*Working Conditions*

* Normal hospital working environment. Requires good verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to speak and read the English language.
* Ability to move freely (standing, stooping, walking, bending, pushing and pulling) and lift up to a maximum of fifty (50) pounds without assistance.
* Work is primarily facility based in an outpatient behavioral health setting and/or correctional facility.
* Some work may occur in a community setting and may include contacts in a high crime area and in extremes of temperature.

*Blood Borne Pathogen Exposure*

* Category I: Job classification includes ALL employees who have occupational exposure\\* to blood borne pathogens\\* (blood or body fluids) while performing their job duties.
* Category II: Job classification includes employees who are likely to have SOME occupational exposure to blood borne pathogens because Category I tasks may occasionally be required.
* Category III: Job Classification includes those employees who perform jobs and tasks where NO CONTACT with blood borne pathogens occurs and Category I and Category II tasks ARE NOT a condition of employment.

**SPECIFIC TO THIS POSITION**

* Clerical staff in this job description have shown competency in their duties and are able to perform independently with minimum supervision.
* Possesses a thorough knowledge of all Health Center procedures and policies and are capable of performing all functions accurately.
* Assists and ensures balances of money receipts at end of each working day and transfers to Reception Manager.
* Maintains Electronic Health Record computer program.
* Provides assistance to Chief Medical Officer, Administrative Support Coordinator and Chief Financial Officer.
* Assists the Quality Assurance Team by preforming duties in various improvement programs including participation in quality assurance and improvement program, and patient centered medical home transformation.
* Prepare, review, and coordinate information for charts. Check records and schedules for accuracy. See that deadlines are met.
* Assists with clerical and medical duties for various clinics, as assigned.

**ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS**

**ACCOUNTABILITY:**

Employee is not responsible for budgetary control of the agency and does not participate in the budget process. Employee is responsible for reading, knowing, and following policies, procedures, and protocols for the Health Center. The employee is responsible for reading, knowing, and following guidelines in manuals dealing with specific programs, as assigned. The employee in this position is forbidden to offer ANY medical advice to the general public while acting as or perceived as an agent of the Health Center.

**Private Health Information:**

Protected Health Information or PHI means any information (including demographic information collected from an individual), whether oral or recorded in any form or medium. This position requires regular access to protected health information. The Medical Assistant position requires some limited access to PHI that is necessary to carry out vital job functions as outlined in this description. The Medical Assistant is obligated to divulge the minimum necessary PHI to carry out essential functions of the position. This position requires the employee to sign a confidentiality agreement as all programs under the Health Center are required to be HIPAA compliant.

**PERSONAL RELATIONS:**

Continual contact with other community agencies, state health department staff, local medical professionals, and the general public. Must be able to establish and maintain effective working relationships with fellow employees.

**OTHER REQUIREMENTS:**

Valid Kansas drivers license, use of personal automobile and certificate of liability insurance from automobile insurer.

title: Quality Manager
description:
**Org Marketing Statement**

**Position Summary:**

Provide leadership and management for the quality function and sustain the quality philosophy and lean culture for the division at the plant level. Establish, maintain and optimize an effective quality management system. Implement the division’s quality plan at the plant level to achieve the divisions overall quality objectives. Enhance and improve the Division’s products and services through the implementation of ISO 9001, problem-solving tools, prevention methods, quality-at-the-source and continual improvement techniques.

**Responsibilities:**

* Communicates customer, regulatory and organizational requirements to assure product quality, contract compliance and customer satisfaction.
* Oversees the effective documentation and implementation of the quality management system to assure compliance with customer and regulatory requirements and the standards set by corporate/division policies.
* Works with the leadership team to ensure that individuals performing functions affecting quality are trained and demonstrate the appropriate skills and performance results.
* Coordinates necessary plant personnel for internal, customer and third party quality system audits.
* Maintains a corrective action system to analyze and correct nonconforming conditions and complaints.
* Implements the performance measurements necessary to effectively evaluate organizational performance and trends in product quality, services, customer satisfaction and the cost of poor quality. Uses the results of performance evaluation to target improvement efforts.
* Assess supplier capabilities and monitor sup.

**Qualifications:**

* B.S. Degree in an Engineering or related discipline.
* 3-5 years of Quality, Engineering or related experience.
* Knowledge of International Standard ISO 9001 Quality Management Systems (QS-9000 as applicable for automotive sector).
* Certification by the American Society for Quality (ASQ) as a Certified Quality Engineer (CQE), Certified Six Sigma Black Belt (CSSBB), or Certified Quality Manager (CQMgr) is preferred.
* Knowledge of manufacturing and quality practices.
* Experience with quality improvement tools and techniques (i.e., Lean, Six Sigma, Statistical Process Control, and Failure Mode & Effects Analysis).
* Demonstrated leadership, project management, facilitation and problem-solving skills.
* Must demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills.

**Conditions of Employment:**

This role is subject to compliance with the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and the Export Administration Regulations (EAR), which requires the incumbent to be either a US citizen, lawful permanent resident [“green card” holders], or have refugee or asylee status).

Parker Hannifin is a Fortune 250 global leader in motion and control technologies. For more than a century the company has been enabling engineering breakthroughs that lead to a better tomorrow. Learn more at www.parker.com or @parkerhannifin.

title: Health, Safety, & Environment Training Specialist
description:
*Health, Safety, & Environment Training Specialist – Field Safety & Compliance*

*Keystone Clearwater Solutions – Full-Time | Oil & Gas Industry*

**About Us:**  
Keystone Clearwater Solutions is a leading provider of water transfer services in the oil & gas industry. We support field operations across various job sites, offering reliable solutions and a strong commitment to safety, teamwork, and growth.

**The Role:**  
As the Health, Safety & Training Manager, you will lead and support Keystone Clearwater's commitment to Goal Zero—zero incidents, injuries, and environmental harm. This position is responsible for advancing company-wide HSE goals, overseeing environmental compliance programs, and driving the development and implementation of impactful training initiatives across the organization. You will supervise the Director of Health, Safety & Environment and Director of Human Resources to ensure programs are compliant, effective, and aligned with operational needs.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead Keystone’s HSE Management and Compliance Programs across field operations and corporate offices
* Develop, manage, and deliver field and management training programs, including compliance and professional development
* Oversee site-specific QA/QC audits, coach field personnel, and ensure compliance with all applicable regulations and customer requirements
* Support onboarding and initial employee orientation regarding HSE procedures and company policies
* Conduct and analyze training needs assessments based on incident trends, near misses, and observation reports
* Serve as a key resource during incidents, emergencies, or regulatory events, including on-call availability
* Maintain up-to-date documentation and reports for compliance tracking and regulatory requirements
* Monitor and report on key HSE performance metrics (TRER, TRIR, etc.) and correlate data to training effectiveness
* Stay current on industry best practices and emerging safety regulations, ensuring Keystone remains ahead of compliance standards

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Safety, Industrial Hygiene, or related field OR 5+ years of experience in Oil & Gas or a similar industry
* At least one current EHS certification (e.g., CHST, CSP, or equivalent)
* Strong working knowledge of federal and state environmental regulations
* 8-Hour Supervisor Training and SafeLand or OSHA 10 Certification
* Valid driver’s license
* Experience with Learning Management Platforms
* 3+ years of training experience, including designing and delivering corporate training programs

**Perks & Benefits:**

* Medical / Dental / Vision coverage
* Health savings account (HSA)
* Company Paid Life Insurance and Accidental & Dismemberment Insurance
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* 401k with a company match
* Paid Time Off
* Employee Assistance Program
* Professional Development Programs
* Employee Referral Programs

**Schedule:**  
Full-Time | Office-Based & Field Support | Travel Required

Work includes indoor office settings and outdoor job sites with varying weather conditions and noise levels. Occasional lifting, climbing, and extended periods of standing or walking may be required.

title: Superintendent - Commercial Construction
description:
Plan better. Build smarter.

McCrory Construction is the oldest general contractor in the state of South Carolina. Since 1918, we have built more than 3,000 projects across all markets throughout the Southeastern United States. What's even more telling? More than 90% of our work, annually, is with clients for whom we've previously completed projects.

**Position Overview:**

This role is within our commercial retail remodel program. The Superintendent coordinates and supervises all site construction operational activities (including field and subcontractor personnel) to successfully complete projects of high quality in a timely and efficient manner. Discusses and incorporates any change directives to original plans and specifications to meet or exceed client satisfaction. Maintains the safety and security of the job site office and closes out quality construction projects. Reports to Vice President of Field Operations.

**Essential Job Functions and Expectations:**

* Establishes staging plans and manages site logistics and workflow.
* Reviews subcontractor scopes of work, submittals and invoices and provides feedback to Project Manager for compliance and coordination.
* Assists Project Manager in job cost reporting and budget control.
* Collaborates with Project Manager in maintaining and updating construction schedules to identify and solve problems in pre-construction meetings prior to mobilization.
* Prepares daily reports, safety reports, schedules and supervises completion of final punch lists.
* Orders materials and schedules inspections as required or needed.
* Assists with recruiting and hiring needs. Trains field crew members, project engineers and junior superintendents and conducts safety orientations.
* Promotes job site safety and ensures employees and contractors are adhering to the company safety policy and regulatory requirements. Rectifies any job site hazards immediately.
* Conducts weekly safety and progress meetings.
* Maintains a clean, organized job site at all times including the construction office.
* Performs other job duties as assigned and/or required.

**Qualifications and Requirements:**

* 7+ years’ experience as a Superintendent with commercial retail remodel experience is a plus.
* Knowledge and experience in field supervision, quality control, scheduling, ordering, safety and production throughout all phases of the construction process is required.
* OSHA 3O - Hour Construction Training preferred or ability to obtain upon hire.
* Experience with Procore preferred.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint).
* Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal communication, problem-solving, organizational, analytical, and basic mathematical skills.
* Must be a self-driven team player and able to multi-task and switch gears in a fast-paced environment while maintaining and fostering a positive attitude with others.
* Maintains a positive relationship with customers, contractors, suppliers and other employees.
* Valid Driver’s License with reliable transportation and **willingness to travel**.
* Job site locations vary between South Carolina, North Carolina, Georgia, and East Tennessee.
* Willing to work night shift if necessary.

Must be able to lift, reach, bend, exert force, or move objects weighing up to 50 pounds. May require sitting, standing, or walking for an extended period of time indoors and/or outdoors. Operates standing office equipment, such as computer, printer, copier, etc. as well as tools and equipment on construction job sites.

title: Maintenance Mechanic
description:
National Gypsum Company, headquartered in Charlotte, NC, is the exclusive service provider of reliable, high-performance building products marketed under the Gold Bond®, ProForm® and PermaBASE® brands. The National Gypsum name – through its Gold Bond®, ProForm® and PermaBASE® product lines – has been synonymous with high-quality, innovative products, and exceptional customer service since 1925.

For decades, we have saved our customers time and money by providing the industry’s best, most reliable building products, resources and services. We are Building Products for a Better Future® one project at a time.

National Gypsum Company operates as a family of companies working together toward a common goal with collaboration and open communication. Our corporate entities include: NG Corporate, LLC; National Gypsum Services Company; Gold Bond Building Products, LLC; Gold Bond Canada, LLC; ProForm Finishing Products, LLC; PermaBASE Building Products, LLC; and Unifix Inc.

***Gold Bond*** has an immediate opening for a **Maintenance Mechanic** at our **Burlington N.J.** plant location. This position will report to the ***Maintenance Manager***

**Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled and dedicated Maintenance Mechanic to join our team in a fast-paced manufacturing facility. The ideal candidate will possess strong mechanical knowledge and experience in maintaining industrial equipment. Install, maintain and repair all plant mechanical, pneumatic, hydraulic and other systems relating to the manufacturing process. Machine parts for use in plant operations. Maintain lubrication requirements on all plant machinery and equipment. This role is essential for ensuring the smooth operation of our machinery and systems, contributing to overall productivity and efficiency.

**Duties**

* Install, maintain and repair all mechanical, mechanical equipment, read blueprints, and troubleshoot equipment and systems.
* Monitor and maintain mechanical equipment to ensure efficient operations.
* Setup and operate machine tool equipment, machine parts from blueprints, sketches and broken parts.
* Ability to use delicate measuring instruments (calipers, micrometers, etc.).
* Have knowledge of metals and plastics for machining process.
* Maintain schedule for oiling and greasing of all plant machinery and equipment.
* Visually inspect and listen to production equipment and advise supervision of any abnormalities.

**Requirements**

* Troubleshoot and repair all plant mechanical equipment.
* Ability to read and interpret diagrams and blueprints.
* Ability to diagnose equipment malfunctions and recommend appropriate course action. Use calipers and other measuring devices.
* Ability to fabricate, repair and /or assemble from simple or complex drawings.
* Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs.
* Ability to operate a lift truck.
* Work in elevated location, awkward or confined position, climb stairs and ladders, and move heavy objects weighing up to 50 lbs.,
* Ability to communicate effectively in English, both verbally and in writing.
* Previous experience working in a manufacturing facility is preferred.
* A commitment to safety practices and maintaining a safe work environment.

Join our team as a Maintenance Mechanic and contribute your expertise to ensure our operations run smoothly!

No phone calls or third-party recruiters, please

Employment ready applicants only

title: Senior Engineering Director
description:
Imagine working at **Intellibus** to engineer platforms that impact billions of lives around the world. With your passion and focus we will accomplish great things together!

We are looking forward to you joining our Platform Engineering Team.

Our Platform Engineering Team is working to solve the Multiplicity Problem. We are trusted by some of the most reputable and established FinTech Firms. Recently, our team has spearheaded the Conversion & Go Live of apps which support the backbone of the Financial Trading Industry.

**We are looking for Architects who can**

* Assess customer business and technical requirements, define scope and provide estimates for solutions across numerous verticals and industries.
* Provide technical expertise in Solution Architecture, Development and Technical Design decisions.
* Validate proposed project scoping with internal stakeholders including project managers, technical leads, designers, strategists and project teams.
* Able to communicate architectural decisions to a varied audience including business and technology stakeholders from the conceptual to the physical perspectives.
* Able to recognize and balance functional and nonfunctional requirements to ensure the optimal solution for the end customer.
* Evaluate and recommend Tools, Technologies, and Processes to ensure the highest quality product platform.
* Work on the architecture, design, development, deployment and support of software projects using Java, AWS.
* Work on AWS cloud platforms including automated provisioning and management of services.
* Work on containers and a container orchestration platform, preferably Kubernetes.
* Work on ORM specifications - Spring Data, JPA, Hibernate.
* Absorb and incorporate new technologies/frameworks quickly.
* Collaborate with peer organisations, quality assurance and end users to produce cutting-edge software solutions.
* Troubleshoot code level problems quickly and efficiently.
* Be team first mentality.
* Be adaptable to changing project and technology requirements while being hands-on with project teams.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to development teams, fostering innovation and excellence.
* Actively contribute to coding, particularly in Java-based backend systems, ensuring the architecture and solutions are scalable and secure.
* Lead end-to-end project delivery, from ideation through implementation, across multiple client engagements.
* Proven track record of leading technical teams in fast-paced, high-pressure environments.
* Ability to think critically and solve complex technical problems on the fly.

**Qualification**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field is preferred. Relevant work experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
* Proven expertise in leading end-to-end delivery of mission-critical systems under tight deadlines
* Previous experience of leading a group of 300+ Engineer’s or more
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* 10+ years of experience in software development, with at least 8 years in a leadership role within fintech or consulting.

**We work closely with**

* Java 8
* REST-based Microservices
* JPA,Hibernate
* Relational Databases
* SVG Libraries
* Java AWT API
* Apache XmpBox
* Pdf box
* Apache batiK
* SVN, GIT
* AWS
* Kafka
* Linux / Unix

**Our Process**

* Schedule a 15 min Video Call with someone from our Team
* 4 Proctored GQ Tests (< 2 hours)
* 30-45 min Final Video Interview
* Receive Job Offer

If you are interested in reaching out to us, please apply and our team will contact you by the end of the day.

title: Service Manager
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Service Manager to lead our Trailer service department. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in Trailer repair and service management, with a focus on delivering exceptional customer service and ensuring the efficiency of operations. This role requires a hands-on approach to managing the team, overseeing service writing, and maintaining high standards of quality in all service offerings.

**Duties**

* Oversee daily operations of the service department, ensuring timely and efficient service delivery.
* Manage and mentor a team of technicians, providing guidance on Trailer diagnostics, brake repair, Wreck repair, and tire service.
* Ensure accurate service writing and documentation for all repairs and maintenance performed.
* Align departmental goals with company objectives to enhance customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.
* Conduct regular training sessions for staff on best practices in Trailer repair and customer service.
* Monitor inventory levels of parts and supplies necessary for Trailer repairs.
* Address customer inquiries and concerns promptly to maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.
* Implement safety protocols to ensure a safe working environment for all employees.

**Experience**

* Proven experience in Trailer service management or a similar role within the Trailer industry.
* Strong knowledge of Trailer repair processes including air brake systems, tire services, and Electrical repairs.
* Proficiency in trailer diagnostics with the ability to transmit information effectively to both customers and team members.
* Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer interaction and team collaboration.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently while maintaining attention to detail.

Join our team as a Service Manager where you can make an impact by leading our skilled technicians in providing top-notch trailer services while fostering an environment of growth and excellence.

title: Service Advisor Lindon Hyundai
description:
**Full Job Description:**

**Come work with a great team and a high paced customer service environment!**

**This position has 2 shifts available working:**

**Monday-Wednesday 7am-9pm or Thursday-Saturday 7am-9pm**

**Competitive pay and a collaborative environment in a family-owned business. Come join our team!**

**Our goal with this position is to develop your abilities into future advancements and opportunities.**

**Applicants should be experienced writer repair orders and mediating conversations with customers and technicians working on vehicles.**

**This position is commission based with a minimum guarantee!**

**Benefits:**

* 401(k) match
* Paid time off
* Trip to Mexico for 2 (Top performers)
* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Life Insurance
* Disability Insurance
* Paid training
* Employee discounts on vehicles, parts, and service

**Company Description**

The Murdock Auto Team is a family-owned business operating in Northern Utah from Lindon to Logan.When you work for the Murdock Team, you are joining a family.Our mission for every guest/employee: "When you walk through our doors you feel like family."

Our family culture is based on four core values: Integrity, Accountability, Charity, and Growth.

Our ownership is involved in our day to day operations. The Murdock culture and is the #1 reason our employees love their job. Our successes come from honesty and consistency of character.

"We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give!" -Winston Churchill

Growth and Accountability are two of our core values that will get you where you want to go. Our goal is to help develop and advance each employee. We do this with proper training and providing the tools necessary to grow. Each employee has an accountability coach. We believe in taking responsibility for our actions and helping develop your abilities through dedication and hard work.

**Tasks:**

* Communicates with Guests timely and enthusiastically to meet and exceed their needs for the service of their vehicle: engaging all guests in the service area and throughout the store; maintaining rapport with previous guests; all guest concerns and vehicle symptoms as defined by the guest; greets drop-ins guest; responds efficiently to inquiries.
* Obtains vehicle information and consults guests on automobile manufacturer guidelines for service intervals and specifications; studies service recommendations by make, previous service, and mileage charts; compares current vehicle conditions by inspecting automobiles, and explaining service trends.
* Represents industry standards and recommended maintenance schedules for the brand entering the store for service; warranty inclusions and exclusions, and consults each guest for the best possible guest decision for the long-term reliability of the vehicle.
* Closes sales for service promotions by overcoming concerns; mediating with service technicians; explaining options; explaining future services, and delivering clean automobile back to the guest.
* Monitor vehicle progress and provide service management updates by interacting with guests, completing reports, and updating computer system frequently.
* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, book reading, and professional publications.
* Enhances Murdock Auto Team's reputation by accepting ownership for completing guest requests, verifying service match invoices, explains all work completion and charges to the guest, addresses customer feedback, and additional job duties as assigned by the service manager and other leadership.

**Skills:**

Guest Experience Management, Computer Skills, Teamwork, People Skills, Problem Solve and Solution Management, .

**Experience And Education:**

High School diploma or GED. Ability to read and comprehend automobile characteristics and technical features. Basic understanding of service programs for automobiles with proven background customer service and people skills. Excellent communication and time management skills. Must be able to work as a team member in a fast-paced environment. Must minimum of 18 years old and authorized to work in the United States.

**Physical Requirements:**

Ability to walk; sit; use hands, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. Need ability to move around the dealership. The employee may be required to lift up to 25 pounds. Work is performed at a desk in an office setting and walking throughout the dealership lot.

title: Deputy Clerk-Town of Buxton
description:
**Job Overview**  
The Deputy Clerk provides back-up support for the Town Clerk, Tax Collector, Motor Vehicle Agent, Inland Fisheries and Wildlife Agent and Registrar of Voters. The Deputy Clerk is responsible for assisting with issuing marriage, birth, and death certificates, marriage licenses, dog licenses, absentee ballots, game licenses and recreational vehicle registrations. The Deputy Clerk is also responsible for assisting with the collection of taxes, preparation and execution of motor vehicle registrations, transfers, and other transactions required by state law for motor vehicles and trailers. **This position requires public contact, the handling of money, a high level of professionalism, a positive image and the ability to handle a multitude of tasks to ensure the public is served efficiently and effectively.**

**Duties**

* Assist the Town’s Agent to the Commissioner of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife by issuing hunting and fishing licenses. Acts as backup to the Motor Vehicle & Inland Fisheries and Wildlife Agent with weekly and monthly reports.
* Prepares and issues marriage licenses and birth, marriage and death certificates.
* Issues absentee ballots, registers voters and aids with other election and voter registration duties.
* Issues dog licenses and aids with overdue notices.
* Collects excise, State sales tax and registration fees as appropriate for motor vehicles, trailers, motor homes, snowmobiles, boats, ATVs and motorcycles.
* Collects revenue from real estate tax and personal property tax and transmits to the Business Office Manager according to the Internal Control Document and the Maine Municipal Association (MMA) Tax Collector’s Handbook.
* Being a Maine Notary and performing Notary services.
* Other Duties as requested

**Qualifications**

* Previous experience in municipality and as a notary is preferred.
* Customer service and telephone experience
* Strong data entry skills with a high level of accuracy.
* Proficient in word processing software and other office applications.
* Excellent clerical skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to handle cash transactions responsibly.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Ability to handle sensitive issues involving the public with tact.
* Familiarity with Municipal and State systems such as TRIO WEB, MOSES, DAVE and CVR is a plus.

This position requires a proactive individual who can work independently as well as part of a team. If you are dedicated to providing exceptional support within an office, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding opportunity.

The Town of Buxton is an equal opportunity Employer

Pay: $22.50 - $24.50 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: QC Technician - Cannabis Production
description:
About Green Dot Labs:

Green Dot Labs is a premier consumer cannabis brand, an industry pioneer, a leader in the Colorado adult-use market, and a soon-to-be leader in Arizona (entering in 2025).

Green Dot Labs was formally established in 2014, but its roots trace back to 2008 when husband and wife founders Dave and Alana Malone began their journey in the state's medical market. Since then, the Green Dot Labs team has tirelessly refined and honed its exceptional, ultra-premium cultivation model – marking its dedication to producing the purest reflections of cannabis’ abundant potential flavors, effects, and wellness benefits.

Green Dot Labs’ tireless work has paid off, earning the brand an obsessive following among the most discerning cannabis consumers. According to BDSA, in 2024 Green Dot Labs was Colorado’s #1 Selling Premium Brand, 1 Selling Independent Flower Brand, #1 Selling Concentrates Brand, #1 Selling Premium Pre-Roll Brand, #1 Selling Live Resin Brand, and the state’s #1 Selling Live Resin Vape Brand as well.

Green Dot Labs will begin offering its enormous, growing, world-class library of 200+ exclusive strains to cannabis lovers in Arizona in the first half of 2025.

Summary:

The QC Specialist works to ensure that Green Dot Labs’ (GDL) quality standards are upheld in our connoisseur-grade cannabis production facility as the final touch-point before it is sent out to customers. The goal of this role is to oversee that quality and compliance are maintained throughout the production lifecycle while keeping an efficient flow of product. The QC Specialist will assist in recording maintenance and data collection, as well as compliance and regulations with inventory systems and with the city of Tempe and state of Arizona.

The position requires a self-motivated individual, strong attention to detail, organizational expertise, and the ability to work well with a team.

Production Responsibilities:

* Ensure all grammed product meets GDL quality and compliance standards including but not limited to labels, boxes and product specifications
* Review all compliance labels and ensure they meet regulatory requirements
* Maintain understanding of all current quality standards for all products and finishes
* Discern variation in product from standard and work with manager to determine cause
* Help create solutions to patterns in product variation with manger and team leads
* Communicate updates to process and quality requirements to team members
* Help team members refine skills and understanding of how to meet quality standards
* Develop, oversee and maintain packaging work orders
* Report on performance metrics weekly
* Maintain and upkeep of packaging equipment
* Other tasks assigned by management

Compliance & Record Keeping Tasks:

* Maintain detailed knowledge of all GDL policies, procedures, SOPs and quality standards pertaining to packaging, QC, order fulfillment and inventory
* Maintain confident comprehension and ensure compliance with MED regulations as they apply to cannabis production and delivery, including but not limited to:
* M/R 100 – General Applicability
* M/R 200 – Licensing and Interests
* M/R 300 – Licensing Premises
* M/R 600 – Medical and Retail Marijuana Infused Production Manufacturing Facilities: License Privilege
* M/R 700 – Medical and Retail Marijuana Testing Facilities (M/R 712)
* M/R 800 – Transport and Storage
* M/R 900 – Business Records
* M/R 1000 – Labeling, Packaging and Product Safety

Specifications of the Position:

* 40-hour workweek with possibility for overtime
* Working hours will be spent in the lab
* Moderate physical activity such as walking and lifting is required on a daily basis
* Able to lift at least 20 pounds, able to stand for long periods of time, able to bend, push, pull and reach
* Provided PPE must be worn when applicable

Required Personal Characteristics:

* Able to work in a fast-paced work environment under deadlines
* Continually exhibit honesty and integrity
* Punctual and reliable
* Communicate effectively and efficiently
* Hold self and others accountable
* Driven to excel and seek constant improvement

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

* Possess physical dexterity necessary to work with small and delicate products
* Work efficiently, manages time effectively
* Pay close attention to detail
* Able to identify problems or malfunctions with equipment
* Exhibit ability to work cautiously but efficiently

Education, Experience, & Misc Requirements:

* 1+ years experience with gramming and/or packing in cannabis production
* 2+ year experience in licensed cannabis facility desirable
* Must have and maintain MED Badge
* Must have reliable form of transportation

Green Dot Labs and all its affiliated companies provide equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Further, the company takes affirmative action to ensure that applicants are hired and employees are treated during employment without regard to any of these characteristics. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $21.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you have or can you obtain a M.E.D. Badge prior to starting work?

Ability to Commute:

* Boulder, CO 80301 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: ReStore Assistant Manager - Trinity Habitat for Humanity (Arlington)
description:
The ReStore is a retail store that sells donated building materials, furniture, and appliances, as an ongoing fundraising leg of Trinity Habitat for Humanity. We are seeking an Assistant Manager for our Arlington ReStore location to help with store management and operations. In addition to an available bonus, Trinity Habitat offers a generous PTO plan, paid holidays, and available medical, dental, life insurance, and 401(k).

**Job Description**

**ReStore Assistant Manager**

**General Description:**

Under the direction of the ReStore Manager, the ReStore Assistant Manager is an agency *Innovator*. Broadly speaking he or she has responsibility for many of the day-to-day operations at the ReStore. This includes retail sales, assisting customers and donors, pricing and stocking inventory, and making sure the store is clean, safe and well merchandised. The Assistant Manager is also responsible for directing volunteers, community service workers and subordinate staff at the store., as well as performing open/close duties at the store.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities…**

He or she must:

* Have retail experience
* Be willing to cover, assist, or fill-in at other nearby locations as needed
* Be willing to work closing shift of 10:00am-6:00pm
* Have a general knowledge of building materials
* Be able to lift 75 lbs. without issue
* Possess ability to work under pressure on multiple projects simultaneously
* Be willing and able to provide excellent customer service to customers and donors
* **Job Conditions…**

Position is full-time (40 hours a week). Evening and weekend work is required. It is an exempt position. Conditions and benefits are contained in the board approved Employee Handbook.

**Priorities…**

Trinity Habitat expects you to succeed in your actions and outcomes according to…

* Core Values
* Operations Manual
* Employee Handbook
* Job Description
* Strategic Plan
* Job Goals
* **Specific Responsibilities:**
* **Provide clear direction and boundaries to staff, volunteers and community service workers**
* **Assist ReStore Manager with daily paperwork, reports and bank deposits as required**
* Provide outstanding customer service to customers and donors
* Do not allow community service workers to work at the store if they have been charged with a violent or sexual crime
* Assist with annual ReStore budget creation process
* Provide recommendations to hire/terminate ReStore staff
* Oversight of Donated goods into the ReStore, including proper pricing/stocking.
* Primary person signing off on the receipt of Purchased Materials and their corresponding log sheets.
* Oversight of staging area organization (including back lot where applicable).
* Ensure that restrooms are cleaned and maintained regularly.
* Ensure that the parking area of the ReStore is kept clean and properly maintained
* Creation of weekly game plan for the ReStore, in the absence of the ReStore Manager

Misc: Assistant Managers are the designated second person in charge of significant programs, operations, or stores

* Assistant Managers are expected to think independently while following the path laid by their manager
* Assistant Managers are in charge in their Manager’s absence. This includes staff with whom they are otherwise parallel
* And other duties as assigned

Pay: Up to $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 8 hour shift

title: Line Cook
description:
Looking for your dream job opportunity? Look no further! At Dos Olivos Markets, we take pride in our dedication to culinary excellence. Our team is passionate about creating innovative and delicious dishes that blend the best of both worlds. It is a unique marketplace that blends traditional European cuisine with a bold Texas twist! We want YOU to be part of our growing team!

**The Benefits!**

* Employee Discounts throughout our brands at Sobremesa Hospitality Management
* Flexible schedule
* Career advancement opportunities! Join us to unlock your true potential!
* Closed Thanksgiving and Christmas Day to spend time with family and friends.
* Fast hiring process.
* Great team atmosphere & culture!

**Line Cook**

At Dos Olivos Market, we invite everyone to experience what a true marketplace can be. We strive to embrace our heritage by merging our European roots with old-fashioned Texas Hospitality. Our mission is to connect top producers of quality wines, beers, and gourmet foods with customers searching for unique and authentic experiences in the Hill Country. We accomplish this by curating an incredible selection of the very best food, wine, and beer. Join us and become an integral part of the exceptional team at Dos Olivos Markets!

* Collaborate effectively within a team to ensure the seamless completion of all kitchen duties.

**Requirements:**

* Possess excellent communication skills to facilitate effective teamwork.
* Embrace a mindset of continuous improvement, actively contributing innovative ideas to enhance individual and team efficiency.

* Ability to work well in a team and communicate effectively.
* Proof of eligibility to work in the United States is required.
