title: Preventative Maintenance Mechanic
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled Technician to join our dynamic team.

Join our team and contribute your expertise as we strive for excellence in our operations!

In this role, you will be responsible for performing scheduled maintenance and basic field repairs on a fleet of heavy-duty rental equipment including rock saws, trenchers, excavators, loaders, and more—ensuring all machines are operating safely and efficiently.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Perform scheduled preventative maintenance and inspections on heavy equipment including rock saws, trenchers, excavators, wheel and track loaders, skid steers, and related machinery.
* Conduct pre- and post-rental inspections to assess condition, identify issues, and prepare reports.
* Diagnose and address minor mechanical issues in the field to minimize downtime.
* Travel to customer job sites to perform on-site maintenance and support service calls.
* Accurately document all work performed using mobile apps or service forms.
* Communicate clearly with dispatchers, service managers, and customers to coordinate service efficiently.
* Identify and report larger repairs or safety concerns needing shop service or escalation.
* Follow all safety procedures, wear appropriate PPE, and ensure compliance with company and regulatory standards (OSHA, DOT, etc.).
* Maintain a clean and well-organized service truck and inventory of tools and supplies.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or GED required; trade school or technical training in diesel/heavy equipment preferred.
* 1–3 years of experience working with construction or utility equipment, including hydraulic and diesel systems.
* Strong mechanical knowledge of heavy machinery such as trenchers, rock saws, excavators, and loaders.
* Valid driver’s license with clean driving record (CDL a plus or willingness to obtain).
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and troubleshoot issues in the field.
* Physically capable of lifting up to 50 lbs and working in outdoor job site environments.
* Basic understanding of diagnostic software, maintenance tracking systems, or mobile service apps.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage + overtime opportunities
* Company-provided service truck for field calls
* Uniforms, tools, and safety gear provided
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* 401(k) with company match
* Paid holidays and vacation
* Training and career development opportunities

**Join Our Team:**

If you’re a mechanically driven professional who thrives in the field and wants to work with top-tier equipment in a growing rental operation, apply now to join the team!

description:
**About us**

Adams dental studio LLC is a small business in Englewood, NJ. We are professional, customer-centric, collaborative and our goal is to provide extraordinary customer and dental services for our clients.

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting

**Office Manager**

Adams dental studio LLC is a Englewood, NJ-based company that provides a range of services to the medical community. We are looking for an Office Manager to organize and coordinate all activities of the office. The ideal candidate will be a hard-working professional able to undertake a variety of office support tasks and work diligently under pressure. This person will be comfortable working with a high degree of attention to detail and discretion as well as incorporating new and effective ways to achieve better results.

**Responsibilities**

* Organize office and assist associates in ways that optimize procedures
* Sort and distribute communications in a timely manner
* Create and update records ensuring accuracy and validity of information
* Schedule and plan meetings and appointments
* Monitor level of supplies and handle shortages
* Resolve office-related malfunctions and respond to requests or issues
* Coordinate with other departments to ensure compliance with established policies
* Maintain trusting relationships with suppliers, customers and colleagues
* Perform receptionist duties when needed (e.g. collect payments, answer phones, greet visitors)

**Requirements/Skills/Abilities**

title: Front Desk Agent
description:
Job Title: Front Desk Agent

Job Summary: We are seeking a friendly and customer-oriented Front Desk Agent to join our team at our boutique hotel located in the Catskill Mountains in Woodstock, New York. As a Front Desk Agent, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service to guests, checking guests in and out, handling reservations, and ensuring a positive guest experience.

**KEY AREAS OF FOCUS:**

* Takes responsibility for a spectacular “360” guest experience
* Transacts business with care and focus
* Fosters an environment of hospitality for both coworkers and guests

**SPECIFIC TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Manages hotel reservations for guests through operating system, phone calls, and in-person inquires
* Takes responsibility for the “360 degree” care of the guest through excellent guest interaction in person and via email, phone, and text.
* Anticipates and pre-empts guests needs and provides guests with recommendations and assistance with making plans and reservations
* Manages massage and reiki appointments by coordinating with hotel guests and third-party wellness contractors
* Is knowledgeable about retail offerings and rings up guests for purchases
* Takes responsibility for the look, feel and cleanliness of the Tannery space – this includes (but is not limited to) light merchandising and monitoring of playlists
* Reviews guest notes and preferences and sets up amenities for incoming guests in rooms
* Communicates clearly and consistently with Housekeeping Team, Front Desk Team Members, and Maintenance about the status of guest rooms – and any issues with guest rooms or the property as a whole
* Inspects rooms with attention to detail and adherence to provided SOPs and guidelines and provides feedback to Housekeeping Managers when needed
* Maintains an inventory of supplies to ensure the Front Desk has the tools to do their job
* Keeps work areas and storage areas tidy and organized
* Shows respect, care, and consideration for co-workers and guests

**SUCCESS INDICATORS:**

* Guest Satisfaction – as indicated through reviews, guest surveys, and general feedback
* Ease and tone of daily service
* Daily presentation of the rooms and property as a whole
* Correct charges and transactions in various operating systems

Requirements:

* High school diploma or equivalent required; associate's or bachelor's degree in hospitality or related field preferred
* 1-2 years of customer service or front desk experience in a hotel or hospitality environment preferred
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment
* Basic computer skills and experience with hotel reservation software (e.g., Opera, Webrez)
* Ability to stand for long periods of time and lift up to 25 pounds
* Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed
* Passion for hospitality and a desire to provide exceptional service to guests.

Candidate must have means of transportation to get to and from work.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 25 – 35 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Night shift
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Customer Service Manager
description:
JCQ Services is a dynamic and client-focused company based in Orlando, FL, dedicated to providing services to the hospitality market in several areas such as: demolition, FF&E (furniture, fixtures, and equipment), transportation, warehousing, carpentry, temporary fencing and cleaning. We pride ourselves on building strong, lasting partnerships with our clients by understanding their unique challenges and delivering tailored solutions that drive their success. Our commitment to excellence and client satisfaction is at the core of everything we do.

Position Summary:

JCQ Services is seeking a highly proactive and relationship-driven Customer Success Manager (CSM) to join our team in Orlando, FL. The CSM will be responsible for nurturing strong, long-term relationships with our valued clients, ensuring their complete satisfaction with our services, and acting as their primary point of contact and trusted advisor. This role is crucial for maximizing client retention, fostering loyalty, and identifying opportunities for client growth within our portfolio.

Responsibilities:

* Serve as the primary point of contact for an assigned portfolio of clients, building deep understanding of their business objectives, challenges, and success metrics.
* Proactively engage with clients through regular communication (calls, emails, meetings) to assess their satisfaction, gather feedback, and anticipate future needs.
* Develop and execute client success plans that align with client goals and leverage JCQ Services' offerings to achieve desired outcomes.
* Facilitate effective onboarding for new clients, ensuring a smooth transition and comprehensive understanding of our services and support processes.
* Act as a client advocate within JCQ Services, collaborating closely with internal teams (e.g., operations, technical support, sales) to ensure timely resolution of client issues and concerns.
* Monitor client health and usage data to identify potential risks or opportunities, implementing strategies to improve client satisfaction and engagement.
* Conduct regular business reviews with clients to discuss performance, value realized, upcoming initiatives, and strategic recommendations.
* Identify opportunities for service expansion or new solution adoption within existing client accounts, collaborating with the sales team to facilitate these conversations.
* Collect, analyze, and synthesize client feedback to contribute to the continuous improvement of JCQ Services' offerings and client experience.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records within the CRM system, documenting all interactions and progress.
* Stay informed about industry trends and JCQ Services' evolving capabilities to effectively advise clients.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong, empathetic relationships with diverse clients.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a proactive and solutions-oriented mindset.
* Proven ability to manage multiple client accounts and priorities effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency with CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Zoho CRM) and Microsoft Office Suite.
* A client-first mentality with a genuine passion for ensuring client success.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team structure.

title: Assistant General Manager (AGM)
description:
Five Guys Burgers and Fries is one of America's most successful hamburger concepts, not just for its food, ranked the #1 burger in America by Zagat survey, but also because of its employees. We have a unique work environment where crew members and management are trained to work every position in the restaurant. From the register, to the grill, to morning prep and evening close, our employees become a team working in all aspects of the restaurant. We also have a unique bonus program that provides the opportunity to earn cash bonuses each quarter.

We have an open kitchen experience so it's fun and it's loud with lots of team communication.

So, what's it take to be a successful Five Guys Assistant General Manager?

* **People & Leadership Skills** - Do you know how to lead and motivate people? This one skill set is what separates good managers from poor managers and will be the key attribute we will focus on in our interview process.
* **Energy & Stamina** - it's a team-based work environment and crew energy is important.
* **Ability To Work At A Fast Pace** - Our kitchens have a lot going on and there's lots of on-the-line communication and job rotation. It's not for everybody.
* **Good Communication** - Our crew is vocal and supports and works with each other on what's happening real-time during each shift.
* **Caring About Your Teammates** - Always working for the success of your team.

Qualifications:

* Minimum age: 18 years old
* High school diploma, some post high school education a plus.
* 1 year previous leadership experience in some capacity.
* 1 year experience in the food service business.
* Serve Safe Certification a plus.
* Strong references from people who have worked for you and who you've worked for.

Responsibilities:

* Financial and inventory management
* Crew assignment, training and motivation of the team during your shift
* Customer relationship management
* Full accountability for how the shift runs under your watch.
* Assist the GM with all day to day operations.
* To be on call as needed for the restaurant

title: Project Manager - Nashville
description:
Bartram Electric is a leading electrical contractor specializing in industrial, commercial, residential, and service work across the lower seven eastern states, including Mississippi, Alabama, Florida, Georgia, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Tennessee. We are committed to delivering exceptional electrical solutions with a focus on quality, safety, and customer satisfaction.

**Job Description:** We are seeking an experienced and driven Project Manager to oversee and manage electrical subcontracting projects from initiation to completion. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in electrical contracting, excellent leadership skills, and a passion for ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.

**Position is throughout the whole state, so travel will be necessary, PM’s are remote but are required to travel to job sites regularly. 10-20% travel required.**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Project Planning & Execution:** Develop and manage project plans, timelines, and budgets. Coordinate with clients, subcontractors, and internal teams to ensure all project milestones are met.
* **Team Leadership:** Lead and motivate project teams, including electricians, subcontractors, and support staff, to achieve project goals. Provide guidance, direction, and support throughout the project lifecycle.
* **Client & Stakeholder Communication:** Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, providing regular updates on project progress, addressing concerns, and ensuring customer satisfaction.
* **Quality Control:** Ensure all work is performed in accordance with industry standards, project specifications, and company quality guidelines. Conduct regular inspections and audits to maintain high-quality workmanship.
* **Risk Management:** Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize impact on project timelines and budgets.
* **Budget Management:** Monitor project budgets, control costs, and report on financial performance. Ensure projects are completed within the allocated budget.
* **Compliance & Safety:** Ensure all projects comply with relevant codes, regulations, and safety standards. Promote a culture of safety on all job sites.
* **Documentation & Reporting:** Maintain accurate project documentation, including contracts, change orders, progress reports, and final project deliverables. Provide regular status reports to senior management.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in project management within the electrical contracting industry.
* Strong knowledge of electrical systems, codes, and industry standards.
* Proven track record of successfully managing multiple projects simultaneously.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in project management software and tools.
* PMP certification is a plus.
* Ability to travel as needed to project sites.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary based on experience and benefits package. (health, dental, vision, 401K, PTO)
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* A collaborative and supportive work environment.
* The chance to work on exciting and challenging projects across multiple states.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Cannabis Harvester/Trimmer
description:
**Job Description:**

**\\*MUST HAVE STATE ISSUED CANNABIS AGENT CARD\\***

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Trim Technician to join our team. This

position plays a key role in ensuring the quality and cleanliness of our cannabis

products. As a Trim Technician, you will be responsible for trimming dried cannabis

flower, assisting with harvest operations, and maintaining cleanliness in compliance with

all state and local regulations, as well as company policies.

Reporting to the Post-Production Manager, your responsibilities will include:

* Preparing cannabis flower for packaging while maintaining the highest standards

of cleanliness, quality control, and professionalism.

* Participating in harvest activities, including the handling and processing of

cannabis plants.

* Cleaning and sanitizing workspaces, tools, and equipment to ensure a safe and

compliant environment.

* Inspecting and identifying irregularities or contaminants in cannabis material in

accordance with company guidelines and state regulations.

If you have a strong attention to detail, a commitment to quality, and thrive in a fast-

paced environment, we’d love to have you on our team!

Essential Duties and Responsibilities – Trimming

* Prepare Workstation: Sets up the trimming station at the start of each shift to

ensure readiness for processing cannabis.

* Trim Cannabis Flower: Carefully trims dried cannabis flower, removing sugar

leaves and fan leaves with precision.

* Record Metrics: Returns all trimmed cannabis, trim, waste, and sift to the Trim

Lead upon completing each allocation for accurate metric tracking.

* Assist with Harvests: Supports weekly harvest operations as needed.
* Ensure Compliance and Quality: Performs all tasks to the highest standards of

quality and compliance, adhering to state regulations, company policies, and

security protocols.

* Team Collaboration: Works effectively in a team environment, follows

instructions from Leads or Managers, and assists with delegated tasks.

* Meet Productivity Goals: Manages time efficiently to meet daily productivity

targets while maintaining consistent quality and pace.

* Maintain Cleanliness: Ensures the processing area remains clean and sanitized

throughout the shift and participates in cleaning equipment and workspaces at

the end of each shift.

* Support Team Efforts: Contributes to team success by completing related tasks

as needed.

This role requires attention to detail, efficiency, and a commitment to maintaining high

standards in a fast-paced environment.

SUCCESS PROFILE/COMPETENCIES

* Action Oriented
* Goal Oriented
* Lead by Example
* Time Management
* Perseverance
* Ethics and Values
* Functional/Technical Skills
* Approachability
* Informing

* Personal Learning
* Self-Motivated

OTHER ASSOCIATED FACTORS

* High level of attention to detail and ability to adhere to strict policies and

procedures.

* Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task.
* Ability to be flexible with schedule and hours of the day.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing and challenging environment.
* Maintain compliance with any and all legal or company policies or regulations.
* Comply with all company policies including confidentiality and non-disclosure.
* Actively involved in Workplace Safety in a warehouse setting.
* Don proper PPE in the workplace, at all times.
* Ability to stand and walk for extended periods of time.
* Ability to bend and stoop to grasp objects, bend and twist neck and waist, reach

above and below shoulders and squat.

* Ability to bend and lift loads, not to exceed 50 pounds.
* Ability to use hands repetitively for grasping, pushing, pulling and cutting.
* Must be motivated, focused and have a strong work ethic.
* Ability to adapt to change and shifting priorities.
* Any additional duties as determined by Management.

The job description defines the general requirements and level of work. The description

is not a complete list of all required responsibilities, duties and skill requirements. Other

responsibilities may be added, and the job description may be changed at any time.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS -

EXPERIENCE/TRAINING/EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION/ETC.

laws.

title: Medical Assistant
description:
We are a new fast growing pain management clinic with multiple locations. We are looking to staff our Sun City Center and surrounding locations. Our focus is on providing our patients with advanced, non-opioid based therapies for the improvement of their pain conditions. We are seeking a Front/Back office Medical Assistant who is a reliable, experienced, energetic, team-player with exceptional customer service skills, capable of providing an outstanding patient experience.

**Front Office (Medical Assistant) Responsibilities:**

* Speak and interact with patients, office staff and providers regarding patient care issues in a friendly and professional manner.
* Must be familiar with insurance requirements for authorizations, referrals, and medical clearances.
* Check in/out patients, schedule patient appointments and procedures accordingly.

Collect and post copays and deductibles into the electronic record.

* Verify and enter/correct patient demographic and insurance information into the electronic record. Will scan new patient registration packets into the electronic record and include a copy of the patient identification card and insurance card paying careful attention to capture any secondary insurances.
* Will prep next day charts ensuring required clearances and records have been received in good order.
* Will add UDS results to the electronic record and upload procedure images.
* May open/close the office and perform general housekeeping duties to include but not limited to changing out trash bags, wiping down and re-stocking exam rooms, changing exam table paper, and wiping down front desk counter top, etc.

**Back Office (Medical Assistant) Responsibilities:**

* Room patients taking histories and vital signs, preparing patients for examination and/or procedures.
* Chart and enter data into patient’s electronic record (eClinicalWorks)
* Scan and index documents accurately to patient’s electronic medical records.
* Assist physician with examinations and treatments including selected diagnostic tests.
* Collect, prepare, and send out laboratory specimens, e.g., urine drug screen samples.
* Prepare and administer medications as directed by physician.
* Answer back office specific calls, seeing to it that messages are handled in a timely manner and specifically patient calls are returned prior to the end of the day.

**Procedure (Medical Assistant) Responsibilities:**

* We will teach/train you to use the in office fluoroscopy machine. Will assist physician with procedures;
* Will position patient for each anatomical view.
* Monitor and report any changes in patients condition to the physician
* Will monitor accessory equipment assisting physician with fluoroscopic exam/radiographic studies.
* Will determine, prepare, and set up medical supplies, instruments, and equipment for each patient as necessary.

**Other Responsibilities:**

* Communicate effectively and professionally with patients, visitors, vendors, physicians, coworkers, and regulatory agencies. Reply to email messages, google chat messages, and telephone messages in a timely and respectful manner.
* Work directly with Physician and/or Office Manager on all aspects of practice operations and workflows.
* Participate in marketing activities and work with vendors and referring physicians as necessary.

**Qualifications**

* Previous experience working as a front and/or back office MA is preferred.
* Experience in Pain Management preferred.
* Strong ethical and moral character is imperative.
* Must possess a strong work ethic, be a self-starter, and forward thinking.
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team is imperative.
* Must be reliable and able to show up to work on time on a daily basis.
* Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office.
* Basic math and spelling skills. Ability to correctly alphabetize.
* Experience in working with electronic health records preferably some experience using **eClinicalWorks (eCW).**

**Requirements**

* Minimum of High school diploma or GED certificate.
* *Reliable transportation and punctuality a must!*

title: Safety & Training Manager (Paratransit)
description:
**Safety Manager – San Diego (Paratransit Operations)**

*Location: San Diego, CA*  
*Division: MTS Paratransit | Transdev U.S.*  
*Salary: $75,000 – $93,000 + up to 10% performance bonus*

**Drive Safety. Build Careers. Make an Impact.**

At Transdev, we're not just moving people — we're empowering freedom and safety on the road. As a **Safety Manager** in our San Diego paratransit operations, you'll lead critical safety initiatives, coach future operators, and champion a safety-first culture that directly impacts lives and the community.

If you’re passionate about safety, leadership, and developing talent in the transit space, we want to hear from you.

**Why You’ll Love Working With Us**

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* **Competitive Salary**: $75,000–$93,000
* **Bonus Potential**: Up to 10% annually based on performance
* **Paid Time Off**:
* 2+ weeks vacation
* 5 sick days
* 12 paid holidays (8 standard, 4 floating)
* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* 401(k) with company match
* Life and disability coverage
* Tool, training, and career advancement opportunities
* Global Company. Local Impact: Be part of a worldwide mobility leader making a difference in your own city.

**What You’ll Do**

* Lead all safety efforts and ensure compliance with federal, state, local, and corporate regulations
* Manage and deliver comprehensive operator training, including behind-the-wheel and classroom instruction
* Conduct monthly safety meetings, accident investigations, and road observations
* Oversee the injury prevention program, Drive Cam coaching, and drug & alcohol testing compliance
* Maintain training records, OSHA logs, and employee safety files
* Collaborate with HR, operations, and local leadership to promote a positive, safety-driven culture
* Respond to customer concerns related to service and safety

**What You Bring**

* **3+ years** in passenger transportation, safety, or operations management
* Experience developing training programs and managing safety compliance
* Strong leadership and communication skills
* Familiarity with DOT regulations (including drug testing requirements under 49 CFR Part 40)

Physical & Work Environment

* Mix of office and field work; must be comfortable working both indoors and outdoors
* Occasional local travel (<5%)

Transdev is the leading private provider of public transportation in North America, operating in 400+ communities and serving millions of riders annually. Our customers and community members know that they can rely on us for Legendary Service and quality products.

**Job title**: Class A CDL Driver

**Pay**: Starting at $25 to $29 an hour, depending on experience

**Schedule**: Monday-Friday starting at 6am and working until all loads for the day have been delivered.

**Location**: Sunnyside, Washington

At PARR, our Drivers are essential to fulfilling the needs of our customers by making sure they are receiving their orders on-time and in great condition. The ideal driver is someone who is driven to maintain safety regulations and above and beyond customer service. The Driver reports directly to the General Manager and interacts daily with customers, dispatchers, receivers, and load-builders.

**Qualifications**

* Must be 21 years old or over
* Class A CDL required (air-brake endorsement *required*)
* Current DOT Medical Card
* Acceptable driving record
* Knowledge of vehicle safety audits and reports of any malfunctioning equipment as required by Federal and state regulations and company policy
* Ability to speak, write, and read English *required*
* Ability to manage time and routes for a streamlined delivery experience
* Open and transparent communication
* Familiarity with GPS devices or map applications
* Driving experience within 50-mile radius of primary location *preferred*

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Always provides required paperwork and scanning for dispatch
* Seeks to learn products and their application for the end users
* Learns and follows established best practices
* Learns from mistakes and accepts coaching as opportunities
* Demonstrates legal and thorough knowledge of tie down rules and regs
* Understands weight, height, and length limits
* Ensures that all material transported on the truck has either an invoice or Material Returns Form
* Continues to participate in training as available
* Learning best practices related to efficient loading, strapping, and driving
* Checks load for accuracy
* Annually update driver's qualification file as required by Federal and state regulations and company policy
* Legally, safely, and efficiently travel to destinations through public and private roads
* Complete mileage and fuel usage reports
* Annually update driver's qualification file as required by Federal and state regulations and company policy
* Follow delivery procedures by taking photos of delivered shipment after completing each delivery
* Learns and uses route planning and optimization
* Demonstrates commitment to on-time and in-full deliveries
* Perform other related duties as assigned

This position will be working at a Truss Facility and making deliveries at jobsites in all weather conditions.

**Physical Requirements**

* Ability to pass DOT pre-placement physical
* Must be able to lift up to 90 lbs.
* Must be able to work outdoors in all weather conditions
* Ability to sit for an extended period of time
* Ability to stoop, bend and walk

We know that without great people, we can't be a great company. Voted as one of the "Top Places to Work" by the Oregonian for the 3rd year in a row, we offer industry-leading benefits:

* Everyone starts earning 2 weeks of vacation per year on day 1, and gains an additional day every year worked up to 4 weeks off
* Employee paid sick days
* 7 holidays
* 2 medical plan options, one with a high deductible that offers an HSA and our standard plan with a very low $1,000 deductible
* Dental, Vision, EAP (Employee Assistance Program)
* Massage, Chiropractic and Acupuncture coverage
* FSA (Flexible Spending Account) and Childcare pretax spending programs
* HSA (Health Savings Account)
* Footwear subsidy through boot vendor after 90 days of employment
* Up to 50% match on the first 6% you contribute to your 401(k) after 1 year of employment and fully vested at the end of your 3rd year
* In addition to the 401(k) match, there a 3% profit share contribution to the 401(k), with Board approval
* Tuition reimbursement (up to $2,500/year)
* Annual profit sharing (every full time employee who worked the full year earned a minimum of $525 for the 2024 year)
* $1,000 referral bonus

**PARR Promotes!**

We have a transparent pay structure, and love to promote from within. Our current CEO started with the company as a driver and by being open to change and a self-starter he climbed the ranks to the role he has today. There are many members of our management team who started their careers in our entry-level positions. If you're willing to work hard, there's no reason you won't earn regular merit increases and promotions. There is A LOT of opportunity - PARR is growing fast!

We value our employees like family and are constantly working to provide a safe place to work for our employees. Most of our locations are not open past 5 and all our locations are closed on Sundays.

Our company mission is **Legendary Service through Teamwork**, and we take that seriously. When you join our team, you're joining a family owned company that's been in business for 90 years, with a well-established reputation as a leader within the building material supply industry in the United States.

title: Travel Center General Manager
description:
**Company Description**

Pilot Company is an industry-leading network of travel centers with more than 30,000 team members and over 750 retail and fueling locations in 44 states and six Canadian provinces. Our energy and logistics division serves as a top supplier of fuel, employing one of the largest tanker fleets and providing critical services to oil operations in our nation's busiest basins. Pilot Company supports a growing portfolio of brands with expertise in supply chain and retail operations, logistics and transportation, technology and digital innovation, construction, maintenance, human resources, finance, sales and marketing.

Founded in 1958 by Jim A. Haslam II and currently led by CEO Adam Wright, our founding values, people-first culture and commitment to giving back remains true to us today. Whether we are serving guests, a fellow team member, or a trucking company, we are dedicated to fueling people and keeping North America moving.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

Military encouraged to apply.

 **Job Description**

Pilot Flying J is seeking an experienced Retail General Manager to oversee our high-volume retail facilities. You will be responsible for the generation and execution of travel center and restaurant business plans to achieve established standards, sales and profit objectives as well as customer satisfaction.  
  
The Retail General Manager will also be:

* Ensuring that customer expectations are met
* Conducting meetings with subordinate employees
* Maintaining effective vendor relationships

As a Retail General Manager for Pilot Flying J, you will build, coach, manage and develop teams from a staffing, interviewing, hiring and training standpoint.

Additional responsibilities for the Retail General Manager include:

* Driving sales
* Managing team members
* Tracking inventory
* Providing customer service
* Performing P&L analysis

Pay Rates Starting between: $54,300.00 - $80,750.00 / year

 **Qualifications**

As a Retail General Manager, you must exemplify integrity and accountability at the managerial level as well as demonstrate excellent team leadership skills. Furthermore, you must be able to work a flexible schedule of nights, days, weekends and holidays.

Additional requirements of the Retail General Manager include:

* Minimum 2-3 years of management experience in the retail, restaurant, grocery or other service industry with responsibility for financial results
* Previous management proficiency in high volume retail with P&L accountability
* Ability to create and maintain a customer focused culture

  
**Additional Information**  

* Fuel Discount
* Nation-wide Medical Plan/Dental/Vision
* 401(k)
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Adoption Assistance
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Flexible Schedule
* Weekly Pay

title: Parts Hanger
description:
**About us**

Iowa Powder Craft is a small business that specializes in metal finishing and powder coating in Mason City, IA where we have about 15 employees. **Powder coating** is a type of coating applied as a **free-flowing, dry powder**. Unlike liquid paint, which uses a solvent, powder coating is applied electrostatically and then cured under heat or UV light. It is commonly used on materials like steel, aluminum, and plastic. We **DO NOT** do wet paint only powder coating. Iowa Powder Craft is small in size and at this time we **DO NOT** have health, dental and vision benefits. We **DO** however offer all employees paid sick leave after 90 days and 40 hours of vacation after 1 year with the company. Iowa Powder Craft is growing and expanding and just moved to our larger facility in Mason City, IA. With our growth comes need for more employees. Iowa Powder Craft is a demanding and challenging company as we strive to be safe in everything we do while providing quality work to our customers.

Our work environment includes:

* Casual work attire
* High demand for quality product
* Making safety our #1 priority
* Employee must have own steel toe boots

**Iowa PowderCraft** is continuously looking for individuals to join our team in Mason City, IA as a **Laborer**.

Iowa PowderCraft is a powder coating and media blasting company that works with a variety of products for our customers. We are looking for candidates who are motivated, hard-working, and willing to learn.

**Duties:**

* Hanging product on racks correctly and safely
* Pretreating metal substrates so its clean and ready for powder application
* Cleaning metal with steel grit abrasive material to ensure metal is free of rust and any paint
* Ensuring product is labeled and stored safely and correctly
* Operate equipment safely and properly while wearing PPE required
* Operate hand tools and follow all safety for each hand tool
* Read workorders completely to determine work to be performed and plan work accordingly
* Clean work areas and equipment throughout the day
* Follow all company safety rules and regulations
* May need to assist in other areas as needed
* Other duties as assigned by supervisor or manager
* Ability to work 32 hours up to 50 hours if needed each week

**Experience:** Manufacturing experience is a plus but is not required. Candidate must be able to lift 50lbs regularly and work in differing weather conditions.

**Positions Hiring**

* Hanging Department
* Media Blaster

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $17.50 per hour

Expected hours: 32 – 42 per week

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Morning shift
* Weekends as needed

title: Assistant Studio Manager
description:
Assistant Studio Manager

POSITION SUMMARY

The BASH Assistant Studio Manager (ASM) supports the BASH Studio Manager (& independently leads at times) in executing all “*front of house*” BASH studio operations - with an unrelenting focus on premium customer service, driving sales, & maintaining an impeccably clean studio. The ASM is expected to meet and push to exceed aggressive sales targets for the studio, including membership, renewals, upgrades, & retail sales. The ASM is to serve as the ‘expert’ for all things member relations, understanding the intricacies of BASH policies, products, and common member/guest inquiries. The ASM is required to take immense pride in maintaining a clean, organized, & premium environment for BASH’s members & guests – and is expected to maintain a welcoming, approachable, & warm energy when interacting with anyone that walks through the BASH doors or reaches out for assistance via phone/email/text. In addition, the ASM will be expected to assist the BASH Studio Manager in leading and managing the general Studio Associate team when appropriate in terms of task delegation, escalation mitigation, & other relevant managerial tasks as assigned by the SM.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

● Serve as the BASH Studio Manager’s ‘go-to’ resource for daily task delegation, staff management & communication, & escalated issue mitigation.

● Oversee & lead when applicable all operational tasks inherent of BASH’s front desk, including but not limited to answering client communications via phone, email & text, greeting prospective & current clients – establishing necessary rapport, managing class attendance & client tracking, & handling all client inquires in a timely fashion with necessary tracking & escalation when warranted.

● Execute the E2E BASH sales process – focusing on identifying new leads, engaging with dormant contacts, driving attendance to the BASH studios, & converting eligible points-of sale

● Serving as the primary guide for first-timers for BASH – providing a welcoming & engaging energy, outlining expectations, relevant guidelines, & ensuring the client is introduced to the studio, the coach, & the workout properly

● Maintain accurate sales funnel records using the provided BASH Sales System.

● Serve as the expert on all things BASH - & sharing insight through BASH studio tours with prospects

● Execute the daily studio cleaning checklist

● Attend & participate in all required BASH trainings, relevant workshops, and applicable marketing/outreach events.

● Adhere to all BASH employment & operational policies

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & QUALIFICATIONS

● A demonstrated interest in health & fitness

● 2+ years of previous sales & customer service experience

● Previous management experience strongly preferred - within the health & fitness industry specifically

● Excellent interpersonal & customer service skills

● Ability to multi-task and manage client & staff concerns with approachable & welcoming energy

● Strong computer skills with knowledge of MS office programs (Word and Excel primarily)

● Ability to work well in a team environment as well as independently

● High School diploma required; College degree strongly preferred

SCHEDULE REQUIREMENTS

● Must have availability to accommodate 20-30 hours a week

● Flexible hours & weekend availability a must

● Required to work 2-3 holidays

COMPENSATION

$15-$17/hour + performance-driven bonus

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 5 – 10 per week

Shift:

* Day shift

Work Location: In person

title: Property Management Assistant
description:
**The largest housing authority in the State of New Mexico is looking for an energetic, conscientious and detail oriented individual who enjoys making a difference, being part of a team and takes pride in their career to work in our fast paced office.**

**Property Management Assistant for the Public Housing Division**

Compensation: Wage range is $17.99 per hour - $22.13 per hour ($37,428.49 annually - $46,032.32 annually) \\*Note: the starting wage for this position will be $17.99 per hour.

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Closing Date/Time: The position is considered open until filled

**POSITION FUNCTION SUMMARY:**

Under general supervision of the Property Manager, this position provides clerical and administrative assistance to assigned AHA-owned and/or managed housing rental properties for a wide variety of property functions including tenant relations and property management, customer service, compliance and eligibility, maintenance requests and general office administrative tasks; maintains tenant files and related documentation; and performs related duties, as assigned.

**Education and Experience:**

***Required:***

*Any combination of training and experience that would provide the required knowledge, skills, and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the required qualifications would be*:

* Equivalent to graduation from the twelfth (12th) grade and one (1) year of experience supporting property management, facilities management, or affordable housing programs and activities.
* Possession of, or the ability to obtain, an appropriate, valid New Mexico driver's license upon appointment. Must have and maintain an Albuquerque Housing Authority insurable driving record.

**Language Requirements:**

***Required:***

* Ability to read and write English in order to understand and interpret written procedures and federal documents. This includes the ability to give and receive instructions in written and verbal forms and to effectively present information and respond to questions from vendors, contractors, supervisors, co-workers, residents, and city/county agencies.

***Preferred:***

* Bi-lingual (English/Spanish)

We offer competitive compensation and very attractive fringe benefits including medical (including gym membership), dental, vision, 10 paid holidays, paid leave, PERA pension, free basic life insurance, volunteer life, paid STD and LTD, 457 and an employee assistance program.

title: Bathroom Installer
description:
As an Installer with Premier Home Pros, you will join us on our mission of Making Homeowners Dreams a Reality by consistently delivering five-star shower installation and bath remodel experiences to our customers.

You will report directly to our Installation Manager and work closely with our Lead Installers, Trainers, and Warehouse/Operations professionals.

We Invest in YOU

We’ve got you covered with:

* Consistent weekly schedule to maximize your earning potential
* We provide the materials and the jobs. You show up and install the project. PAID WEEKLY DIRECT DEPOSIT!
* Provided training and development on installation practices to maximize efficiency
* Be your own Boss within our Company

What It Takes to Succeed

At Premier Home Pros, we are detailed oriented on making our customers experience seamless. Our factory direct process makes us the easy choice for the consumer, and we create a team that can execute the finished product into their homes. We’ll provide you with the training and tools to set you up for success, and we hope that you’ll bring:

* Experience in carpentry, remodeling, plumbing, construction – or a hunger to learn!
* Reliable work vehicle (truck, van, hybrid, etc)
* Necessary tools
* Basic knowledge of hand tools and power tools
* Strong attention to detail
* Ability to accurately read a tape measure
* Valid Driver’s License
* Must have a valid smart phone or smart device in order to receive work orders and update our CRM

Day to Day Operations

In this role, you can expect to:

* Meet at our warehouse at 6:30AM, gather materials, and load vehicle
* Drive to customers home, greet and establish rapport
* Complete controlled demolition of the bathtub/shower area
* Install new bathtub/shower base and solid surface wall surround, update plumbing as needed
* Show extreme attention to detail and care for customer’s home by properly cleaning up following installation
* Obtain necessary signed documents & payment from customer, and return to documents to Project Manager.
* Daily job close outs and emailed documentation

Why Work at Premier Home Pros?

We are the fastest growing bathroom company in the country. With 20+ years’ experience in the Residential Remodeling industry and a multi- state brand that is rapidly expanding throughout the United States.

If your a skilled professional that is looking for consistent work with the highest pay in the industry, we have the training, coaching, and development to take your career to the next level.

* Adhere to installation standards while installing and performing service requests.
* Walk customers through finished project and get signed completion certificate

Basic Qualifications:

* Previous successful experience in basic plumbing and remodeling experience
* We will train the right candidate if they have a strong work ethic and a great attitude
* Familiarity with building supplies and industry background.
* Ability to lift 50+ pounds.
* Liability Insurance and Workers Compensation (when needed)

Additional Skills/Preferences:

* Ability to handle physical workload.
* Ability to work well in teams.
* Ability to prioritize and multitask.

Premier Home Pros is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

title: Manager, Finance & Accounting, Americas
description:
**Company Description**

Shiji is a global technology company dedicated to providing innovative solutions for the hospitality industry, ensuring seamless operations for hotelier’s day and night.

Built on the Shiji Platform—the only truly global hotel technology platform—Shiji’s cloud-based portfolio includes Property Management System, Point-of-Sale, guest engagement, distribution, payments, and data intelligence solutions for over 91,000 hotels worldwide, including the largest chains.

With more than 5,000 employees across the world, Shiji is a trusted partner for the world’s leading hoteliers, delivering technology that works as continuously as the industry itself. That’s why the best hotels run on Shiji—day and night. While its primary focus is on hospitality, Shiji also serves select customers in food service, retail, and entertainment in certain regions.

The best hotels run on Shiji—day and night.

 **Job Description**

**Job Summary:**

The Manager, Finance & Accounting, Americas oversees the financial operations across the Americas region, ensuring accurate reporting, budgeting, regulatory compliance, and timely execution of accounting processes. This role prepares and manages financial statements, supports audits, contributes to strategic planning, and provides insights to drive business performance and financial health.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Manage day-to-day financial operations for the Americas region.
* Lead and develop a high-performing regional finance team, providing coaching, direction, and performance management to ensure alignment with business goals.
* Collaborate with the global finance teams to ensure alignment on financial activities and reporting.
* Align regional financial practices with global finance policies and strategic objectives.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to deliver financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis, providing actionable insights to support strategic initiatives and informed decision-making.
* Oversee budgeting and forecasting processes in collaboration with regional and global teams.
* Lead the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial close processes in compliance with corporate standards and timelines.
* Prepare and analyze financial statements and management reports.
* Manage tax filings and ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations across multiple jurisdictions.
* Maintain and enhance internal controls to ensure financial integrity and risk mitigation.
* Support internal and external audits, including preparation of required documentation and responses to inquiries.
* Coordinate with external vendors for tax advisory and compliance matters in the Americas region.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and lead initiatives to increase efficiency and accuracy.
* Develop and implement accounting policies and procedures to streamline processes and ensure consistency.

  
**Qualifications**

**Minimum Qualifications (knowledge, skills, and abilities):**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field
* Minimum five (5) years of experience in accounting or finance or related
* Bilingual fluency in Chinese (Mandarin) and English, both written and spoken
* Strong knowledge of GAAP and regulatory compliance requirements
* Experience preparing financial statements and reports
* Proficiency with financial systems and tools (e.g., ERP systems, Excel)
* Excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills
* Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional and international teams

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience working in a multinational or technology-driven organization

  
**Additional Information**

*Shiji US, Inc does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, ancestry, genetic information, veteran status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, political affiliation, and matriculation or any other characteristic protected by law. Employment decisions at Shiji US, Inc are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Shiji US, Inc is also committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hr.uscan.list@shijigroup.com.*

title: Talent Acquisition Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Talent Acquisition Manager

**Location**: New York, New York

**Position Type:** Contract

**Bonus Opportunities:** Performance-Based

**Company**: Mims Consulting Group

**About Us:**  
At Mims Consulting Group, we provide specialized consulting services exclusively for the hospitality industry. Partnering closely with hotel owners, management companies, and independent operators, we deliver strategic solutions that drive financial performance, enhance market positioning, strengthen brand development, and boost customer engagement.

**About the Role:**

We are seeking an experienced and motivated **Talent Acquisition Manager** to help our clients find top-notch candidates across various hospitality roles, from front-of-house to leadership positions. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with a deep understanding of the hospitality industry and a strong network of contacts.

* Ability to build relationships with clients and candidates alike.

**Why Join Us:**

* Join a respected network of hospitality professionals

title: Project Manager
description:
What is Compellier?

Compellier™ is focused on creating value in the construction industry by investing in technologies and business practices that improve the longevity and quality of building systems as well as the work environment and productivity of our team members and customers in service of our purpose- balconies that don't leak; floors that don't fail. We build sustainable growth through startups, targeted acquisitions, and the development of solid relationships that support our industry with superior service and technology.

Compellier has three brands:

* Cemplex Group: A construction subcontractor serving primarily the multi-family housing and hospitality markets across the central and eastern United States.
* Formulated Materials: A developer and distributor of waterproofing, sound dampening, leveling, and sub-floor systems that are leading innovation in their field.
* Smart Batch Systems: An innovative startup-making network connected small aggregate cement mixing heavy equipment that makes work crews safer and more productive while providing immediate access to productivity, progress, and issues on construction projects.

At Compellier, we believe our ICOMPEL values are the foundation for all internal interactions and business conduct. We are seeking talented people who can execute the position's responsibilities in a manner consistent with our values.

Integrity: Do the right thing

Commitment: Keep your promises and make satisfied customers

Opportunity Makers: Grow yourself, your career, and the company

Master your Craft: Take pride in your work

Protect: Keep each other safe

Everyone is a Leader: Positive Influence, positive results

Love: Treat others with dignity and respect

DESCRIPTION SUMMARY

The Project Manager is responsible for complete oversight of construction projects in assorted sizes and scope from beginning to end.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

* Effectively manage multiple construction projects that are in various stages of completion and locations including code compliance, project scope definition, preparation of project budgets, coordination of appropriate working documents/specifications, and project close out based on established Company guidelines
* Work collaboratively with and maintain effective communication vendors to ensure that project scope definition is clearly established and understood for all projects
* Scheduling of crews
* Initiate appropriate project documents and track progress of each project as related to objectives, approved budgets, and approved timelines
* Ensure project costs are aligned with approved budgets, track expenses, approve contractor invoices and change order requests
* Implement/coordinate all required change requests, make recommendations, secure approvals, and issue change orders. Assess change request to determine impacts to scope, budget, schedule, quality and risk
* Other duties as assigned
* Supervising construction site operations
* Work directly with general contractors, site personnel, other subcontractors, and suppliers.
* Positively respond to sensitive situations
* Recruit, coach, and mentor team members for career advancement opportunities. Establish and develop a high performing and scalable team
* Instill a high-performance safety culture throughout the business and lead by example
* Perform a key role in planning, budgeting, and identification of needed resources
* Maintain adherence to the budgetary guidelines, quality, and safety standards
* Facilitate creation of the teams’ objectives/goals and individual responsibilities
* Monitor the progress of the construction activities on a regular basis and hold regular status meetings with key operations team members
* Work with corporate support teams to improve efficiency, work processes, and ensure group compliance with corporate policies
* Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the execution of field operations
* Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
* Ensure resource availability and allocation
* Measure operational performance using appropriate systems, data, tools, and techniques
* Report and escalate to management as needed – Utilize subject matter experts when necessary for overall success of the business
* Perform risk assessments to minimize operation risks.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES

* Ability to travel to job sites, attend meetings and functions outside of typical business hours
* Team player with operations, sales, estimators, and company administration
* Self-starter with ability to set goals and tasks
* Strong leadership skills
* Good client management and relationship building ability
* Tactful and mature demeanor with well-developed interpersonal skills including the ability to work well with diverse personalities
* Manage Ambiguity: Embraces change, adapts to evolving work demands, and navigates uncertainty with flexibility and openess.
* Planning: The incumbent's preparedness and strategic vision for achieving organizational goals are essential.
* Coordination: Ability to effectively coordinate multiple components of an event, process, or project to meet established deadlines. Ability to quickly handle unexpected problems.
* Team Member Development: Supports growth, career planning, and skill enhancement aligned with organizational needs.
* Job Knowledge: The level of knowledge, skills and education required for job functions, and their application, along with a commitment to continuous improvement
* Financial Acumen: Applies financial knowledge to analyze data, interpret trends, and make informed decisions.
* Accountability: Responsible and answerable for actions and performance individually or on a team
* Initiative: Ability to perform job responsibilities independently and responsibly
* Teamwork: Promote positive work relationships with staff, team members and supervisors

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Required:

* High school diploma or equivalent and 5 years of Project Management Experience ~or~
* Associate's degree or certificate in business, construction, engineering, architecture or related field and 4 Years of Project Management Experience ~or~
* Bachelor's degree in business, construction, engineering, architecture or related field and 3 years of Project Management Experience ~AND~
* 3 Years of Construction Experience

Preferred:

* Supervisory Experience (Preferred)
* Bilingual: Spanish (Preferred)

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORKING CONDITIONS

* Work in a mostly field environment
* Exposed to various weather elements including rain and extreme hot and cold
* There were various amounts of standing, kneeling, climbing, bending, lifting, and carrying up to 50 pounds.
* Safely perform work with appropriate safety gear when needed
* Will require travel based on project needs

title: Senior HR Generalist
description:
**URGENTLY HIRING!**

**HR Generalist** **Location:**New York City (Park Avenue Office) **IN PERSON POSITION** **Job Type:** Full-Time, **Salary Range:** $75,000–$90,000 per year, willing to negotiate

**About the Company** (name to be discussed during interview)

The company is a global leader in AI-powered solutions for commerce and retail, focused on transforming customer engagement, streamlining transactions, and driving revenue growth. Our flagship product suite – BRAiN Commerce, BRAiN Checkout, and BRAiN Assistant leverages the power of AI to deliver personalized, frictionless shopping experiences that drive measurable business outcomes. With strategic partnerships including Microsoft and Google, the company is redefining the future of commerce.

**About the Role**

We are seeking a dynamic and proactive HR Generalist to work along side of the VP of Global HR Operations, support global initiatives, and enhance the employee experience across our fast-growing international team. This role also includes executive administrative and office coordination responsibilities. Based in our New York City headquarters, you’ll work closely with global leadership to implement HR policies, drive compliance, talent acquisition, foster a high-performing company culture, and day to day HR operations.

**Key Responsibilities Global HR Operations & Compliance**

* Support HR operations across the U.S., **Canada**, UK, Australia, and other global regions.
* Ensure compliance with local labor laws and employment regulations.
* Partner with legal, HR and leadership to uphold international best practices.
* Assist with global onboarding and offboarding processes.
* Stay current on employment law, immigration, and benefits trends in key markets.

**HR Strategy & Employee Experience**

* Scale HR systems and processes in a high-growth, startup environment.
* Collaborate with leadership to roll out people policies, benefits programs, and performance frameworks.
* Serve as a trusted advisor for employees and managers on HR matters.
* Maintain and optimize BambooHR and track key HR metrics.

**Talent Acquisition & Onboarding**

* Work closely with hiring managers to support recruitment efforts.
* Manage hiring logistics, from sourcing to onboarding, including for international hires.
* Ensure a smooth and engaging onboarding experience for all new team members.

**HR Policies & Compliance**

* Draft and update employee handbooks and HR policies.
* Ensure compliance with regional employment regulations and data privacy laws.
* Maintain accurate HR documentation and employee records.

**Culture & Engagement**

* Support initiatives to boost employee engagement and foster a strong team culture.
* Assist with learning and development efforts as the company grows.

**Administrative & Office Support**

* Provide high-level administrative support to C-suite executives.
* Greet and assist executives and visitors, ensuring a polished and professional experience.
* Maintain an organized and welcoming office environment, always ready for high-profile guests.

**Requirements**

* Must be based in New York City and available to work **in-person,** Monday–Friday.
* 5+ years of HR experience, ideally within corporate, tech,start-ups or high-growth environments.
* Hands-on experience with **U.S. and Canadian** employment law and compliance.
* Proficiency in **BambooHR**, **Lever**, and other HRIS/ATS platforms.
* Strong interpersonal skills-**Must be polished, yet not calculated when speaking with the Executive team**.
* Ability to manage both HR and administrative tasks with flexibility and professionalism.
* Adaptable and resourceful with excellent problem-solving capabilities.

**Nice to Have**

* Experience with mergers & acquisitions and global workforce expansion.
* Professional HR certifications (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR, CIPD).

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary and performance-based growth opportunities
* 401(k) retirement plan
* Health insurance

Paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick leave)

title: Pharmacy Technician/Patient Care Coordinator
description:
**Position Title**: Patient Care Coordinator (Pharmacy Technician)

**Reports To:** Pharmacist-in-Charge (Pharmacy Manager)

**Locations:** NPS Pharmacy Direct

NPS Pharmacy is seeking a dynamic and experienced Patient Care Coordinator (PCC) to join our pharmacy team. The PCC will be instrumental in ensuring smooth pharmacy operations, maintaining regulatory compliance, and delivering outstanding patient care. This position requires strong organizational skills, a commitment to excellence, and a passion for improving patient health outcomes. Additionally, the PCC will play a crucial part in providing pharmacy services and culturally competent care to a very diverse patient population, including individuals living with HIV, at risk of contracting STD/STIs, the LGBTQ+ community, communities of color, and low socioeconomic status.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Assist pharmacists (e.g., PIC, Staff Pharmacist, PRN) in preparing and dispensing prescribed medications.
* Enter prescription information and/or type prescription label(s) into a pharmacy filling system (e.g., PioneerRx)
* Record prescription information meticulously into all pharmacy filling systems and databases to maintain accurate patient records.
* Ensure compliance with labeling requirements and affix appropriate labels to medication containers (e.g., vial, bottle, box, bubble pack).
* Assist in pharmacy inventory management by accurately counting, pouring, mixing, and packaging of medication, including removing expired medications.
* Answer incoming and outgoing calls to patients, case managers, providers, insurance companies (payers), nurses, doctors, healthcare providers, etc.
* Help pharmacist provide comprehensive patient care and education, ensuring patients understand their medications and treatment plans.
* Interact courteously with patients and team members to develop and maintain positive, professional relationships.
* Produce routine reports and correspondence with clarity and accuracy.
* Coordinate prescription deliveries efficiently to meet patient needs.
* Proactively identify operational challenges and provide effective solutions to improve pharmacy processes and patient care.
* Other additional related duties as assigned.

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* High school diploma or GED
* Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT)
* If currently not CPhT, must acquire within 90 days of employment.
* Proficient in English with strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong typing and data entry skills
* Strong Technical and MS Office skills (Word, Excel, Outlook, Zoom, etc.)
* Experience with pharmacy software (e.g., PioneerRx)
* Excellent interpersonal, customer service, managerial, and communication skills.
* Must have a positive attitude, be energetic and flexible, have excellent phone etiquette, and provide exceptional customer service.
* Ability to establish positive rapport, build relationships, and provide culturally sensitive patient care.
* Able to efficiently operate in a fast-paced environment while fostering positive customer relations.
* Must have a reliable transportation mode to and from both NPS Pharmacy locations regularly.

**HIGHLY PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* 2+ years of full-time retail/community, clinical, specialty, or 340B pharmacy experience.
* Associate degree or higher, especially in a related healthcare field
* Extensive experience with PioneerRx
* Familiarity with Electronic Medical/Health Records (EMR/EHR)
* Experience providing direct pharmaceutical care, serving as a drug information and patient education resource, and assisting with the monitoring of patients living with the **Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV),** including: Experience providing comprehensive pharmaceutical support to patients living with HIV in a clinical environment and/or in partnership with a 340B covered entity.
* Has experience providing direct pharmaceutical care, serving as a drug information and patient education resource, and assisting with the monitoring of patients who identify as part of the **LGBTQ+ community**, including: Experience providing comprehensive pharmaceutical support to patients identifying as LGBTQ+ in a clinical environment and/or in partnership with a 340B covered entity. Currently has or is willing to acquire foundational knowledge about key concepts and terminologies relevant to the LGBTQ+ population, including but not limited to pronoun usage, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identities, and intersectionality of multiple identities.
* Knowledge and understanding of the federal **340B Drug Pricing Program**.
* Bilingual in Spanish

**LOCATION**

This position is in Brentwood, Tennessee.

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT**

* NPS Pharmacy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer**.**
* NPS Pharmacy does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices because of race, color, religion (creed), sex, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, HIV status, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, protected military status, or any other reason prohibited by law.
* Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC), Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Gender Non-conforming people, and all individuals of diverse backgrounds and lived experiences are encouraged to apply.
* NPS Pharmacy will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with known disabilities unless doing so would result in undue hardship.
* Employment decisions at NPS Pharmacy will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities to provide all individuals equal employment and advancement opportunities.

**TIMELINE, BENEFITS, & PROCESSES.**

* Benefits include competitive compensation ($22-$24 hourly), medical, dental, vision, life insurance, opt-in auxiliary insurance options, Simple IRA matching, HSA (where allowed), generous PTO, 12 paid holidays, professional development, and career growth support.
* Background investigations (e.g., state/federal, OIG) and drug tests (where permissible by law) are required for all new hires as a condition of employment after the job offer is made.

**APPLICATION**

For more information or to submit your resume, email hr@npspharmacy.com. Cover letters are entertained but not required, and **phone calls are not accepted**.

**ABOUT NPS PHARMACY**

NPS Pharmacy (NPS) is on a mission to provide the most culturally competent pharmacy services to patients living with HIV, members of the LGBTQ+ community, communities of color, and patients of low socioeconomic status. Today, nearly 20,000 patients from Ryan White/STD Grantees, AIDS Services Organizations, and Federally Qualified Health Centers nationwide get their pharmacy services from NPS Pharmacy.

Unlike other pharmacy companies, NPS creates a nationwide network of pharmacies where every team member’s #1 priority is the patient. NPS expects every team member to always go above and beyond our industry’s standard to care for every patient—no matter who they are or where they come from. We believe this is accomplished by delivering superior clinical pharmacy service to every patient who walks through our doors.

Unlike our competitors, NPS never puts profit above patients, as our company does not have to answer private investors or venture capital firms. We see ourselves as having a bigger purpose than filling prescriptions and delivering pharmacy services. We believe it is our duty to serve our neighbors, friends, colleagues, and acquaintances as unselfishly as possible and to the highest level of service we can deliver.

**DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, & ACCESS**

NPS is unapologetically accepting and affirming diversity, equity, inclusion, and lived experiences as values shaping our future. We believe in actively fostering a culture that respects, celebrates, and values differences, serving as a catalyst to accomplishing our mission of providing culturally competent healthcare in a safe and affirming environment where all individuals feel welcome, valued, and have equal access to care and services.

**CORE BELIEFS**

1. Make decisions locally, quickly, and **always** in the best interest of patients.

2. Do everything with the highest levels of integrity.

3. Always be 100% honest and transparent.

**PHILANTHROPIC GIVING & SOCIAL IMPACT**

NPS believes in giving back to the communities that have given so much to our company and our patients over the last 23 years. Annually, NPS donates a significant share of its net income to support organizations focused on individuals living with HIV, individuals at risk of contracting HIV or STD/STIs, LGBTQ+ causes, individuals and households of lower socioeconomic status, or individuals from marginalized communities that experience discrimination and stigma.
