title: Irish Dance Teacher
description:
**A rapidly growing dance studio in Richmond, VA is seeking Irish dance instructors.**

**Crossroads Irish Dance offers an energetic environment with inspiring instruction that gives dancers the opportunity to have fun and develop a love of Irish dance, music, and culture. Our studio values community, professionalism, integrity, empath, creativity, excellence, trust, and fun.**

**Our teachers are the driving force behind the learning, development, and leadership of our dancers. Our teachers are empowered to determine the artistic and creative direction for their classes and provide a strong foundation for our dancers.**

**SCHEDULE**

* Contracts may be renewed each year for the new dance season
* We offer classes Monday-Thursday between 4:30-9:00pm and Saturdays 9:00-2:00pm.
* Teachers are assigned out to classes that work best for their skills, training and schedule.
* We will also occasionally run themed camps, so opportunities for more hours and growth.
* Private lessons are also an option for scheduling which are frequently requested by our dancers.
* We strive to offer a work/life balance with our teachers as most of our staff go to school and work outside of the studio.
* Many of our teachers hold dual roles in the studio to be involved and increase their training.
* So candidates will have opportunities for advancement to move into other roles in the studio if possible in addition to teaching if they desire.
* Candidate must be able to attend various community events and Spring Showcase. (these dates are provided to you in advance).

**PAY RATE**

* This is a part time position with a starting hourly rate of $18, which is commensurate based on experience and/or certifications.
* Teachers are paid an hourly wage based on years of experience and training.
* We offer professional development and certification pay/reimbursement.
* We also provide additional compensation to teachers for attending events, any administrative tasks and bonus stipends.
* Discount and other perks also included.

**TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Our teachers must be able to work in an environment that can be loud and filled with the squeals and laughter of young children up to our fun and calm Adults.
* Educators are placed in classes that best fit their skills, abilities, and personality..
* Our teachers must be team players who can work collaboratively with the leadership team of the studio, communicate effectively, and manage stressful situations with kindness, empathy, and love.
* We are looking for a clever, creative, tech-savvy, smart-working, driven and detail-oriented star to join our team.
* You'll already be excellent and passionate about delivering outstanding education and service as well as being excited to work on administrative tasks.
* You'll have outstanding attention to detail and a strong drive to provide an out of this world experience each and every class.

**THE DAY TO DAY - What You'll Be Doing Exactly**

**Teaching**

* Establishes and nurtures a fun, creative, safe, and welcoming environment.
* Make an effort to form a relationship with every student
* Follows and supports all processes and procedures for the studio.
* Creates a classroom environment that is fun and conducive to learning and appropriate to the developmental level of the students.
* Implements a variety of instructional techniques and sources that meet the needs and capabilities of the student (s).
* Guides the learning process towards the achievement of curriculum goals and within the context of these goals, establishes clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects with the ability to communicate these objectives effectively to students.
* Develop and apply artistry, creativity and musicality through ideas and listening skills.
* Offering recommendations and evaluations to students/parents throughout the season to encourage their love of dance, expose them to new styles, build their confidence and support the studio's re-enrollment rate.
* Establishes high expectations for success and classroom behavior.
* Choreographs routines and selects music/costumes for shows/events that are age/level appropriate.
* Brings new ideas to improve services, systems and processes and encourages/ supports the growth of the studio.
* You must be at least an 8 out of 10 when it comes to loving and understanding technology.

**Customer Experience**

* Takes the extra mile to engage customers.
* Develops and fosters student and parent relationships through professional, courteous, and efficient service.
* Maintains open lines of communication with students, parents and faculty.
* Responses to inquiries within 24hrs with professionalism and excellence.

**Organization & Administration**

* Manages and completes all work tasks through software/systems .
* Provides feedback on methods and techniques to improve processes and enhance our vision

**IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE**

* Dance Training: Has training and education in Irish dance and is knowledgeable of techniques, vocabulary and skills as related to Irish dance. Certification is a bonus, but not required. We would love a candidate looking to work towards certification as certification training and reimbursement is provided.
* Self-Motivated and Excellent Direction-Taker: You know how to prioritize the most important tasks (at times with minimal guidance), and how to think on your feet. At the same time, you pride yourself in your ability to take direction and deliver the desired result.
* Excellent Communication Skills: You understand the nuances of email communication, and can handle even the most challenging situations with professionalism and warmth. You're also committed to keeping your supervisor “in the know” about your progress. (No one has to ever chase you down!)
* Excellent Grammar and Punctuation: You pride yourself on catching every typo!
* Deadline-Obsessed and Detail-Oriented: You love doing tasks on time, and checking them off your checklist! In fact, you are one of those people who don't understand how some people can be so disorganized and tardy. Responding to emails with a sense of urgency and care is a source of pride.
* Personal Responsibility: If you make a mistake, you take 100% responsibility and fast action to remedy the situation. Able to communicate with Manager and/or co-workers when needing assistance with a task to meet a deadline or due to being overwhelmed or stuck.
* Customer Empathy: Imagining yourself in a customer's shoes, you respond with empathy and have an ability to not take grumpy or terse emails personally. You see yourself as a bridge between company needs and customer needs. You know when it's appropriate to be friendly and accommodating and when to be firm.

**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS**

Candidates must be able to:

* Build relationships among the students, families, and staff.
* Willing to work with other staff as a team.
* Have strong communication and organizational skills.
* Have a strong understanding of HOW to teach skills- not just how to do the skills.
* Know how to make our dancers shine and feel confident.

Candidates must:

* Have at previous dance training/education in the field of Irish dance.
* Possess a strong desire and commitment to engage, encourage and motivate students to reach their goals.
* Possess a desire to learn and grow with the studio.
* Be punctual and reliable.
* Assess student progress, maintain student discipline, and comfortable working with parents to discuss progress and problem areas.
* Demonstrate the ability to be patient, dependable, enthusiastic, attentive to detail, resourceful, organized, and detail-oriented problem solver, and work with a team as well as, independently.
* Have the ability to always present a professional disposition inside and outside the studio.
* Be able to follow well-defined processes and procedures and guidelines including multiple deadlines.
* Have reliable transportation to get to all necessary destinations.

**STUDIO PERKS**

* Flexible scheduling
* Direct Deposit-Payroll
* Family/life balance
* Family community
* Major holidays off
* On the Spot Bonus opportunities
* Delights and surprises by CEO throughout the season
* Substitute Pay (Time and half)
* Additional pay/compensation for duties outside the classroom to include, but not limited to, events, competitions, admin work and more.
* Opportunities to hold additional positions within the studio on other teams
* Paid professional development and teacher certification opportunities
* Teachers receive complimentary tickets to our annual showcase
* Additional compensation with private lessons, community events, and more

**Think you or someone you know might be the right fit?**

Send an email to amy@crossroadsirish.com to let us know you are interested. Attach a current resume to your email and send with the subject line Teacher

**About Crossroads Irish Dance**

Crossroads Irish Dance is one of the leading Irish dance institutions in Richmond, VA. Established in 2001, we have committed ourselves to provide quality and age-appropriate instruction in a fun, upbeat, welcoming environment that is encouraging for all. No matter what class or level you’re in, our dance family and the team are a super dedicated, passionate, and supportive group of people. We create an atmosphere that sets dancers up for success as they discover their own Crossroads journey. We aim to encourage a widespread love of dance, welcoming children and adults who want to be a part of our family.

title: DoD Business Development and Capture Manager
description:
**Job Title:** **DoD Business Development and Capture Manager**  
**Location:** **Remote**  
**Employment Type:** **Full-Time**

**Overview:**  
We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven **DoD Business Development and Capture Manager** with deep experience in the **Department of Defense (DoD)** sector. This individual will be responsible for identifying, qualifying, and capturing new business opportunities aligned with the company’s strategic goals in the federal defense space. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of DoD procurement processes, established relationships within the defense community, and a proven track record of winning competitive federal contracts.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Business Development:**

* Ex-federal employees or those retiring or transitioning from the DoD into the commercial sector with strong relationships across defense agencies are highly encouraged to apply.
* Identify and assess new business opportunities within the DoD ecosystem.
* Build and maintain relationships with DoD clients, partners, and stakeholders.
* Develop and execute strategic account plans and opportunity pursuit strategies.
* Conduct market research and competitive analysis to inform pursuit decisions.
* Represent the company at industry events, trade shows, and client meetings.

**Capture Management:**

* Lead and manage all phases of the capture process from opportunity identification through proposal submission.
* Develop and implement capture strategies, win themes, discriminators, and pricing strategies.
* Coordinate with internal teams including proposal management, technical leads, pricing, and contracts.
* Manage partnerships, including teaming arrangements, NDAs, and subcontractor negotiations.
* Conduct Black Hat reviews, competitive assessments, and customer call plans.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Political Science, or related field (Master’s preferred).
* 8+ years of experience in business development and capture management in the federal space, with a focus on DoD.
* Demonstrated success capturing large, complex, full-and-open federal contracts (ideally $50M+).
* Deep understanding of DoD acquisition lifecycle and procurement vehicles (e.g., GSA, GWACs, IDIQs, OTAs).
* Strong network of DoD contacts and knowledge of key defense agencies (e.g., Army, Navy, Air Force, DLA).
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and leadership skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Active security clearance (Secret or above).
* Experience with emerging DoD technologies such as AI/ML, cyber, C5ISR, space, or defense logistics.
* Familiarity with Shipley or other industry-standard capture methodologies.
* Experience with CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce, GovWin, Deltek).

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Experience:

* DOD (United States Department of Defense): 1 year (Required)
* business development and capture management : 8 years (Required)

The Director of Sales (DOS) is responsible for directing the sales and marketing efforts of the hotel in order to maximize revenue.

**Account Management and New Business Development**

* Executes all aspects of the sales and marketing plans to surpass revenue goals. This includes making outside sales calls and cold calls while maintaining relationships with current accounts.
* Builds and maintains relationships with key clients. Creates and solicits new business through innovative means.

**Management/Supervisory Responsibilities**

· Directly supervises the Sales and Marketing staff.

· Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, training, directing work, and appraising performance of associates. Also tasked with resolving employee relations issues and rewarding/disciplining associates.

· Oversees the activities of staff members in order to ensure adherence to hotel policies and procedures.

· Responsible for coaching and evaluating the sales and marketing teams’ sales techniques in order to help achieve revenue target's

**Guest Service**

* Responsible for resolving escalated customer relations issues.
* Answers inquiries pertaining to hotel policies and services.
* Responsible for positively representing and promoting the property.
* Ensures systems and procedures are in place and followed for guest safety and security.

**Financial and Marketing Business Analysis**

* Prepares the yearly and quarterly Sales and Marketing budgets as well as the annual marketing plan.
* Responsible for revenue forecasting.
* Develops business plans as needed.
* Oversees advertising and marketing campaigns for the hotel.
* Works with General Manager to analyze sales and marketing reports.

* Assists with sales and marketing efforts as needed

**SKILLS, EDUCATIONAL BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE**

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent years of relevant work experience required.
* 5+ years of hotel sales experience required.
* Prior hotels sales management or Director of Sales/Sales Manager experience highly preferred.
* Prior experience using Windows-based software including Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook highly preferred.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.
* Strong selling and negotiating skills.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Superior customer service skills.
* Ability to work independently.

title: Produce Manager
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Produce Manager to oversee the daily operations of our produce department. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the highest quality of fresh produce is available to our customers while managing inventory, sales, and staff. This role requires strong leadership skills, a passion for customer service, and an understanding of retail operations within a grocery store environment.

**Duties**

* Manage the daily operations of the produce department, ensuring all products meet quality standards.
* Oversee inventory management, including ordering, receiving, and stocking fresh produce.
* Implement effective inventory control measures to minimize waste and maximize profitability.
* Train, supervise, and motivate staff to provide excellent customer service and maintain department standards.
* Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations in the handling and storage of produce.
* Utilize retail math skills to analyze sales data and make informed decisions regarding product placement and promotions.
* Handle cash register operations accurately, including cash handling procedures.
* Maintain an organized and visually appealing display of produce to enhance customer shopping experience.
* Collaborate with other departments to ensure seamless store operations.

**Experience**

* Previous experience in grocery store management or a similar retail environment is preferred.
* Strong background in inventory management and control practices.
* Proven skills in cash handling and operating cash registers.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively.
* Experience in sales management within a retail context is a plus.
* A commitment to providing outstanding customer service is essential.

Join our team as a Produce Manager where you can make a difference by delivering fresh, high-quality products while leading a dedicated team!

Founded in 1997 by Thierry Gillier, Zadig&Voltaire has redefined the very essence of luxury for a new generation. It is an exciting, highly successful French brand offering luxury fashion for women, men and kids. Indifferent to the norms, dictates, and codes of traditional luxury, the House has revealed over time its passion for freedom, an aspiration that fuels its creativity and perpetuates its audacity. Influenced by musical worlds, steeped in contemporary art, and distinctly Parisian, the brand has made duality its signature.

The spirit of the brand is eternally youthful, encouraging its community to cherish uniqueness. Zadig&Voltaire emphasize the importance of expressing yourself, loving yourself, and cultivating an independent mind, to be free, again and again! Zadig&Voltaire is dedicated to nurturing the talents of tomorrow and supporting the development of its employees' skills in all the countries where the brand is present. Just like its founder, Zadig&Voltaire is an artistic company where employees are encouraged to be entrepreneurial and agile in a context of strong growth. Zadig&Voltaire fully embraces the complex challenges of the 21st century by actively engaging in its global sustainability program VoltAIRe.

As an evolving global brand, Zadig & Voltaire is looking for talented people to get involved.

Zadig & Voltaire is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Residential HVAC Service/Maintenance Technician Must have experience
description:
*You’re great at what you do and you want to join a team that appreciates you, where you can create your own opportunities.*

***What We Offer***

* Our top performers are among the highest paid technicians in North Canton. You’ll have unlimited earning potential.
* Company supplied, take it home at night, company truck.
* Medical Insurance.
* 401k Plan.
* Limited on-call rotation.
* A family atmosphere. This is last on the list because it’s most important. We care about our team, and expect you to bring that same caring when you join.

***What We Do***

We are a team of expert home service providers who go the extra mile to ensure peak performance for our clients home heating and air conditioning systems.

***Who We Are***

We keep on growing because we only hire the best most personable technicians, and our customers love us for it. We’ve been at this since 1985 here in North Canton and Massillon. You’ve probably seen our trucks and our ads. What you don’t know is what it’s like to be a part of a team like this. How much you feel appreciated when you don’t cut corners. How much we inspire ongoing training and education. How it feels to have customers rave about you and demand that you’re the only technician that works in their home. How much you can earn when you truly are the best. People often come to us looking for a job. They stay with us because they find a fulfilling career, room to grow, and opportunities to excel.

***The Big Task***

You will maintain, diagnose and repair heating and cooling systems and lead customers to informed and confident buying decisions by providing an extraordinary customer experience.

***Key Sub Tasks***

* First thing, maintain a positive attitude.
* Maintain communication with our dispatcher, your manager, parts and installation teams.
* Keep your company truck clean, inside and out.
* Keep your truck inventory up to date.
* Properly complete all paperwork.
* Join the limited on-call rotation.
* Maintain a clean and professional appearance.
* Have and maintain a clean driving record.
* Have and maintain a clear background.
* Participate in training allowing you to grow and develop as a professional.
* Have or be willing to get the proper certifications. We can help you with this.

***Desired Skills and Experience***

If you can achieve the above and you find it fun and challenging - you have just the right amount of skill and experience.

* Minimum of 3 years residential HVAC service diagnostic
* Minimum of 2 years residential HVAC preventative maintenance
* Have and EPA license with a minimum Type-2 certification

If you want to be part of something bigger than just a job – make this career move and find exactly what you’re looking for. You will work in a place where you will be appreciated by the team and our clients, and where the work you do has a direct effect on our customers and your earnings. If this sounds like you, please spend a little time learning about Quality Heating and Cooling by visiting www.qualityheatingandcooling.com.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Brand Marketing Coordinator, NBCU News Group
description:
**Company Description**

NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.

Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('Versant') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin-off is expected to be completed during 2025.

 **Job Description**

As the **Brand Marketing Coordinator**, you will serve as a core team member for consumer-focused marketing communications for NBC News brands (NBC Nightly News, Meet the Press, NBC News NOW, and NBC News digital platforms). This role supports the team responsible for strategic brand marketing activities including daily advertising and promotion, consumer events, and digital and cross-platform marketing. They will report into the Manager, Brand Marketing and will have the opportunity to work closely with the larger NBC News Marketing team.

**Responsibilities**:

* Support the Brand Marketing team (Vice President, Director, Sr. Manager and Manager) on the development and execution of daily consumer-focused marketing communications
* Manage daily project status documents and communicate priorities and deliverables with the cross-functional team (including morning and end of day snapshot emails, creative deadlines, deliverable specs)
* Work with Creative team to create and distribute daily on-air and social promotion graphics
* Maintain an organized, up-to-date asset library and coordinate and distribute brand creative assets for internal and external partners
* Manage requests from cross-company departments and partners (ad sales marketing, PR, digital, distribution partners) to create and distribute creative assets to be used in various channels for brand promotion
* Support the Sr. Manager on local marketing efforts, including building and deploying daily email communications to local NBC station news teams
* Monitor competitive marketing activity and provide regular reporting to the team
* General administrative support (e.g., scheduling meetings), assist with organizing department activities, meetings, and presentations
* Oversee the team’s NBC Page on specific projects

  
**Qualifications**  

* At least 2 years of relevant experience—internships and/or professional roles—in media organizations, advertising firms, or media agencies preferred
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent relevant experience
* Must be willing to work outside of normal business hours (including weekends) to respond to breaking news or other timely promotional needs
* Must be willing to attend occasional events, including early mornings and some weekends
* Willing and able to work in NYC
* Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV through nbcunicareers.com to be considered
* Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Organized and solution-oriented, with a high level of attention to detail and follow-through
* Eager to work in the fast-paced, ever-changing news world
* An excellent communicator with a strong ability to conduct effective in-person and email communications
* Able to prioritize and juggle numerous projects and deadlines
* Self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and with a team

**Additional Job Requirements:**

* **Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website. **Salary range**: $50,000 - $60,000

 **Additional Information**

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

Although you'll be hired as an NBCU employee, your employment and the responsibilities associated with this job likely will transition to Versant in the future. By joining at this pivotal time, you'll be a part of this exciting company as it takes shape.

title: Account Success Associate
description:
Account Success Associate

**Location:** Flexible (Remote U.S.), ideally based in Toronto, Denver, or Austin  
**Type:** Full-time | Customer Experience Team  
**Compensation:** $105,000 OTE (Base + Quarterly Bonuses)

**About Vendoroo**

Vendoroo is building the humanoid AI workforce for the built world. Our AI coworkers, or “Roos”, handle specialized operational roles like maintenance coordination, vendor communication, and resident support. They scale instantly, never churn, and execute with precision. Our customers don’t just use Vendoroo, they hire it.

We’re helping property operators replace chaos with intelligent coordination. As smart as our Roos are today, they'll always have more to learn and new opportunities to surprise and delight our customers. To maintain long-term trust and deliver ongoing value, we still need a human who can lead change, build on early successes, and act as a strategic partner to clients as their businesses grow and evolve with us.

That’s where you come in.

**The Role**

As an Account Success Associate, you’ll be the primary steward of the client relationship after onboarding and early adoption are complete. Your job: ensure every client continues to see value, deepens their knowledge and use of our Roos, and views Vendoroo as their trusted growth partner as their business evolves..

This role is a mix of project manager, product trainer, change management guide, and customer advocate. You’ll be handed the reins from our onboarding team then your goal is to maintain and expand the trust and value created during the client’s onboarding journey.

You’ll work across departments-Sales, Product, and Operations-to make sure every client utilizes best practices, maintains adoption, and understands the ROI we are delivering.

**What You’ll Own and Drive**

**Continuity of Value Post–Go-Live**  
Take over client relationships at the 90-day mark and continue to drive adoption, usage maturity, and ROI visibility well into their journey. Build upon the foundation laid during onboarding to maximize retention and long-term satisfaction.

**Client Health & Impact Measurement**  
Monitor leading indicators of client health, utilization trends, and friction points. Track and report on key metrics like NRR, feature adoption, and realized savings. Share insights regularly with clients to reinforce outcomes and identify risks early.

**Feedback & Product Advocacy**  
Serve as the client’s internal advocate. Document emerging use cases, unmet needs, and enhancement requests. Collaborate with Product and Ops to prioritize improvements that support your accounts and similar segments.

**Product Expansion & Education**  
Introduce clients to new capabilities, bundles, and workflows. Partner with Sales when it’s time to expand. Provide light-touch enablement for new features and identify training opportunities when needed.

**Strategic Account Partnering**  
Become a trusted advisor. Understand your clients’ goals, workflows, and team structure. Act as an extension of their operations team-embedding Roo more deeply into their business and driving strategic alignment.

**You Might Be a Fit If:**

* You’ve worked in a customer-facing SaaS onboarding, CX, or implementation role—ideally in a startup or high-growth environment and property management space
* You’ve worked with property operators, real estate platforms, or operationally intense industries
* You’re naturally proactive, clear in your communication, and organized under pressure
* You enjoy making customers feel smart, supported, and excited about the future
* You love to dive in and understand a product better than anyone and can turn data into action
* You understand how to actively listen and connect the dots between a real, or perceived, painpoint and product functionality.
* You get excited when a customer is facing a challenge and have a bias towards action to help them solve it. Whether it’s through product functionality or coaching them through an internal change you feel that these moments are shared wins.

**Why This Role Matters**

* You’re the ongoing connector between the customer, operations, and product. A defined point of entry of the feedback loop and a critical part of how Vendoroo maintains its competitive advantage.
* You’ll define the meaning of what "continuity of value” and “continuity of trust” really means in property operations
* You’ll help create a repeatable, scalable account support experience for the entire company
* You’ll directly influence NPS, adoption, and retention—one account at a time
* You’ll shape how property operators transition into the age of AI teammates

If you’ve read this far and are convinced in your desire to be a Roo, we want to hear from you.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $105,000.00 per year

* Health insurance

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Quarterly bonus

title: Parts Coordinator
description:
**Job Overview**  
The Parts Coordinator plays a critical role in the efficient operation of our autobody collision shop. This position involves managing the inventory of parts, ensuring timely procurement, and coordinating the availability of parts for repair jobs. The ideal candidate will possess strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and a passion for the automotive industry.

**Duties**

* - \\*\\*Inventory Management:\\*\\* Track and maintain the inventory of parts and supplies required for vehicle repairs, ensuring optimal levels to meet demand while minimizing excess.
* - \\*\\*Ordering Parts:\\*\\* Source and order parts from suppliers, negotiating prices and delivery times as necessary to ensure timely availability for repair jobs.
* - \\*\\*Receiving and Inspecting Parts:\\*\\* Receive new parts shipments, check for accuracy and quality, and enter inventory into the system.
* - \\*\\*Coordination with Technicians:\\*\\* Work closely with the repair technicians to understand parts needs for current and upcoming jobs, ensuring they have the necessary components to complete repairs efficiently.
* - \\*\\*Record Keeping:\\*\\* Maintain accurate records of parts orders, inventory levels, and usage. Prepare reports as requested by management.
* - \\*\\*Customer Service:\\*\\* Provide excellent customer service by answering questions regarding parts availability and status of orders, and assisting with any special requests.
* - \\*\\*Collaboration:\\*\\* Communicate regularly with management and repair staff to facilitate smooth operations and address any issues related to parts supply.

**Skills**

* Proven experience in procurement management within the automotive industry.
* Strong skills in sourcing and buying automotive parts from OEM suppliers.
* Excellent customer service abilities with a focus on client satisfaction.
* Familiarity with CCC, OPS, and Collision Link management systems.
* Strong analytical skills to assess pricing and market trends effectively.
* Knowledge of automotive service processes is a plus.

Join our team as a Parts Manager where you will play a crucial role in ensuring our operations run smoothly while delivering outstanding service to our customers.

Pay: From $800.00 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Hose Assembly
description:
Venair (www.venair.com) is a leading engineering and manufacturing company of silicone hoses and flexible silicone pieces for the most demanding sectors, such as pharmaceutical, biotechnology and aerospace. We provide innovative custom solutions according to our customers' requirements.  
The Group was established in 1986. Nowadays Venair has 33 sales branches distributed in Europe, Africa, Asia and America, 5 manufacturing centers and employs more than 350 people around the world.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DqkcBVUcYNs

At VENAIR INC, we owe our success to the high quality of our products and services. To help maintain and grow this standard, we’re seeking an experienced Hose Assembly Technician – Warehouse Technician to oversee daily activities in our office located in Merrimack, New Hampshire. As an ideal candidate, you’ll taking care of loading and unloading trucks, operating the forklift, perform any hose assemblies, package and keeping the warehouse in perfect conditions. You’ll be highly skilled in operating forklift, hydraulic crimping machine and perform the product packaging with attention to detail due to the critical product handled or be willing to learn.

The main tasks and responsibilities for this role are listed below:

* Prepare the required hose assemblies.
* Package the required orders and fill the required assembly reports.
* Weight and measure the packages and provide the required information to the Operations Manager to prepare the documentation (Invoice, Delivery Note and so on).
* Perform quarterly stock audit.
* Coordinate with Operations Manager on the order of any products, consumables or services.
* Other related tasks.

The essential requirements for this position are listed below:

* Previous experience in handling electrical equipment, hydraulic press or similar preferred.
* Experience in reading mechanical drawing and assembling of industrial parts.
* Ability to precisely measure and document mechanical dimensions.
* Match skills to make calculations for crimp specifications (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division).
* Manually dexterity to utilize hand tools and equipment.
* Ability to operate forklift or stacker.
* Cleanliness and attention to detail.

The benefits we offer are:

* A competitive compensation package.
* A comprehensive training.

* International environment.

title: Community Relations Manager
description:
The Vista at Hammock Cove in Naples is currently looking for a Community Relations Manager. This perfect person for this position is someone proficient in the Business Office Manager position and who also has a flair for sales.

A **Community Relations Manager** is responsible for overseeing the business office functions at our assisted living facility. This role typically manages the A/P, A/R, payroll and financial tasks necessary to ensure smooth daily operations. This position also supports the community sales functions which include working with inquiries interested in touring, supporting families throughout the move-in process and planning the community's sales events.

Here’s an overview of the job responsibilities and qualifications that are often required for such a position:

**Key Responsibilities**:

* **Financial Management**:
* Book revenues and process billing
* Manage accounts payable/receivable processes.
* Handle payroll and other financial tasks.
* **Onboarding and Training Support**:
* Assist with hiring and onboarding of new staff.
* Maintain employee records and ensure compliance with labor laws and facility policies.
* Oversee and track employee training.
* Keep community in compliance with all local, state, and federal regulations regarding employee records
* **Customer Service**:
* Hire, manage, train and schedule the concierge staff
* Act as a point of contact for families, residents, and vendors when appropriate
* **Marketing and Admissions**:
* Assist with managing inquiries, tours, and information for potential residents.
* Process new resident admissions and maintain relevant records as required by all pertinent regulations
* Greet new residents and manage their orientation to our community

**Required Qualifications**:

* **Education**:
* Requires an associate's degree or higher in business administration, healthcare management, or a related field.
* **Experience**:
* Previous experience in office management, preferably in a healthcare or senior care setting.
* Familiarity with financial software, time keeping software and billing systems in an assisted living environment.
* Experience in leadership and team building is a must
* **Skills**:
* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Proficiency in office software (e.g., Microsoft Office, Excel) and the ability to learn specialized software.
* Basic understanding of accounting principles and financial management.
* **Personal Attributes**:
* Compassionate and empathetic attitude toward residents and families.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a focus on customer service and operational efficiency.

This position is ideal for someone who enjoys a mix of administrative duties, sales and human interaction, with a focus on helping elderly residents live comfortably in a senior living environment.

title: Blaster - ONLY BLASTERS SHOULD APPLY
description:
**EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY -** ONLY BLASTERS SHOULD APPLY

**Blaster**

**Location: North Antelope Rochelle Mine**

**Position:** Design, layout, prepare and detonate planned explosive related blasts with correct products, measured quantities, safe application, and effective use of explosives in alignment with Service Operations Manual to meet customer's requirements at locations serviced by WESCO. Lead blast crew and provide on-the-job training. Willing to train.

**Experience:** 1-2 years of experience as a blaster. Experience preferred but not required. ONLY BLASTERS SHOULD APPLY.

**Technical Requirements:**

-Advanced computer skills

-Knowledge of the Dyno Nobel electronic initiation system, but not required. Will provide on-the-job training

-Maintain current blasting licenses along with any certifications required by federal, state and county entities

-Must satisfy the requirements for a “possessor of explosives” as defined by the B.A.T.F.

**Essential Functions:**

-Practices behavior consistent with company policies and procedures from applicable technical modules, all company SOP, work site, regulatory and safety policies, and procedures.

-Thorough knowledge of products, product applications, blasting practices, and mining\\quarry\\construction principles.

-General knowledge and understanding explosives technology, basic geology, and seismology.

-Design the appropriate use of explosives to properly fit the customers.

-Able to manage any unusual blasting scenarios

-Responsible for the day-to-day management of blasting crew, all inventory records, and other appropriate documentation required at site.

-Ability to step in to manager role as required

-Lead blast crew while providing on-the-job training

-Investigate all product complaints and poor performing blasts and report these to management and the Technical Service Resource.

-Safety focus at all times. Report potentially unsafe conditions. Use equipment and materials properly.

-Develop professional relationships with customers. Participate in customer safety processes

-Understand and enhance service requirements to continually improve customer profitability

**Working Environment:** Must be able to work primarily outdoors in all weather conditions of temperature and climate. Physically travel between offices and remote field locations. Must wear personal protective equipment where required. May require lifting of up to 60 lbs.

**Schedule:** Shift is generally four days on, four days off, continuously. Schedule includes weekends and holidays.

**Pay:** Starting at$27.00/hr., depending on experience

**Benefits:** WESCO provides a competitive benefit package which includes medical, dental, vision, company-paid life insurance, and 401k plan with company match. Along with holiday pay, sick leave, and paid vacation.

description:
We are looking for a reliable, skilled property manger that can also do maintenance work. Perform essential upkeep tasks throughout our Marshall, MN and Redwood Falls, MN properties for approximately 40 hours/week between the 2 properties. In this position, you will be responsible for a wide variety of activities such as repairs, cleaning and onsite leasing and compliance paperwork to ensure that our facilities are both tidy and functional. Being reliable and self-motivated with a keen eye for detail is essential in this job, as the ideal candidate will preferably have previous maintenance work and property management experience and solid technical knowledge. You should have the manual dexterity and physical stamina necessary for this work. This position will require some travel to our Marshall, MN site with the Redwood Falls, MN site as being the home base. Milage is paid when you travel.

**Start Date:** within 2 weeks

**Duties to include Maintenance:**

– Maintenance of buildings & units

– Light painting, landscaping, carpentry and turnover of units when tenants vacate

– Minor plumbing & electrical repairs

– Snow removal from walkways

**Qualifications:** Successful candidates should have a valid drivers license and reliable transportation. Knowledge in plumbing, HVAC, and electrical. Experience in apartment maintenance preferred, but not required. Must have excellent customer service skills, be a team player, self-motivator and have their own tools.

2. Be available to take phone calls and e-mails and respond to them accordingly.

10. Address resident issues to the best of your abilities and any necessary paperwork

11. Keep all common areas clean and presentable.

12. Walk the property on a consistent basis to check for cleanliness, maintenance issues, hazards, and tenant issues on the property.

14. Shovel and salt building sidewalks and stoops.

16. Consult with contractor(s) for any required site work.

18. Ensure all fire alarms are tested monthly and keep accurate records.

19. All other tasks assigned by your supervisor

20. Work in accordance with fair housing

title: District Operations Manager
description:
About Us

LA Fitness is a fast-paced health club company and is one of four brands included in the 730 health clubs in the U.S. and Canada all company owned and operated by Fitness International, LLC. To fulfill this mission, we have created this network of health clubs, where we offer our members the widest range of amenities and the friendliest service at an affordable price. We continue to grow locations and services offered, having launched this year a new brand called Club Studio. If you join us, it’s an opportunity to grow along with us and 28,000 other employees of the largest privately held health club chain in the world.

Our District Operations Managers combine a passion for health and fitness with motivational leadership, proficiency in selecting and retaining talented managers, experience with vendor relations and property management, and exceptional customer issue resolution skills to create an environment that will help as many people as possible achieve the benefits of a healthy lifestyle. title: Machine Maintenance and Installation Technician
description:
This role requires a hands-on professional who can handle the technical demands of installing, de-installing, aligning, and preparing complex machinery—including CNC equipment—for transport and recommissioning.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Safely install, de-install, and relocate CNC and industrial equipment for a variety of clients including aerospace, medical, manufacturing, and defense industries.
* Conduct full machine diagnostics and condition reports before decommissioning, documenting any operational issues or special handling requirements.
* Disassemble complex machines with attention to sequencing, component labeling, and protection of sensitive elements (ball screws, spindles, wiring looms, etc.).
* Label and organize wiring, hydraulic lines, and hardware to ensure a smooth and error-free recommissioning process.
* Utilize precision tools (such as laser alignment systems, optical tooling, dial indicators, and machinist levels) to align, level, and calibrate machines post-move.
* Interpret mechanical, electrical, and fluid schematics to aid in both de-installation and reinstallation.
* Troubleshoot CNC and PLC-controlled equipment, verify control logic, test motor function, and assist with I/O checkouts during recommissioning.
* Work directly with rigging crews to plan critical lift paths, machine orientation for egress, and safe removal under tight clearances or height restrictions.
* Oversee or assist in crating, blocking, and bracing machinery for over-the-road transport, ensuring compliance with DOT safety standards.
* Prepare machines for transport by ensuring fluids are drained, moving parts are locked out, and high-precision components are protected against vibration or moisture.
* Coordinate with electricians, millwrights, and outside vendors on complex power drops, disconnects, and reconnections.
* Assist in start-up and recommissioning procedures, including program loading, zero return, spindle warm-up, and part test verification when required.
* Serve as technical liaison to customers, explaining work performed and helping resolve installation or function issues.
* Complete and submit accurate and timely documentation for all job activities, including condition reports, punch lists, service checklists, time sheets, and sign-offs.
* Help manage inventory of rigging and maintenance tools, identifying when service or calibration is needed.
* Train and mentor apprentices or junior techs, enforcing company procedures and best practices on mechanical integrity and customer service.
* Operate powered industrial equipment including forklifts, scissor lifts, telehandlers, and overhead cranes in compliance with site-specific and OSHA safety requirements.
* Enforce and model rigorous jobsite safety standards, including PPE usage, lockout/tagout procedures, confined space awareness, and lift planning.
* Remain flexible and adaptable to highly dynamic job schedules and environments, with willingness to travel and work extended hours when required.
* Work with dispatch and project managers to provide real-time updates and change management when field conditions differ from planned scope.
* Provide feedback on customer sites to help the sales team develop accurate quoting, better timelines, and recurring service opportunities**.**

**Qualifications:**

* 3+ years of experience in industrial machinery maintenance, installation, or CNC operations.
* Strong understanding of basic CNC programming and diagnostics (Fanuc, Haas, Siemens, etc.)
* Ability to read and interpret mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic schematics.
* Skilled in using tools and equipment for aligning, leveling, and setting heavy machinery.
* Comfortable working in a variety of industrial environments and on customer sites.
* Valid driver’s license; ability to travel locally or regionally as required.
* OSHA 10/30 or other safety certifications a plus.

**Preferred Experience:**

* Background in machine tool installation, millwright work, or rigging support.
* Forklift or crane certification is a strong plus.
* Experience working in a fast-paced, safety-focused machinery-moving environment.

 **About MEI Rigging & Crating:**

Nationwide rigging, machinery moving, millwrighting, mechanical installation, commercial storage, crating and export packing services for when the stakes are high.
company_description: MEI Rigging & Crating is one of the largest U.S. providers of rigging, machinery moving, millwrighting, mechanical installation, industrial storage, crating and export packing services.

title: CRATING OPERATIONS MANAGER
description:
The Crating Operations Manager position is responsible for supervision of crating and warehouse crews including department management and customer interfacing.

**Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for all activities of the crating operation from crating department management to scheduling of crews.

* Develops, plans and implements schedules for crating crew in alignment with customer work orders and jobs.

* Directs workforce to meet operational goals in terms of volume, cost, quality, safety, and schedule.

* Directly supervises one or more crating supervisors, leads and crating department drivers.

* Hire, coach, train and manage the performance of crating crew with best management practices.

* Develop, train and instruct crating crews in best known operation practices and procedures with an emphasis on safety.

* Work closely with safety personnel in coordinating safety training, accident and injury investigations and reporting and equipment or property damage incidents investigations and reporting.

* Effectively manage work projects & jobs by organizing all project information to ensure they are accurate and contain all necessary information.

* May participate in selection of company crating equipment assets.

* Direct oversight, purchasing, vendor management and inventory responsibility for crating department materials.

* Facilitate dangerous goods packaging and shipping administration in compliance with International Air Transport Association (IATA) requirements including declarations and maintaining active IATA certification and IMDG (International Maritime Dangerous Goods) and DOT 49.CFR (domestic hazardous materials)

* Purchase and upkeep of the day-to-day crating equipment and hand tools.

* Work collectively with local and corporate accounting administration to ensure accurate and timely customer invoices and payments (AR).

* Work closely with the sales team to manage customer complaints by investigating problems; developing solutions; preparing reports; making recommendations to management.

* Participate in sales as needed on customer bids/estimates to accurately price projects.

* Actively participate in MEI’s leadership and management meetings as requested.

* Build customer and employee relationships with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

* Develop highly effective relationships with customers, business partners, rigging operations management and support staff.

* Consistently demonstrates professional conduct representative of MEI corporate mission, vision and values.

* Develops professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.

* Consistently gain knowledge regarding industry and market information and trends

* Local travel required for client site meetings and job walks.

**Minimum Qualifications (Experience, Skills, and Education):**

* High School diploma or equivalent with continuing education in Business, Project or Construction Management or related degree a plus.

* Minimum three (3) years proven operations management experience or comparable field preferably within the construction, manufacturing, warehousing or crating industry.

* Excellent interpersonal, management, supervisory and project management skills.

* Highly self-directed and motivated.

* Embraces our Values, Vision, Mission and Company Culture

* Ability to use Microsoft Office Applications and other business software (such as Wright Plan/CRM) as needed.

* Valid driver’s license and acceptable driving record

**Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to climb, stand; walk; sit; lift and/or move up to 50 pounds; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; use fingers and hands. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The Crating Operations Manager is subject to possible exposure to extreme year-round outdoor environmental conditions and may also be subject to working weekends and holidays.

  
**About MEI Rigging & Crating:**

Nationwide rigging, machinery moving, millwrighting, mechanical installation, commercial storage, crating and export packing services for when the stakes are high.
company_description: MEI Rigging & Crating is one of the largest U.S. providers of rigging, machinery moving, millwrighting, mechanical installation, industrial storage, crating and export packing services.

title: Safety Service Patroller - Virginia Beach
description:
**Company Description**

**Work with Us. Change the World.**

At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.

There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.

We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.

 **Job Description**

**AECOM** is seeking passionate talent with a customer focused mindset for Overnight and Evening Safety Service Patrol Operator positions in Virginia Beach, VA. These positions will be a direct report to the Safety Service Patrol (SSP) Supervisor and Management Team with direct public and multi-agency communications. Pay is $22.00hr.

**About this Opportunity**

Virginia’s DOT Safety Service Patroller’s play a key critical role in safeguarding motorists traveling the interstates by ensuring roadways are clear of debris, reporting highway maintenance issues and assisting stranded motorists. Our SSP program operates 7 days a week, 365 days per year, serving a critical role in the delivery of safety and mobility to the motoring public.

As this is a 24/7/365 operation center, schedules are dictated by operational need and stated in advance and will include on call duties. Schedules may vary and individuals selected will be required to successfully complete certification training.

**The responsibilities of the SSP include, but are not limited to:**

* Establishing temporary traffic control for emergency responders and providing scene assistance.
* Detecting incidents and disruptions in traffic.
* Clearing obstructions and debris from the roadway.
* Support reversible roadway and high-occupancy vehicle gate and tunnel operations to ensure safe and incident-free lane change functions. ERO ONLY

**The Safety Service Patrol also offers help to individual motorists, including:**

* Tire change assistance.
* Fuel to get to the nearest gas station.
* Jump starts.
* Water for overheating radiators.
* Phone access to call tow / recovery services.
* Directions.
* To ensure safety, Safety Service Patrol operators are provided with special highly visible, reflective uniforms and drive specially marked vehicles.

Qualifications

**Minimum Requirements:**

* High School Diploma and or equivalent certificate (GED) or 1 year of relevant work experience in lieu of education.
* Be a minimum of 18 years of age.
* Ability to drive, using an AECOM provided vehicle, patrolling and monitoring a segment of interstate roadway in an assigned region.
* Must pass a State and Federal criminal history/security background check; must also successfully complete Virginia Department of Transportation fingerprint-based Criminal History Records Check (CHRC).
* Possess a valid Driver's License and a clean driving record in the last 3 years, including no suspension of license or single violation that the department of motor vehicle treats as worth 6 demerits.
* Employees must also participate in monthly MVR monitoring program and maintain a satisfactory driving record as a condition of employment.
* **Must pass a pre-employment drug screen and successfully participate in the program’s mandatory random drug screening process.**

**Work Environment/Physical requirements – Essential Functions**

* **Physically able, with or without an accommodation, to work in outdoor environments with uneven terrain, variable outdoor conditions including heat, cold, moisture, dust, dryness, noise, and automotive-related chemicals (e.g., fuels, coolants, lubricants, etc.); position requires frequent operation of vehicles. Work around heavy, moving, dangerous equipment; often standing/walking. The essential functions of this job include the:**
* Ability to lift up to 85 pounds.
* Ability to pull/drag a force gauge to produce 160 ft./lbs of force with a contact point of 36 inches off the ground.
* Ability to lift a 40-pound tool bag.
* Ability to perform repetitive bending, stooping, squatting, kneeling, and/or crouching and occasionally work with arms above shoulder level.
* Ability to perform fine motor skills.
* Ability to perform hand gripping/squeezing for hand tools and equipment (levers, jack handles, air compressor, jumper cables etc.).
* Ability to occasionally work at heights less than 4ft.
* Ability to climb stairs.
* Ability to descend/ascend vehicle steps.

**Please Note**: **This position is contingent upon successfully completing functional tests for each essential function identified for this position.**

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Five (5) years of driving experience.
* Prior Safety Service Patrol Operator experience.
* Knowledge/experience of incident management techniques.
* Radio and telecommunications experience.
* Possess or be able and willing to obtain CPR certifications.
* Basic competency in using computers such as laptops, smart pads.
* Working knowledge of basic automotive repair.
* A positive customer service attitude - both to co-workers (internal customers) and external customers.
* Geographic familiarity with regional freeway system and arterial roads.

Additional information

* This position does not include sponsorship for United States work authorization.
* This position does not include relocation benefits.
* This is NOT a remote position but located on the client site locations.
* Opportunities for overtime hours and pay are also available.

**About AECOM**

AECOM is proud to offer comprehensive benefits to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D, disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absences, voluntary benefits, perks, flexible work options, well-being resources, employee assistance program, business travel insurance, service recognition awards, retirement savings plan, and employee stock purchase plan.

AECOM is the global infrastructure leader, committed to delivering a better world. As a trusted professional services firm powered by deep technical abilities, we solve our clients’ complex challenges in water, environment, energy, transportation and buildings. Our teams partner with public- and private-sector clients to create innovative, sustainable and resilient solutions throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm that had revenue of $16.1 billion in fiscal year 2024. Learn more at aecom.com.

**What makes AECOM a great place to work**

You will be part of a global team that champions your growth and career ambitions. Work on groundbreaking projects - both in your local community and on a global scale - that are transforming our industry and shaping the future. With cutting-edge technology and a network of experts, you’ll have the resources to make a real impact. Our award-winning training and development programs are designed to expand your technical expertise and leadership skills, helping you build the career you’ve always envisioned. Here, you’ll find a welcoming workplace built on respect, collaboration and community—where you have the freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in your potential and are here to help you achieve it. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: District Operations Manager
description:
About Us

LA Fitness is a fast-paced health club company and is one of four brands included in the 730 health clubs in the U.S. and Canada all company owned and operated by Fitness International, LLC. Our mission is to help as many people as possible achieve the benefits of a healthy lifestyle. To fulfill this mission, we have created this network of health clubs, where we offer our members the widest range of amenities and the friendliest service at an affordable price. We continue to grow locations and services offered, having launched this year a new brand called Club Studio. If you join us, it’s an opportunity to grow along with us and 28,000 other employees of the largest privately held health club chain in the world.

The Role:

Our District Operations Managers combine a passion for health and fitness with motivational leadership, proficiency in selecting and retaining talented managers, experience with vendor relations and property management, and exceptional customer issue resolution skills to create an environment that will help as many people as possible achieve the benefits of a healthy lifestyle. If you are ambitious and driven, with a track record of successfully operating multiple locations, this position might be a perfect fit for you.

What you will be doing:

· You work at 2-3 clubs per day within your market of 8-12 locations to ensure all company standards for club operations are met and resolve any issues while on site.

· You are responsible for club staffing at all levels. This includes a talented Operations Manager in each club, a friendly front desk and babysitting staff, and effective janitorial team.

· Your previous experiences and background enable you to resolve all escalated member concerns within your market quickly and thoroughly.

· You utilize the resources and systems in place to ensure facility presentation is in full compliance with company standards, including maintenance and cleanliness.

· You collaborate and build rapport with the other department managers to support the overall performance of the market.

What we are looking for:

· Bachelor’s Degree or a minimum of 4+ years of Management level experience

· Multi-Unit Management level experience

· Passionate about Health & Fitness

· Full-time Monday-Friday.

Some calls expected off-hours.

What we offer:·

Competitive pay · Full Medical, Dental and Vision benefits

· Paid Vacation and Sick Pay

· Complimentary Membership

Are you excited to learn more?

Please apply to the link and if you meet our qualifications, we will contact you to discuss the role and your background more thoroughly.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. The above position description is intended to describe the general content, identify the essential functions of, and requirement for the performance of this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Community Manager (Build to Rent)
description:
**Primary Responsibilities:** The Senior Community Manager- BTR plays a key leadership role in overseeing the day-to-day operations and strategic success of multiple Build-to-Rent (BTR) communities. This role encompasses property performance, team leadership, resident satisfaction, financial management, and compliance. The Senior Community Manager ensures all communities align with company goals, policies, and industry regulations while mentoring onsite teams and optimizing property-level execution.

**Skills & Competencies:**

* Minimum of 3–5 years’ leadership experience in Build-to-Rent, Multifamily, New Home Sales, or related fields.
* Proven expertise in lease-up operations and new construction community launch.
* Strong financial acumen with budget creation and NOI management experience.
* Advanced proficiency in property management systems, Excel, and digital leasing tools.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
* High attention to detail and ability to lead in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
* CAM, CAPS, CPM, or equivalent certifications strongly preferred.
* Active Real Estate or Property Manager license (state specific).

**Essential Job Functions:**

* Lead all aspects of daily operations across assigned BTR communities.
* Ensure alignment with financial and operational goals by executing business plans and optimizing workflows.
* Monitor compliance with company policies and all applicable regulations (e.g., Fair Housing, ADA, FCRA).
* Supervise and mentor Community Managers, Leasing Specialists, and support staff.
* Oversee recruiting, hiring, onboarding, and performance management of BTR community staff.
* Conduct regular team training on leasing operations, customer service standards, and company initiatives.
* Guide prospective residents through the community and home tours, ensuring an exceptional first impression.
* Implement and oversee community engagement strategies to drive resident satisfaction and retention.
* Respond to and resolve resident concerns, promoting a high standard of service.
* Lead the development and oversight of annual community budgets.
* Monitor NOI performance, occupancy trends, rent collection, and variance reporting.
* Recommend strategic pricing and leasing strategies based on market intelligence.
* Analyze market trends to inform and implement leasing, marketing, and retention strategies.
* Provide strategic input on new community lease-ups and stabilization plans.
* Support marketing efforts including reputation management, community branding, and lead generation.
* Ensure that communities are maintained to brand and safety standards.
* Oversee vendor relationships and verify the quality and scope of third-party services.
* Conduct regular inspections of homes, amenities, and common areas with follow-up action plans.
* Leverage property management software and CRM tools for team communication, leasing workflow, and resident relations.
* Support implementation of digital platforms for leasing, maintenance, and performance tracking.

**Key Metrics & Responsibilities:**

* Achievement of NOI targets and occupancy/stabilization benchmarks.
* High customer satisfaction as measured through reputation management KPIs.
* Team training compliance and performance development tracking.

**Why Work for Maymont Homes?**

At Maymont Homes, our mission is simple yet impactful: *“We Positively Impact the Lives in the Communities We Serve.”* By joining our team, you become part of a company that makes a meaningful difference every day, both through our work and through company-sponsored volunteer initiatives. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to enrich the communities around you—while advancing your career in a supportive and rewarding environment.

**What We Offer:**

**Comprehensive Benefits Package**

Our benefits, provided by Brookfield, are designed with your well-being in mind. With an immediate 5% match on our 401(k) plan, substantial wellness credits that help reduce health care costs, and up to 160 hours of paid time off per year for full-time employees, you’ll enjoy a package that supports both your health and financial goals.

**Stability and Support**

As part of Brookfield Asset Management—one of the world’s leading real estate asset management companies—you’ll benefit from the resources and stability of a large, financially secure parent company. This strong backing allows us to pursue ambitious growth and development initiatives.

**Career Advancement Opportunities**

With our ongoing expansion into new markets, there’s ample room for growth and advancement within Maymont Homes. We’re committed to investing in our employees’ careers, providing pathways for professional development and promotion.

**Resident-Focused Values**

At Maymont Homes, our residents are at the heart of everything we do. We believe that exceptional service fosters lasting resident satisfaction, and our commitment to our residents’ needs drives our everyday operations. This resident-first approach reflects our core values and strengthens the communities we serve.

Join Maymont Homes and be part of a team that’s making a positive impact while enjoying a fulfilling and progressive career path.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: CDL Class B Route Delivery Driver
description:
At Big Geyser Inc., we are New York’s largest non-alcoholic family-owned beverage distributor. If you are looking to join a collaborative team that is rapidly expanding and promotes career development, Big Geyser is where you belong!

We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package which includes **Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, 401(k) + Generous Match, Retirement Savings, Paid Vacation**, **Paid Sick Time**, **Paid Family Leave** and much more.

**About the Position**

Route delivery drivers can expect to have consistent year-round work with a minimum of 40 hours per week and overtime potential. Our drivers are assigned a route within the five-boroughs and Westchester with the primary responsibility of meeting our customers' needs by safely delivering our products in a timely, accurate, and courteous manner.

**Compensation starting at:** $27.00 per hour

**Position Overview:**

* Safely and courteously deliver and satisfy the needs of our customers.
* Maintain driver logs and complete pre and post-trip inspections as per DOT.
* Inspect vehicles for mechanical items and safety issues.
* Follow all Big Geyser operational procedures.
* Accurately follow paperwork procedures and execute crash management duties.
* Protect the company's assets by maintaining organized, safe, and clean vehicles while always complying with the company's safety and security standards.
* Utilization of flashers and warning devices in accordance with laws, regulations, accepted industry practices, and company policy.

* Adhere to all safety requirements particular to the equipment, including DOT safety regulations.
* Immediately report accidents, equipment malfunctions, and DMV or traffic violations.
* Ensure cargo is secured properly and in compliance with safety requirements.
* Keep all company vehicles and equipment in good condition.
* Control, protect, and maintain truck's inventory and equipment.
* Maneuver trucks into loading or unloading positions.
* Follow delivery/pickup instructions from dispatcher and manager.
* Assist in loading and unloading truck.
* Give directions to helper in packing and moving product for customers.

**What we are looking for in the ideal candidate**

* Active CDL License (Class A or B).
* Experience in commercial driving for delivery.
* Delivery experience within the food & beverage industry is preferred, but not required.
* Strong attention to detail regarding safety measures.
* Ability to communicate with customers, management, and other Big Geyser employees in an effective and timely manner.
* **The reporting location for this position is the Big Geyser Warehouse in Maspeth, Queens.**

Video intro| Big Geyser Route Delivery Opportunity

**https://youtu.be/enVcuFhiDH8\\_\\_**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $28.00 - $33.00 per hour

* Safety bonus
