title: Residential Building Superintendent
description:
**Residential Building Superintendent – Long Island City, NY**

**Residential Building Superintendent: Prestigious residential property seeks a building superintendent for a luxury building located in Long Island City. For a full job description, please see below.**

**Ideal candidate must possess a minimum of 6 years of prior experience, and have the ability to function effectively in high-pressure work environment a must. Good salary/benefits package. Please respond with resume w/salary requirements.**

**General Responsibilities:**

**I. Summary of the Position:**

The *Building Superintendent* will be responsible for all activities related to his/her specifically assigned residential property, including general supervision, personnel issues, tenant relations, overseeing/coordinating of repairs, cleaning, maintenance, upkeep and renovations, both for the property as a whole as well as for individual apartments, along with any and all other tasks, duties and responsibilities required for the satisfactory fulfillment of the position, in accordance with departmental and management needs.

**II. General Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for the day to day operations of the building.
* On a regular basis, reviews and ensures that condition of the building, as well as apartments, are maintained in appropriate condition, to ensure compliance with lease and legal requirements.
* Responsible for the operations of and the optimal performance of the physical plant/mechanics of the building(s)
* Recommends and implements procedures for improving property operations and performance and for correcting potential problems (preventative maintenance).
* Handles any and all tenant-related issues, problems, concerns, security matters, physical plant matters, facilities, etc.
* Meets with the onsite property manager on a frequent basis to discuss concerns or problems, as well as to update PM on building operations matters.
* Handles all building service breakdowns and assesses repair conditions at sites, including communication with residents. Analyzes conditions to determine appropriate repair or replacement.
* Obtains bids from contractors, supervise and inspects completion of work and reviews contractor invoices.
* Notifies Management of any potential or present violations or related matters in the building, and recommends suggested follow-up or resolution where possible. Obtains bids from contractors and supervises the work.
* Supervises all building staff, and schedules them properly for optimum performance.
* Establishes and maintains proper channels of communication and chain of command among building staff.

**III. Measures of Accountability:**

In accordance with the guidelines described above, the *Building Superintendent/Resident Manager* will be held accountable for the following expectations:

* Timely and accurate fulfillment of all job duties, tasks and responsibilities as outlined above
* Compliance with general mandates and directions as set forth by Executive Management of the company, and by the VP/Director of Residential Real Estate.
* Adherence to highest standards of professional integrity and best-practices
* Maintains a consistently low rate of open tenant issues, complaints, etc. indicative that issues/problems/concerns are being dealt with in an effective and timely manner

**IV. Hiring Specifications:**

* Minimum 6 years of Resident Manager or Superintendent experience, preferably in a residential real estate or property management environment
* Strong technical knowledge in Electrical, Carpentry, Plumbing, HVAC, Building Systems, or related fields
* Good computer skills (BuildingLink, Excel; PowerPoint; etc.)
* Excellent general administrative and management capabilities
* Well-honed communications and tenant relations/customer service skills
* Highly developed organizational and prioritization skills
* Ability to function effectively in a high-pressure, deadline-oriented work environment

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* building systems and management: 6 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

License/Certification:

* HVAC Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Service Manager
description:
Black Hills Outdoor is a leading dealership specializing in boats and powersports vehicles, offering top-of-the-line products and exceptional service. We are passionate about helping our customers get the most out of their time on the water, and we're looking for someone equally enthusiastic to lead our service department.

Position Summary:

We are seeking a motivated and customer-focused **Service Writer / Service Manager** to join our team. This hybrid role is ideal for someone with strong communication skills, technical knowledge of marine and powersports equipment, and proven leadership ability. You’ll be the key liaison between customers and our service team—ensuring smooth operations, timely repairs, and satisfied clients.

Responsibilities:

* Greet customers, listen to their service needs, and accurately document service requests
* Prepare work orders and maintain clear and detailed service records
* Schedule appointments, manage shop workflow, and coordinate technician assignments
* Provide timely updates and service estimates to customers
* Ensure all repairs and services are completed efficiently and to quality standards
* Manage warranty claims and parts ordering as needed
* Lead and motivate the service team; provide training and support where necessary
* Maintain a clean, organized, and customer-friendly service environment
* Monitor and achieve service department performance goals (CSI, labor hours, etc.)

Qualifications:

* Previous experience as a service writer, service advisor, or service manager (marine or powersports industry preferred)
* Solid understanding of boat, ATV, UTV, and motorcycle systems and service requirements
* Excellent customer service and communication skills
* Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities
* Ability to lead a team and work in a fast-paced environment
* Familiarity with service software systems (e.g., Lightspeed, CDK, etc.) a plus
* Valid driver's license required (boating/motorcycle endorsements a plus)

Benefits:

* Competitive salary + commission/bonus potential
* Paid time off and holidays
* Ongoing training and professional development opportunities

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Shift:

* Day shift

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Service writing: 2 years (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Rapid City, SD 57701: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Home Health Aide (HHA)-Willing to train.
description:
**Meadow Place Assisted Living is looking for two full-time evening and one part-time NOC Home Care Aides. Shift differential of $2/hour more for evenings and $3/hour more for NOC shift. Willing to train, no license required!**

Title: Home Care Aide (HCA)

Department: Nursing

Supervisor: RN Assisted Living Clinical

FSLA: Hourly

**JOB SUMMARY:**

This position is responsible for providing personal care and designated health-related services designed to maintain the resident’s physical and emotional well-being for those residents living at Premier Healthcare. This position assists residents with tasks of daily living as indicated on the Service Agreement, the Medication Administration Record (MAR), and other services as delegated by the RN.

**Vulnerable Adult Mandated Reporter**

A mandated vulnerable adult reporter of maltreatment, neglect, abuse of vulnerable residents/tenants. Required to report any alleged maltreatment, neglect, or abuse to your supervisor and appropriate state agencies.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* High School education/GED or previous work experience
* CNA/ NAR or HHA Certificate preferred.
* Experience in working with older adults.

**SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:**

This position requires the incumbent to:

* Possess a sensitivity and aptitude for working with the elderly.
* Prioritize and organize work effectively and efficiently.
* Possess skills to communicate effectively with residents, families, staff and other customers.
* Possess the ability to read, write and comprehend simple instructions, correspondence and documentation, including medical terminology, in English.
* Be punctual with a good attendance record.
* Must demonstrate good interpersonal skills.
* Understand how to use, carry and be responsible for the cell phone while on duty.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND TASKS:**

**Medication Administration**

* Administer medications and give reminders to residents as required according to the Medication Administration Record (MAR) and as delegated by the RN Supervisor.
* Follow policy for administrating medications PRN standing orders.
* Follow policy and procedure for narcotic administration and documentation.
* Follow policy and procedure for medication administration when a resident is leaving the building.
* Follows policy and procedures when receiving new or changed medication orders.
* Reorder medications and supplies weekly, or as needed.
* Understand standard precautions used for infection control and adhere to them.
* Other medication administration duties as assigned by RN Supervisor.

**Provide personal and direct care to residents**

* Assist residents with activities of daily living as indicated on their individual service agreement (including, but not limited to dressing, showering, grooming, toilet assistance and escorting).
* Assist residents with daily room order and light housekeeping.
* Assist residents with personal laundry duties, which may include ironing.
* Maintain a clean and healthy environment.
* Promote independence, not dependence, with residents offering choices and fostering self-help skills.
* Perform routine procedures as delegated by the RN Supervisor.

**Documenting and reporting**

* Document any changes in residents’ condition in the resident chart and communication log. Report these changes to the RN Supervisor.
* Completes incident reports according to policy.
* Reports to RN Supervisor any medication changes or any PRN medications that have been administered to a resident.
* Understands procedures regarding assisted living tasks and charting procedures when performing these tasks.
* Recognizing abnormal signs and symptoms, or changes in residents’ condition.
* Documenting duties completed with residents on the service delivery record during each shift.

**Complete essential paperwork**

* Filing papers in residents’ charts as needed.
* Signing Medication Administration Records (MAR’s) monthly.
* Reviewing and signing all new residents plan of care/ weekly service record and changes in current residents’ plan of care.
* Reading the communication book and checking employee mailbox before the start of each shift.
* Checking outgoing US mailbox, collecting US mail delivered and distributing US mail and in-house mail to the residents.
* Other documentation as assigned and/ or needed.

**Knowledge and compliance with state regulations**

* Understand and adhere to the Vulnerable Adult and abuse policy, Bill of Rights and HIPPA.
* Works to assure facility is in compliance with federal, state and local standards and regulations.
* Complete a minimum of eight (8) hours of documented training.
* Be up to date with completing mantoux tests or chest x-rays.

**Activity Programming**

* Encourage, gather and/ or escort residents to participate in scheduled activity programs.
* Lead activity programs as assigned.
* Socialize with residents and incorporate new ideas and resident suggestions into programming.

**Participate and function effectively as a team member**

* Develop and maintain a positive working relationship with other Unlicensed Personnel’s, housekeeper, Nursing staff, kitchen staff and other Premier Healthcare staff.
* Provide back up to other staff as needed to ensure 24 hours staffing.
* Communicate information regarding residents care needs and changes to the team and families.
* Provide proactive and constructive participation in staff meetings.
* Be compassionate and work with tact and ethical awareness.
* Be flexible and adaptable to changing situations.
* Responds appropriately to safety hazards, fire, weather or emergency situations.
* Follow through promptly on requested duties.
* Assisted kitchen staff at meal times with set up, serving and clean up.
* Provide on-the-job training for new associates.
* Must be mature and emotionally stable using a calm and kind tone of voice.
* The ability to remain calm in difficult or unusual circumstances.

**Other duties as assigned**

* Support the mission and values of Premier Healthcare.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS** The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to:

* Ability to transfer, and reposition a resident to or from a bed, wheelchair, Mechanical lift, toilet, tub, shower and occasionally the floor. Requires varying degrees of pushing, pulling and lifting due to the differences in resident weights which could be over 75 lbs.
* Must be able to continuously perform simple manipulative Dexterity tasks such as the equipment listed above as well as safety pins, buttons, snaps, buckles and tie strings. Occasionally perform difficult manipulative tasks.
* Must be able to detect the smell of smoke, spoiled food, soiled linen, etc.

The employee must:

* Must be able to continuously hear normal sounds and voice patterns with some background noise. Must have adequate hearing to receive verbal instructions. Must be able to hear audible emergency signals, alarms, call, light indicators and to be able to answer the phone.

Specific vision abilities required by this job include:

* Must be able to continuously see objects up close so as to notice a change in the resident’s condition (breathing, color, skin breakdown, etc.) Ability to focus and read a thermometer.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT** The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to:

* Seasonal exposure to high humidity to resident’s option to control environment.
* Stress of working with sick residents and their families combined with the resident who may be confused, irrational, highly agitated or given to abrupt mood swings. (Frequent).
* Frequent exposure to latex, plastic and/or materials that are used for personal protective equipment.
* Frequent exposure to micro bacteria and other infectious agents inherent to care of ill residents.
* Work is performed indoors although during the summer, fall and spring, residents are escorted out on the patio. The nursing unit is well lighted and clean with some exposure to dust. Heat air conditioning and humidity are controlled by the building’s central system with a temperature variance of not more than 7 degrees on either side of the norm of 72 degrees.
* There are constant exposures to blood, body tissues and fluids with occasional exposure to hazardous materials and infectious diseases.
* Exposure to loud or unpleasant voices and bodily injury on a regular basis.
* Constant stress of working with sick residents and their families combined with the residents who may be confused, irrational, highly agitated or given to abrupt mood swings.
* Exposure to toxins is rare.

The noise level in the work environment is:

* Quiet to loud.

This job description is not mean to be all-inclusive. The employee will also perform other reasonable related duties as assigned by the RN Supervisor and/ or Assisted Living Manager.

Management reserves the right to change job responsibilities, duties, and hours as needs prevail. This document is for management communication only and is not intended to imply a written or implied contract of employme

I have read the Unlicensed Personnel job description and fully understand the conditions set forth therein, and I will perform these duties to the best of my knowledge and ability.

Expected hours: 8 – 40 per week

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

* Geriatrics

title: Assistant Studio Manager, Greenwich
description:
**Company Description**

**Who We Are**

We’re purpose-driven. With every ride, we aim to redefine health and happiness. It’s all about being more than a workout: SoulCycle is a mind-body-soul experience, built on community, love, respect, acceptance, and a lot of fun. It comes to life through the ride, the relationships, and the unparalleled hospitality. And all of that comes from our people. Join us—we’d love to have you

**Our Mission**

To foster an open, diverse, & inclusive community—while embracing each unique individual exactly as they are. We empower each other by listening with an open mind, finding ways to learn and grow together, and always nurturing a sanctuary of trust. To make a real, lasting impact, we’ll work nonstop to embrace and create change. Because nobody is equal until everyone is equal.

 **Job Description**

SoulCycle is seeking an Assistant Studio Manager who will contribute to the company growth by expertly and efficiently managing their studio and leading their studio team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for the SoulCycle culture and brand. This person will be interpersonally savvy with strong organizational abilities, a customer focus and will be able to creatively problem solve and learn on the fly. This person embodies integrity, confidence, is a role model, is bold, and is responsible for and the success and health of the studio’s daily operations.

The responsibilities and duties of this position described here are representative of those an employee must perform. This is not a comprehensive list and other duties may be assigned.

**ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**:

INTERPERSONAL SAVVY

* Foster the SoulCycle Community and Culture in your studio
* Set the weather in your studio so your studio team loves to come to work
* Build and foster relationships in your studio, with your instructors and local community
* Proactively identify and address conflicts within your studio
* Acknowledge your studio team’s wins and show gratitude
* Be open to, embrace and manage change within your studio and your studio team

CUSTOMER FOCUS

* Provide in the moment support to your team to ensure that all rider requests are addressed
* Be a hospitality champion that provides exceptional hospitality to riders and staff, and inspires their team to uphold high hospitality standards and our core values
* Confidently manage conflict in high pressure situations
* Develop meaningful relationships and connections with your studio’s riders

PROCESS MANAGEMENT

* Be an expert on studio specific and company-wide operational procedures and policies
* Seamlessly transition yourself, team, and studio to new ways of working and processes
* Develop and maintain schedules to ensure that all operating processes are completed
* Demonstrate a solution oriented mindset and ability to execute within company standards in any situation

ORGANIZING AND PLANNING

* Set priorities to ensure all deadlines are met
* Develop checklists and operational schedules to ensure that all aspects of the facility are maintained
* Be future oriented with a strong ability to plan for projects
* Demonstrate the ability to manage your own schedule, prioritize and meet business critical deadlines, and complete projects under pressure
* Support your Studio Manager in developing business plans to reach and exceed your ridership and retail goals
* Support your Studio Manager in ensuring that all company-wide initiatives are executed in your studio
* Develop a holistic retail sales plan that encompasses your studio’s retail goals
* Work alongside the retail team to identify opportunities to grow your studio’s retail business

PAY TRANSPARENCY

This is a full-time, hourly position compensated at $24.04/hr

 **Qualifications**

* Must have superior customer service and hospitality skills
* Must be highly organized with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadline
* Strong ability to communicate clearly with team members, clients, and

management  

* Must be able to work flexible/non-traditional hours including weekends
* All employees are expected to be available to work peak holiday shifts.
* Personal passion for fitness and/or the SoulCycle brand is required

#LI-SC

 **Additional Information**

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

For additional Information visit our Career Site: https://www.soul-cycle.com/careers/

title: Commercial Office Manager
description:
**Company Description**

The **Doka Distribution Center (DC)** is the logistical hub for Doka North & Latin America, ensuring the efficient delivery and quality control of formwork and shoring solutions across the region. Strategically located for optimized distribution, the DC oversees material receiving, inspection, reconditioning, inventory, and dispatching. Staffed by skilled logistics and operations professionals, the DC embodies Doka’s commitment to engineering excellence and customer service, supporting diverse construction sectors including infrastructure, commercial, industrial, and high-rise projects.

**We Make It Work.**

 **Job Description**

The Commercial Office Manager handles all aspects of office operations including order processing, inventory management and control, business planning, equipment logistics and administration of the daily operations tasks of the Distribution Center. This position reports directly to the Head of Supply Management North America.

Responsibilities

* Full responsibility for all commercial office aspects of Distribution Center operations.
* Coordinates with Operations staff including Logistics, Cycle Counters, H&M and Yard staff as applicable.
* Coordinates with the Distribution Center Yard Manager to assure daily tasks performed in the yard are scheduled and executed in a timely manner.
* Assures all physical activities conducted by yard operations are recorded and processed using our in-house order processing systems in a timely manner.
* Ensures that the DC inventory levels are properly maintained by continually tracking and monitoring the inventory using the in-house order processing system.
* Coordinates with Logistics that orders physically received into DC are properly documented and received into our order processing system accordingly.
* Oversees that orders physically shipped out of the DC are properly documented and processed through our order processing system accordingly.
* Coordinates, monitors and records the physical inventory counts.
* Continuously conducts month end closing procedures in accordance with the reporting calendar.
* Ensures that returns of material are processed according to company standards.
* Reviews freight costs to monitor cost effectiveness.
* Ensures timely and accurate billing of all product sales and services provided.
* Handles, resolves and addresses complaint management for all Operations related internal customer complaints.
* Creates, generates and distributes a large volume of spreadsheets and reports.
* Reviews internal procedures, recommends process improvements and ensures compliance to existing Doka corporate processes and standards.

Other Responsibilities/Peripheral Functions

* Travel as required.
* Other duties/projects as assigned; including participating in company committees/teams.
* Assists in ensuring safe working practices and a safe working environment.
* Complies with all corporate policies and business practices.

  
**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's Degree preferred. concentration in Operations, Controlling or Logistics preferred.
* Recent management experience in administration, operations or logistics.
* Facilitates projects and effectively manages multiple tasks.
* Excellent communication skills including an excellent command of English (speaking, reading, writing).
* Qualitative abilities including strong analytical skills, technical proficiency and effective problem solving skills.
* Proficient using Microsoft Office applications; advanced Excel required.
* Willing and able to learn new computer systems, products, concepts and techniques.
* Possesses strong leadership skills, effectively manages a diverse team and achieves results
* Able to work as an organized team player in a results-driven, fast-paced environment.

  
**Additional Information**

Doka offers terrific career opportunities, competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, Flexible Spending Account, company paid life insurance, supplemental voluntary term life insurance, 401k retirement plan (Roth and Non-Roth), short-term disability, AFLAC policies, paid time off (sick/personal, vacation, floating holiday and company paid holidays) and an exciting opportunity to join as a member of Doka's team.

If working with some of the most impressive construction projects in the US and joining an industry leader excites you, please submit your resume by clicking below. Visit us on-line at www.dokausa.com for additional information on Doka USA, Ltd.

Doka USA, Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

*If you are interested and have a strong competitive drive, positive attitude, a desire to learn and grow from your experiences, then this is your opportunity to make an immediate difference.*

Please submit your resume and apply now.

**External candidates must be authorized to work for any employer in the USA.**

title: Delivery Driver - $12/hour + Tips
description:
Job Summary:

Pay: Drivers receive $12.00 per hour plus tips

The Delivery Driver, using his/her personal automobile, carries prepared food items or meals to customers' residences and collects payment upon delivery.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

· Drives safely and legally to deliver prepared, pre-ordered food items and meals to customers at their homes, offices, worksites, etc.

· Packs orders and ensures their accuracy before leaving the restaurant.

· Handles money reliably and collects payment from customers when delivering their requested food items. Makes appropriate change.

· Returns all monies and collected coupons to the restaurant and accounts for all collected payments.

· Tries to resolve inaccurate deliveries, ALWAYS enlisting supervisory assistance.

· While on deliveries, operates his/her personal automobile in a safe and responsible manner in accordance with company standards and all applicable laws and regulations.

· Maintains personal automobile in good working order with a current state inspection.

· Is courteous with customers and respects their personal and private property.

· Presents a clean-cut, neat and professional image.

· Helps to maintain the neatness, cleanliness and orderliness of the restaurant and surrounding property by sweeping, unpacking supplies, stocking shelves, breaking down empty boxes, and removing trash, etc., as requested.

· Assists within the kitchen by cutting/chopping meats and produce, etc., and helping the prep cook as requested.

· Scrapes food from and pre-rinses dirty cooking and serving dishes, flatware, utensils and drinking glasses.

· Loads rinsed cooking and serving dishes, flatware, utensils and drinking glasses into dishwashers.

· Operates commercial dishwashers in accordance with standard operating procedures.

· Sets up 3 compartment sink properly – wash, rinse, sanitize – and ensure proper chemical concentration.

· Washes dirty dishes, utensils, drinking glasses by hand as necessary.

· Dries clean dishes, utensils, drinking glasses by hand as necessary.

· Wash and store all tableware, glassware and kitchenware following company procedure and in accordance with health department regulations.

· Removes chipped or damaged dishes, utensils, glasses, etc., from service to ensure the safety of patrons and fellow employees.

· Informs supervisor and/or restaurant management of need to replace damaged stock.

· Maintain adequate levels of clean tableware, glassware and silverware for dining room and kitchen.

· Bag and haul trash to dumpster. Keep dumpster door closed and surrounding area clean.

· Handle tableware and glassware carefully to prevent breakage and loss.

· Maintain adequate levels of dish detergents and cleaning supplies.

· Clean walls, floors, sinks, mops, etc.

· Maintains a positive, supportive work environment via effective, professional communication with co-workers.

· Supports and follows all company policies, procedures and programs.

· Promotes good business principles by never discussing company business in public areas or with customers.

· Exhibits and encourages proper hygiene and sanitary habits.

· Maintains a friendly, courteous and cheerful demeanor at all times.

· Provides assistance to other employees to contribute to the best overall operation of the store.

· Be available to fill in as needed to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of the restaurant as directed by the restaurant manager or immediate supervisor.

Reporting Relationships:

· Reports to the Driver Supervisor or Restaurant Manager.

External Relationships:

· Interacts regularly with customers

Qualifications and Credentials:

· Possess a valid driver’s license, proof of adequate automobile insurance and an acceptable driving record

· Some delivery and customer service experience preferred

Abilities and competencies:

To perform the essential functions of this position, the incumbent regularly employs the following competencies, physical and/or sensory abilities, and skills:

· Communication and Problem Solving

· Able to effectively communicate verbally with customers

· Able to see clearly (with or without glasses) to read, interpret and understand road signs, maps, bank drafts, etc.

· Able to perform basic math and make change

· Physical and Sensory Abilities

· Able to see, hear and react quickly to surrounding environment while driving

· Regularly sitting to drive and operate an automobile

· Walking while carrying and balancing pizza boxes and/or other food containers

· Able to handle detergent and degreasers for cleaning purposes

· Able to stand, bend, lift and carry up to 50 pounds

· Computer Skills

· No specific computer skills required

Work Environment:

Delivery drivers primarily work away from the restaurant, driving in their vehicles or walking to and from customers' homes, offices, etc. They are routinely exposed to outdoor weather conditions. When assisting within the restaurant, drivers may be exposed to extremes in temperature and humidity, sharp blades, mixers, scalding water, food (uncooked and cooked). Lighting within the restaurant ranges from dim to bright, and the noise level ranges from moderate to loud and from irregular to constant.

Work Schedule:

Delivery drivers may work full or part-time schedules. Work schedules may vary and may involve day, evening or nighttime hours during the week and on weekends.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Benefits:

Schedule:

title: Community Manager
description:
**ALL QUESTIONS TO BE COMPLETED FOR FULL CONSIDERATION.**

We are looking to hire a dynamic, highly motivated **Community Manager** to work for a **55+ active adult** community in **Decatur, GA**. The ideal candidate will manage the operations of the community and have **extensive LIHTC (Tax Credit)** experience. We are seeking someone that will provide extraordinary service to prospects, residents, and visitors.

ABOUT ONESTREET RESIDENTIAL

OneStreet Residential is the premier developer/owner/operator of 55+ Active Adult communities throughout the Atlanta submarket with just over 2,400 units currently in our portfolio and another 726 currently under development. Prospects are drawn to our beautifully maintained communities, and friendly staff. Residents stay with us because of our experience, our knowledge, our reputation, and the unparalleled service we deliver.

We offer a comprehensive benefit package to include PTO, Company Paid Holidays, Medical and Dental (which includes zero cost options for associate only coverage), Vision, Telemedicine, Wellness program, life insurance, voluntary ancillary benefits, EAP, 401(K) match, Associate Referral Program, and a Retail Product Discount Program.

Salary is commensurate with experience.

**Note: OneStreet Residential is a smoke-free environment in all locations.**

**Role and Responsibilities:**

The Community Manager’s primary responsibility is to organize, direct and manage the day-to-day operations of the apartment community to include:

* Ensure the operation of the community complies with company policies and procedures, Fair Housing, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, and other laws and regulations governing multi-family housing operations.
* Oversee the lease process by conducting tours, reviewing and updating the waitlist, approving prospective resident applications and lease renewals per company standards. If applicable, submit applications to Compliance for approval.
* Manage the community to be in compliance with any community program requirements (e.g., Low Income Housing Tax Credit, Bond, HOME, etc.).
* Responsible for data accuracy in the property management and marketing systems.
* Confirm all applicable deposits, rents, other fees, and ancillary revenue are collected and deposited.
* Walk and inspect the community to ensure that the physical aspects of the community, grounds, buildings, and amenities meet established standards for safety, cleanliness, and appearance. Touch clean vacant units.
* Conduct periodic apartment inspections.
* Assist the RSC with completing the monthly resident calendar by inputting and reviewing reoccurring activities.
* Collaborate with the Regional Manager to prepare the budget and manage expenses to align with community goals.
* Assist in managing the client owner relationship by meeting with owners, conducting community tours, providing updates and information about the community performance, and responding to Regional Managers regarding owner requests as needed.
* Promote resident satisfaction and retention by responding to concerns, questions, and requests in a timely manner, and take appropriate action to resolve and address issues.
* Gather information and complete incident reports.
* Participate, collaborate, and manage marketing efforts to increase occupancy. Review marketing efforts to determine effectiveness. Gather, analyze, and interpret current market and economic trends that may impact the community.
* Submit invoices and all other accounting activities for processing to the accounts payable department, and reconcile the company credit card.
* Maintain records on all aspects of management activity and submit reports timely.
* Work with the maintenance team to manage maintenance programs ensuring prompt and courteous response to maintenance requests. Enter, close and follow-up on work orders through to completion.
* Maintain adequate supply of market ready apartments to meet leasing demands, and the community appearance meets or exceeds standards.
* Supervise all on-site staff, including hiring, training, coaching and counseling. Determine and communicate productivity standards to maximize community performance and individual success.
* Provide friendly communication and exceptional service while adhering to Fair Housing guidelines.
* Assist the team with resident functions. This may occasionally include after-hours events, including weekends.
* Keep up to date on training assignments.
* Assist with additional duties, responsibilities, and projects as requested.

**Required Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or equivalent, some college is preferred
* Valid Driver’s License, auto insurance, reliable vehicle
* 2+ years of residential property management experience and/or training.
* Prior experience with property management software is required, RealPage is preferred.
* Working knowledge of all financial aspects of apartment management, bookkeeping and cost control, physical asset, local and state laws pertaining to apartment management, marketing, sales and leasing.

**Desired Qualifications:**

* 2+ years of affordable housing experience with Low Income Housing Tax Credit, HOME and/or Bond financing, if applicable to the community. (highly preferred)
* Diverse experience working in multi-family, and active adult (highly preferred)
* Knowledge and understanding of Violence Against Women Act (VAWA)
* Business and financial acumen to manage and control expenses
* General knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
* Strong leadership and management skills (highly preferred)
* Exceptional customer service skills
* Problem solving skills
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* Able to take initiative, set priorities and deadlines, respond quickly and work with a high degree of accuracy
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and maintain appropriate discretion

**Technology experience:**

* OneSite or other property management software. RealPage preferred
* Proficient Microsoft Office skills to include Word, Excel, Outlook.

**Physical Requirements:**

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* This position generally performs work in a typical office environment
* Regularly walk to inspect all inside and outside areas of the community
* Perform in an environment prone to high levels of distraction, dealing with a wide variety of challenges, deadlines, and a varied and diverse array of people
* Be able to occasionally lift up to 30 lbs.

*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and participate in E-Verify. A pre-employment background check and drug screen are required.*

title: Weekend Lobby Concierge
description:
*Receptionist*

**Job Overview:**

The Lobby Concierge will ensure a positive and lasting impression through attending to guests’ and building occupants, including but not limited to badge access, parking, and liaising with security team.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** include, but not limited to:

· Greet and welcome guests and building employees upon arrival. and welcome clients, visitors, and guests; determines the purpose of each person’s visit and directs or escorts them to the appropriate location.

· Register guests into electronic badging system. Maintain building system database, adding and removing employee/ contractor access as needed.

· Administer Flash Parking system for access to parking lots, including issuance of access cards and providing weekly revenue reports.

· Acknowledge and recognize guests upon departure.

· Immediately respond to all telephone and email inquiries.

· Receives mail, documents, packages, and courier deliveries and delivers or distributes items.

· Monitor assigned area; report suspicious activities.

· Performs administrative and clerical support tasks.

· Follow all safety and sanitation policies and procedures.

· Flexibility to step into whatever role is needed at the time in order to deliver exceptional customer service. This may include taking on job responsibilities outside of this job description and may require assisting other departments in their regular functions.

· Take initiative as shown, doing assigned tasks without prompting and developing new ideas and programs.

· Use sound judgment in meeting building objectives and in resolving problem situations.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

· Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.

· Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.

· Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software.

· Experience with Flash Parking or similar system a plus.

· Superior interpersonal skills and ability to work extremely well alone and as part of a team.

title: Shop Mechanic
description:
Taylor Sudden Service provides exclusive worldwide distribution of genuine Taylor OEM parts and forklift service for equipment designed, manufactured, and marketed by Taylor Machine Works, Inc. Backed by a network of parts and service centers, nationwide dealer support organizations, and factory-trained service technicians, SSI is committed to providing the best parts and service support in the industry. We offer training schools for our service technicians on a regular basis, ensuring the best possible service to Taylor Machine Works’ customers. Sudden Service, INC (SSI) is a subsidiary of the Taylor Group of Companies, a third-generation family-owned business based in Louisville, MS since 1927.

*Duties/Responsibilities:*

* Inspects lift trucks and equipment to determine the extent of repairs.
* Performs needed repairs on gasoline, diesel, and propane engines with minimal instruction.
* Inspects, adjusts, and repairs components as needed.
* Repairs cooling, fuel, electrical, and exhaust systems using diagnostic tools.
* Performs preventative maintenance as needed to improve the condition and performance of the fleet.
* Operates equipment to troubleshoot and test equipment as needed.
* Maintains records of all maintenance performed.
* Assists parts department in shipping and receiving of motor freight.
* Takes service calls and provides assistance when the Service Manager is unavailable.
* Cleans and maintains garage area as needed.
* Other related duties as required.

*Required Skills/Abilities:*

* This job requires stooping, bending, climbing, and the capability of lifting 50 pounds.
* Basic computer skills required.
* Must be able to read and interpret blueprints and other technical material.

*Education and Experience:*

* Some vocational or formal schooling in hydraulics and diesel engine repair.
* Three years on the job experience in diesel mechanics and hydraulics. Schooling in these fields could substitute for some of the job experience.
* While it is not a requirement that the FSM pass the AWSD14 Welding Test, the incumbent is required to pass the tacker test. The FSM is encouraged to practice and improve welding skills to pass the AWSD14 Welding Test to be considered for future promotions.

*Benefits:*

* 401K

title: Tower Foreman
description:
**5 Star Electric, LLC** (5 Star) is a premier full-service provider of electrical construction, maintenance, and repair services with offices in Western Kentucky and Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas. 5 Star specializes in Distribution and Transmission Power Line work, Substation, Industrial, Commercial, Streetlighting, and Fiber installations.

**Position Title:** Foreman, Tower

**Our Core Values:** Guided by Safety. Focused on Communities. Powered by Care.

**Essential Functions:**

*Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.*

The **Tower Foreman** to lead the day-to-day performance, safety, production, and quality expectations on a variety of wireless tower projects. This position will perform work on communication towers for the purpose of installing, replacing, and repairing wireless communications equipment. The Foreman will be a team leader and mentor to various Tower Technicians

**Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Ensure safety is always being adhered to using proper procedures such as 100% tie off as well as completing daily JSA/toolbox talks.
* Work with the Project Manager daily to ensure schedules and budgets are being met
* Verify ordered project materials are accurate and complete reviewing BOMs
* Ability to climb and rescue at 100 feet or more with 50lb. load
* Ability to complete coax, fiber, boom, microwave dishes, antenna, and radio installations
* Responsible for tracking and approving time for all crew members
* Ensures tools and equipment on project sites are always being utilized and maintained responsibly
* Ability to perform PIM, sweep, fiber, and antenna alignment testing on site set rets and program equipment as needed
* Communicate with customers, providing daily updates and problem resolution
* Ability to read and interpret construction drawings, RFDS’, port diagrams, and tower/mount structural analysis’
* Complete project required close-out packages and take required photos, sending to management to verify installation has been done properly
* Train and develop Tower Technicians and Tower Foreman according to the Career Advancement Matrix (CAM)
* Performs other position as assigned by leadership
* Proficient-level ability to install radios, base station equipment, conduit, DC power wiring, AC Power and fiber optic cables

**Success Factors:**

* Travel Ability Nationwide
* Strong team player with the ability to adapt to diverse team members
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to review and understand construction drawings and specifications.
* Ability to perform heavy manual labor for extended periods, often under adverse climatic conditions.
* Ability to climb, dig, work in tight spaces, on uneven surfaces, walking, stooping, and kneeling
* Ability to understand and follow specific oral and written instructions
* Ability to work well independently and as a part of a team with co-workers
* Ability to pass motor vehicle, criminal background check, and comply with drug-free workplace policy
* Ability to climb and work up to 500+ft and lift over 50 lbs.
* Willingness and ability to learn additional skills

**Experience and Education:**

* Two (2+) years in a Foreman, Tower role overseeing wireless crews
* Five (5+) years of Wireless Industry Experience
* OSHA 30 Certification Required
* First Aid / CPR Certification Preferred
* NWSA certification is preferred
* Ability to use Rigging Calc to create and edit rigging plans as needed in the field is preferred
* Must show previous Competent Climber/Rescuer certification
* Tower Stacking experience is preferred (monopole, self-support, and guy towers)
* Equipment operation is preferred (skid steer and lull/telehandler forklift)

**Additional Requirements/Licenses/Certifications:**

* Possession of, or ability to obtain, a valid State of Residence Class A CDL License is preferred.
* Candidates must pass criminal and Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) background checks and pass a pre-employment drug screen.
* Must be able to work in a variety of physical positions like sitting, squatting, standing, walking, climbing, etc.
* When working on site, will be required to wear common protective safety equipment.
* May be exposed to uncomfortable or distracting sounds or noise levels while onsite.
* Must endure regular exposure to all weather conditions, including hot, cold, humidity and rain.

**Notes:**

*The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.*

title: Global Sales Manager
description:
**Date:** June 2025

**Position:** Global Sales Manager

**Profession:** Sales/Business Development

**Country / Location:** Remote (EST, GMT, or APAC time zones preferred)

**Background/General Purpose of Position:**

Eco-Soap Bank is a non-profit organization committed to improving hygiene and sanitation in underserved communities sustainably. We recycle and redistribute soap to promote proper hygiene practices and reduce preventable diseases. Our mission is to make soap accessible and affordable to those in need, contributing to a healthier and more sustainable world.

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Global Sales Manager to lead our sales distribution efforts of recycled soap across target retail and NGO markets in Africa and Asia. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and executing retail sales strategies through local teams, building our network of salespeople and fostering relationships with our key distribution partners. The candidate will also be responsible for new, direct business development with key B2B customers, such as NGOs, and distributors.

**Key Accountabilities:**

* Develop and implement a comprehensive, multi-channel route-to-market strategy aligned with Eco-Soap Bank's mission and objectives.
* Analyze market trends and competition to identify opportunities for growth
* Identify and pursue new business opportunities to expand Eco-Soap Bank's presence in the market.
* Track performance of sales actuals vs target by channel and develop action plans to achieve and exceed them.

* Using market insight, co-create with local markets the correct product offering by channel
* Track average pricing by market and hold local teams accountable to compliance with Eco-Soap Bank’s pricing strategy.

* Work directly with Sales Leads in key target markets to support their in-market sales strategies
* Be the voice of the market within the Eco-Soap Bank HQ team, bringing market opportunities and risks to the centre of the organization
* Foster a collaborative and positive team culture

* Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers in support of the local sales teams, including key distributors and retailers
* Support the local sales teams to deliver the sales strategy and hold them to account to target delivery
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment between sales and other departments

* Review sales performance weekly with local teams
* Provide monthly $ sales, unit sales and av pricing vs target reports for HQ
* Build a database of competitor product activity to ensure marketplace relevance
* Maintain and report on inventory levels
* Manage a basic CRM via AirTable

**Knowledge and Skills Required:**

* University Degree (preferably in a similar field)
* Fluent English
* Selling Fundamentals
* Managing Customer Service Operations
* Sales Strategy and Planning
* Data literate with excellent Excel/equivalent skills
* Excellent communication, negotiation and relationship-building skills
* Experience with Canva a plus, but not required

**Experience required:**

* Proven track record of success in sales management, preferably in the consumer goods or hygiene industry.
* Understanding of the social impact sector and a passion for sustainable and humanitarian initiatives
* Past experience with WASH, humanitarian, or INGO procurement a positive, but not required

Remuneration: Salary will be based on experience at a fair middle market rate and commission available

*Eco-Soap Bank is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply.*

Please send a copy or your CV and 1-paragraph introduction email (or short video) to

title: Raw Materials Lab Technician (Entry Level) - 2nd Shift Mon-Fri
description:
**Company Description**

**Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.****Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.**

**In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.**

**In 2021, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR 6.72 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.**

 **Job Description**

**Join our team as a Raw Materials Technician, where you’ll work in a cleanroom environment to dispense, inspect, and handle raw materials for biopharmaceutical production. This entry-level role supports quality control by managing samples, performing basic testing, and maintaining lab compliance with GMP standards. It’s a great opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a regulated lab setting with opportunities for cross-training and growth.**

**Responsibilities Include:**

* Operate in a cleanroom environment to dispense raw materials and inspect containers for quality and accuracy
* Receive, handle, and properly dispose of laboratory samples
* Calibrate or verify calibration of instruments and devices prior to use
* Record test results with precision and promptly report any quality deviations
* Maintain inventory of lab supplies and ensure cleanliness through routine housekeeping tasks
* Provide excellent customer service and support to internal and external clients
* Participate in all required training sessions and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements
* May be cross-trained to assist with sampling and testing of compressed gas systems and gas tankers

**This position is an indoor lab-based position working in biopharmaceutical manufacturing cleanrooms and lab spaces. Position requires significant time spent in ISO 8 cleanrooms with the following restrictions**:

* No cosmetic products or applications (such as makeup, false lashes, spray tans, tinted moisturizer, etc) are permitted and must be removed before entry
* Nails must be kept short, trimmed, and unadorned (no nail polish, rhinestones, etc)
* No jewelry may be worn (exceptions are medical alert-related and one smooth ring band that can be easily covered by a glove)
* Hair must be able to be neatly tied back and contained in a hairnet, and all facial hair must be neatly trimmed and able to be secured in a beard cover.

  
**Qualifications**

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry or a related scientific field, or equivalent directly relevant experience
* Authorization to work in the United States without restriction or sponsorship

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Self-motivated, adaptable, and team-oriented with a positive attitude
* Strong ability to learn new techniques, multitask, follow instructions, and maintain accurate records
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail
* Comfortable in a moderately physical role requiring extended periods of standing
* Proficient in computer use and well-organized in managing tasks and documentation
* Committed to fostering a transparent, collaborative, and respectful work environment
* Prior experience in a GMP, biopharmaceutical, or regulated industry setting
* Familiarity with Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS)

  
**Additional Information**

**What to Expect in the Hiring Process:**

* 10-15 Minute Phone Interview with Region Recruiter
* 45-60 Minute Virtual Interview with Manager and/or Group Leader
* 30 Minute Virtual Meeting with Site Director

**Additional Details:**

The work schedule will be on-site, full time, second shift Monday through Friday, 12:00 pm-8:30 pm, with overtime as needed. Candidates living within a commutable distance of Rensselaer, New York are encouraged to apply.

Excellent full-time benefits include:

* comprehensive medical coverage, dental, and vision options
* Life and disability insurance
* 401(k) with company match
* Paid vacation and holidays
* Pay is between 21.00-23.00 per hour, depending on education and experience

Eurofins Lancaster Laboratories Professional Scientific Services® (PSS) is a global, award-winning insourcing solution that places our people at our clients’ sites, dedicated to running and managing laboratory services while eliminating headcount, co-employment, and project-management worries.

We infuse our 55-year track record of scientific and laboratory operations expertise, as well as HR and great place to work best practices, to recruit, hire, train, and manage highly qualified scientists to perform laboratory services using our clients’ quality systems and equipment.

To learn more about Eurofins Lancaster Laboratories, please explore our website www.eurofinsus.com.

**Eurofins USA PSS Insourcing Solutions is a Disabled and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity employer.**

title: Affordable Housing Assistant Community Director (REF9733M)
description:
**Company Description**

**Multifamily Property Management**

 **Job Description**

The Assistant Community Director is fully accountable in assisting the Community Director with the day-to-day property operations, and managing the asset to meet the client's expressed operational and financial goals. Assists with the supervision of on-site staff, which may include: Resident Services Coordinator(s), Compliance Specialist(s), Leasing Manager, Leasing Consultant(s), Maintenance Supervisor(s), Maintenance Technician(s), Make-Ready or Rehab Technician(s), Groundskeeper(s)/Porter(s), Painter(s), and Cleaner(s)/Housekeeper(s).

* Property Name: A169 - Ironwood Ranch
* 39695 W Lococo St, Maricopa, AZ 85138, USA
* Full-Time
* Unit Count: 252
* Driving a site-owned golf cart is a requirement for this role. Since driving a site-owned golf cart is a requirement for this role; a valid unrestricted United States Driver's License will be required.

Pay: $23 - $25 / Hour

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* **Client Relations**
  + Carry out the philosophies and wishes of the Owner in the daily overall operations of the apartment community to ensure FPI is meeting the Client objective and expectations
* **Communication**
  + Maintain positive, professional and effective communication with applicants, residents, vendors, clients and guests while representing FPI
  + Keeps immediate supervisor informed concerning work progress, including present and potential work problems and suggestions for new or improved ways of addressing such problems
* **Employee Management**
  + Operate the property in the absence of the Community Director
  + Responsible for training and onboarding of new leasing team members
* **Leasing/Occupancy**
  + Maintain occupancy levels as established by owner/budget expectations
  + Exhibit professional leasing techniques
  + Assist with the completion of the monthly Market Surveys and analysis
  + Implement advertising and marketing strategies for the apartment community as needed
  + Exhibit closing ratios in regards phone and walk-in traffic per FPI policy
  + Ensure that all online marketing sources are updated (e.g., Craigslist) daily
  + Promote positive resident/management relations, to retain desirable residents. Place customer need requests and follow up as number one priority.
  + Assist with the implementation of resident retention programs
  + Ensure the safety, comfort and privacy of all property residents
  + Ensure move-in orientation is completed consistently with new residents
* **Revenue Management**
  + Assists the Community Director in maximizing revenue potential of the property through the management of lease expirations and timely turnover
  + Assists the Community Director with the management of monthly rent collections and delinquency to include timely deposit and security of funds according to FPI policies
  + Accurately processing vendor invoices and managing accounting month end
* **Reporting and Document Management**
  + Maintain appropriate resident files including forms, leases, documents in accordance with FPI Standard Operating Procedures
  + Responsible for the daily integrity and confidentiality of resident files
  + Ensure that documents and reporting systems are maintained, updated, and organized
  + Meet all periodic reporting requirements as requested/required e.g., Month End, Weekly Reports, Collection/Eviction Files etc.
  + Assist in budget preparation and delivery
* **Risk Management**
  + Ensure compliance of Risk Management items through the following of the FPI Standard Operating Procedures.
  + Reports timely any/all injuries, illnesses, property damage through the proper reporting channels and forms.
  + React calmly and professionally in emergency, emotional and/or stressful situations.
* **Facility Maintenance**
  + Assist residents with reporting of maintenance needs.
  + Document facility and maintenance needs and ensure timely completion.
  + Ongoing monitoring of the physical asset and identifying concerns with immediate supervisor.
  + Follow up on maintenance requests to promote resident communication and satisfaction.
* **Other**
  + Consistently and fairly enforce community rules and regulations, FPI Standard Operating Procedures.
  + Comply with all Fair Housing Laws and FPI policies and procedures.
  + Promote a professional image by adhering to FPI Management's Dress Code Policy.
  + Conduct displayed must be of a professional manner when communicating with employees, residents, prospective residents, clients, vendors, and guests while representing FPI Management.
  + Responsible for meeting all training requirements for the position (Grace Hill, Safety Meetings, etc.).
  + Perform any and all functions as directed by the supervisor, including special project assistance.

  
**Qualifications**

**Minimum Requirements:**

* Must have experience in affordable housing programs including but not limited to: LIHTC, HUD programs (Project Based Section 8, Section 236, PRAC, 811 PRA), USDA-Rural Development (515), HCD, HOME Funds and Bonds.
* Minimum 1 year of experience in a similar supervisory role, preferably within Residential Property Management.
* High School diploma or equivalency certificate required. College degree in a relatable field preferred, but not required.
* Must be proficient in speaking, reading, and writing in English.
* Strong computer skills (MS Office, Google Apps, property management-related software, email, internet).

**Skills Required:**

* Google Mail (GMail)
* Google Drive
* RealPage
* Internet Use
* Basic Computer Skills
* Management
* Customer Service

  
**Additional Information**

**ESSENTIAL ATTRIBUTES**

* Embracing and exemplifying our **HEART** core values and incorporating them into every task performed and every interaction with clients, supervisors, team members, colleagues, residents, vendors, etc.
* Positive influencing, interpersonal, and communication skills are essential.

**Why look at FPI for your next career step?** We are one of the largest third-party 100% fee-managed Property Management companies in the nation, an industry leader in both the Conventional and Affordable Housing spaces, managing over 850 communities (~150,000 units) across the country, and employing ~3,500 team members. We offer comprehensive compensation and benefits packages (employee-only employer-paid plan available), ongoing training, and plenty of opportunities to grow your career. Come join Team FPI!

**EEO/EVerify Statements**

FPI Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply. FPI Management participates in the E-Verify program.

title: Installer
description:
**Job Overview**  
Auto-Chlor Services, LLC is currently seeking an **Installer** for our local location who would be responsible for efficiently, functionally, safely, and cost-effectively installing equipment at the customer’s site to specifications agreed to by the branch manager, outside sales executive, and the customer. The Installer is responsible for installing Auto-Chlor dish machines and dispensing equipment. This role entails some electrical and plumbing knowledge as well as the ability to troubleshoot mechanical issues proficiently.

**Duties**

* Installation of Auto Chlor dish equipment in conjunction with customer wishes and prearranged plan as approved by the Auto Chlor salesperson and branch manager.
* Installation includes machine fit, water and chemical hookups; leaving a clean job site with a fully operational machine; including adjustments in the original installation plan.
* Performing preventative maintenance on dish machines.
* Uninstall competitor’s dish machines and dispensing equipment.
* Receive cash and paperwork from the customer at each installation. Properly account for all funds on a daily basis.
* Ensure that all installations are in accord with local codes and good operating practices.
* Inspect and test equipment before leaving customer’s premises.
* Participates in “on-call” rotation schedule and service calls as requested.
* Maintain equipment and parts stock on the installation truck, while maintaining vehicle cleanliness and safety.
* Purchase supplies and parts in accordance with Auto Chlor Policy.
* Prep and test equipment before arriving at the installation site.
* Train assigned support personnel to be fully functional as an installer.
* Support other branch operations as necessary.

**Requirements**

* Proven experience in a similar installation role is preferred.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Willingness to adhere to safety standards and protocols at all times.
* Physical ability to lift heavy objects and perform manual tasks as required.

This is an hourly position in a stable environment with growth opportunities. Auto-Chlor Services, LLC has an excellent employee benefits package which includes, medical, dental, 401K, vacation, profit sharing plan (one of the best employer-funded retirement programs around) and much more.

**Job Requirements:**

* High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED)

* Must have a clean and insurable driving record and valid license.
