title: Display Coordinator/Office Assistant
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

We’re looking for a bright, energetic **Display Coordinator/Office Assistant** to join our Havertys Team. Advance your career with Havertys, the most established Furniture Retailer in the industry. Your onsite, hands-on training begins on your first day, when you’ll learn how to maintain display standards of showroom in accordance with Corporate Display Standards. Process customer sales, process payment transactions, answer phones, and schedule deliveries. You’ll thrive in our team environment where our focus is always superior Customer Service, Integrity, Quality, and Teamwork.

**Pay**: Starting between $16 - $20 per hour, based on experience.

**Schedule**: 5 days a week, Monday – Friday, as needed on Saturday, typical hours 7:30 am – 4:30 pm.

**This is your Opportunity to:**

* Arranges and presents merchandise on showroom floor based on Best Seller Report and Display Plan.
* Aids sales consultants with customers in selection of furniture and/or accessories.
* May provide in-home design services.
* Coordinates and displays accessories and accent pieces based on Corporate Display Standards.
* Completes Display Coordinator Weekly Checklist and reviews with Display Manager and/or General Manager.
* Tags accessories according to Corporate Display Standards.
* Tracks accessories sales using Best Seller Report.
* Marks down, appropriately displays and moves out accessories that are not selling as indicated by Best Seller Report.
* May be required to provide administrative and/or housekeeping support.

**May also perform Office duties:**

* Balance the cash fund every morning and evening
* Complete daily opening and closing procedure checklists
* Prepare and reconcile bank deposits
* Accurately process customer sales and payments
* Maintain an organized and secure office environment
* Answer incoming calls, distribute messages, and manage store voicemail
* Handle customer complaints and follow up on service tickets
* Review of outstanding customer transactions
* Verify and schedule deliveries to ensure they are ready to be routed
* Ensure purchase orders are present for out-of-stock products
* Contact customers when products are available for pickup
* File and prepare daily paperwork

**We Offer:**

* Paid comprehensive training.
* Flexibility to draw pay between pay cycles with our Daily Pay Program.
* 401K program with a company match of 4%.
* Generous benefits package with premier medical, dental, and vision partners.
* Paid time-off includes vacation, sick time, personal days, company holidays.
* Ability to advance within the company if desired.
* Opportunities to give back to the community.
* Substantial associate discount on our quality merchandise.
* Bonus program for Team Member Referrals.
* Educational financial assistance.
* Complimentary health and wellness program.

**Job Requirements**
--------------------

**Earning Opportunity:**

* Starting between $16 - $20 per hour, based on experience.
* Get Paid Daily. Team members have the flexibility to Draw Pay between pay cycles.

**Qualifications***:*

* A minimum of six months to one year of related experience and/or training is required. 2+ years of retail display experience is desired.
* Preferred: Associate degree (A. A.) or equivalent educational knowledge is preferred.
* 1-3 years of cash handling experience (e.g., banking, customer service, data entry, office administration, medical records) or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* General computer skills with knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and O365 preferred
* Strong math, communication, and customer service skills
* Highly organized with the ability to multitask.
* Able to follow oral and written instructions and work independently with discretion.

**Physical Demands:**

* Must successfully complete a physical assessment to be considered for the position.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 60 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include color vision.
* The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Work Environment:**

* Beautifully appointed showrooms with a 140-year company heritage, fast-paced environment, customer-focused, business professional dress code.
* 5 days a week, Monday – Friday, as needed on Saturday, typical hours 7:30 am – 4:30 pm.

**Disclaimer**
--------------

This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. He/she will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties upon the request of his superior.

Havertys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Havertys does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

title: Account Manager
description:
In our 'always on' world, it's essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

You find solutions for every customer! Due to growth and customer demand, CommScope is looking to add an Account Manager to our team. The ideal candidate will be based in San Diego, CA.

**How You'll Help Us Connect the World**

As the global market leader in our low-voltage/telecommunications infrastructure space, CommScope is looking for an upbeat Account Manager to join a very successful and results-oriented team.

As a customer-facing expert, you'll drive sales and position our top-tier low-voltage infrastructure solutions, including copper and fiber optics, In-Building Wireless, and Distributed Antenna Systems, directly to key decision-makers. Your focus will be on delivering structured cabling, fiber optics, and physical layer selling this infrastructure to enterprise accounts campus accounts, SLED and hospitals.

Here, you will provide outstanding customer service by understanding the customer and specific business units and delivering products, services, and solutions to meet or exceed customer expectations.

We provide our employees with opportunities where they can innovate and build while growing and developing their careers. We grow with change and know the value diversity plays in bringing forth new insights and generating better solutions. Connect your future!

**Required Qualifications for Consideration:**

  

* Five or more years of account management sales experience, with a track record of meeting or exceeding quota.
* Ability to strategically run large enterprise accounts and grow the territory.
* Expert ability to establish and cultivate positive relationships with existing customers and grow existing revenue streams.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, willing to act with professional interpersonal skills.
* Ability and willingness to travel within the San Diego and Hawaii market for tradeshows, customer meetings, industry events, etc.

**You Will Excite Us If You Have:**

* A team player mentality
* A growth mindset
* A completed bachelor’s degree
* Experience with a quota of $7 million or more
* Experience in the telecom industry or data center industry
* Experience with Business Development, cold-calling, and building a professional network

Our salary ranges consider a wide variety of factors, including but not limited to benchmarking by independent third-party consultants, skill sets, years of experience, training, education, geography, and other business needs. Depending on experience, the range can be higher for candidates with exceptional experience and a demonstrated history of successful performance. This position's expected total OTE is $125,000.00-$185,000.00

The candidate will be rewarded with a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision plans, life and accidental death insurance, a 401(k) plan, and participation in the Company’s Incentive Plan. Candidates starting with the Company will be eligible for eleven paid holidays in a full calendar year, two weeks of paid vacation (prorated based on start date), as well as other leave options.

**What Happens After You Apply?**  
Learn how to prepare yourself for the next steps in our hiring process by visiting https://jobs.commscope.com/content/How-We-Hire/?locale=en\\_US

**Why CommScope?**

CommScope is on a quest to deliver connectivity that empowers how we live, work, and learn. Our employees push the boundaries of communications technology that enables game-changing discoveries like 5G, the Internet of Things, and gigabit speeds for everyone, everywhere. With our unmatched expertise in copper, fiber, and wireless infrastructure, our global clients rely on us to outperform today and be ready for the needs of tomorrow.  
  
If you want to grow your career alongside bright, passionate, and caring people who strive to create what's next…..come connect to your future at CommScope. CommScope is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO), including people with disabilities and veterans. If you are seeking an accommodation for the application or interview process, please contact us to submit your request at talentacquisition@commscope.com. You can also learn more about CommScope’s accommodation process and EEO policy at https://jobs.commscope.com/eeo

title: Assistant Director SPVR
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------

Position Information

**Recruitment/Posting Title**

Assistant Director SPVR

  

**Job Category**

Staff & Executive - Career Education

  

**Department**

Career Center - Cmd

  

**Overview**

Ranked #46 in *U.S. News & World Report*’s list of Best Public Colleges and Universities, Rutgers University–Camden is a diverse, research-intensive campus of approximately 6,100 students at the undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels and 1,100 faculty and staff members. Located in Camden, N.J., directly across the Delaware River from Philadelphia, the university is uniquely situated to serve the local community while achieving global reach. A U.S. Department of Education-designated Minority Serving Institution, the university thrives due to a supportive culture that helps students achieve their goals and fosters collaboration among employees. Rutgers–Camden is recognized as a national model for civically engaged urban universities and was selected by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching for a Community Engagement classification. *Washington Monthly* magazine has ranked Rutgers University–Camden among its “Best Bang for the Buck” universities and best national research universities. Recently, Rutgers–Camden earned Carnegie classification as an R2 research university due to a high volume of internationally recognized research, creative output, and scholarly activity.

  

**Posting Summary**

Reporting to the Director of Career and Academic Success, the Assistant Director of the Career Center is a member of the highly collaborative Division of Student Academic Success team and works with various Rutgers-Camden stakeholders to develop, facilitate, and coordinate an innovative student success agenda with a primary focus on career development and job placement services. The assistant director supports the Division’s overall mission, strategic plan, and goals; and serves as the driver for projects and initiatives central to the career success of undergraduate and graduate students and alumni and supports the College’s overall commitment to access, community engagement, and excellence in supporting a diverse student body, alumni, faculty, and staff.

The incumbent is responsible for day-to-day operations of the Rutgers-Camden Career Center, including all programs and services designed to provide career readiness, planning and placement services to all undergraduate and graduate students and alumni. The Assistant Director supervises professional and support staff and ensures a high level of customer service is provided. Creates marketing strategies and innovative programs to engage employers to develop internship opportunities, to foster job placement, and for students to fully utilize programs and services. Remains abreast of current of trends in career services and job market, including the use of technology, economic trends and best practices. Oversees the three critical mission areas of the Career Center including: career development, career readiness, and job placement including the development and management of student-focused programs, developing relationships with employers and working with faculty to incorporate career competencies into curriculum.

  

**FLSA**

Exempt

  

**Grade**

06

  

**Salary Details**

Starting salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience, within university policy and salary schedules, as well as departmental budgets.

  

**Minimum Salary**

79387.00

  

**Mid Range Salary**

100485.00

  

**Maximum Salary**

121582.00

  

**Offer Information**

The final salary offer may be determined by several factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate’s qualifications, experience, and expertise, and availability of department or grant funds to support the position. We also take into consideration market benchmarks, if and when appropriate, and internal equity to ensure fair compensation relative to the university’s broader compensation structure. We are committed to offering competitive and flexible compensation packages to attract and retain top talent.

  

**Benefits**

Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefits package to eligible employees, based on position, which includes:

* Medical, prescription drug, and dental coverage
* Paid vacation, holidays, and various leave programs
* Competitive retirement benefits, including defined contribution plans and voluntary tax-deferred savings options
* Employee and dependent educational benefits
* Life insurance coverage
* Employee discounts programs
  

For detailed information on benefits and eligibility, please visit: **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.

  

**Position Status**

Full Time

  

**Working Hours (per week)**

37.5

  

**Standard Hours**

37.50

  

**Daily Work Shift**

  

**Work Arrangement**

Consistent with the current application of Rutgers Policy 60.3.22, this position may be eligible for a hybrid work arrangement. The flexible work arrangements outlined in Rutgers Policy 60.3.22 are part of a pilot program that is effective September 1, 2022 through August 31, 2024. Therefore, there is no guarantee that this flexible work arrangement will continue beyond that date. Flexible work arrangements are not permanent, are subject to change or cancellation and contingent on the employee receiving approval in the FlexWork@RU Application System. Additional information may be found at **https://futureofwork.rutgers.edu**.

  

**Union Description**

Admin Assembly (MPSC)

  

**Payroll Designation**

PeopleSoft

  

**Seniority Unit**

  

**Terms of Appointment**

Staff - 12 month

  

**Position Pension Eligibility**

ABP

Qualifications

**Minimum Education and Experience**

Bachelor’s degree or higher required plus a minimum of five years of progressively responsible experience in managing a career services operation at the college/university level. Higher Education and career services administrative experience required.

  

**Certifications/Licenses**

  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

Bachelor’s degree or higher required plus a minimum of five years of progressively responsible experience in managing a career services operation at the college/university level. Higher Education and career services administrative experience required.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**

Preferred qualifications include a Master’s degree and career counseling professional certification. Strong organizational, program development, and communication skills, creative thinking/reasoning abilities, and demonstrated competency to oversee multiple tasks with attention to detail and the ability to work effectively with a broad range of internal and external constituents including students, employers, alumni, faculty, and staff. Knowledge of job market and economic trends desired.

Rutgers University-Camden

**Location Details**

Pre-employment Screenings

All offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of all pre-employment screenings.

Immunization Requirements

Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.

title: Channel Distribution Leader, Sr Director
description:
In our 'always on' world, we believe it's essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

Showcase some of the world’s most advanced technology!

We are looking to add a <Sr. **Director of North American Distributors>** to CommScope’s Datacenter team! <This remote position can be based anywhere in North America.>

How You'll Help Us Connect the World:

The CommScope Datacenter team goes to market by forging deep relationships with dedicated and trusted installation partners and end customers that require the world’s best fiberoptic network infrastructure solutions to take on the most demanding applications. It is imperative that our Distribution Partners comprehensively enable, equip, and reward them in such a way that they are eager to go to market leading with us.

Our highly strategic distribution position will play a key role in continuing to position CommScope’s datacenter offering by bringing channel experience that will lead to an increasingly valuable distribution partner experience that helps us STAND APART in our industry.

Working together with the VP of North America Datacenters, this position will be responsible for ongoing oversight of the efficiency of the program and ensuring we are easy to do work with at scale. Achieving annual growth of our Distribution Partners extending beyond revenue. You will work with CommScope execs, sales leaders, account managers, and Distribution Partner resources to ensure the program is impactful, exciting, and ever improving. The position requires direct interaction with channel operations, marketing, finance, and engineering teams, as well as coordination of multiple inner-departmental initiatives to reach the sales growth goals of CommScope’s Datacenter team.

Required Qualifications for Consideration:

* A completed bachelor's degree and seven or more years of direct experience building (ideal) and/or contributing to a team setting to the efficiency of a partner-centric Distribution Program
* Experience with operational aspects and standard processes required to support large-scale sales and distribution programs and familiarity with channel Go-to-Market strategy
* Proven track record in embracing an outside-in framework for program execution, including the account the ability to regularly collaborate with CommScope leadership and distribution partner contacts to acquire feedback used for ongoing improvement

You Will Excite Us If You Have:

* Experience at the distribution level selling into technical opportunities is a definite plus
* Experience with a sophisticated distribution partner programs with another $500M+ company in the tech industry is also a plus

title: Product Manager, Wired PLM
description:
In our ‘always on’ world, we believe it’s essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

RUCKUS Network’s ICX switches work seamlessly with RUCKUS wireless access points (APs), RUCKUS SmartZone™ network controllers and RUCKUS Cloud™ to deliver a high-performance, cost-effective unified wired and wireless access solution.

**How You’ll help us connect the world:**

Are you a visionary technologist eager to make a significant impact? RUCKUS Networks is looking for talented individuals to develop groundbreaking initiatives with our cutting-edge Wi-Fi, Cloud, and AI products.

RUCKUS Networks is seeking a high performing Product Manager for Ethernet switches. As a Product Manager you will have product line responsibilities for Ethernet switches, owning every product aspect throughout the product lifecycle - from market exploration, product requirements definition and development, go-to-market, product transition and end-of-sale phases.

Product Managers at RUCKUS are empowered, trusted and influential leaders.

**Responsibilities:**

* Make data driven and business-oriented decisions to drive revenue and market share growth of RUCKUS Ethernet switches
* Responsible for product positioning, pricing, promotions, and messaging
* Develop joint initiatives leveraging RUCKUS Wi-Fi, Cloud, and AI solutions to position RUCKUS as the leader in Enterprise networking.
* Manage new product introductions, transitions, forecast and P&L.
* Engage with sales, distributors, resellers and end customers to socialize and promote our portfolio.
* Participate in training webinars, blogs, whitepapers and trade shows to articulate value propositions and competitive advantages.

**Required Qualifications:**

* BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or related degree
* 3+ years of product management experience with enterprise networking products
* Strong technical understanding of campus networks and LAN technologies

**You’ll excite us if you have:**

* Excellent technical and business presentation skills for diverse audiences that includes executives, engineers, and customers.
* Ability to analyze competitor products and business strategies
* Extensive skills in financial performance metrics and analysis
* Strong customer orientation, used to develop and validate product and solution requirements and build business plans.

title: Lab Assistant II - 1st Shift
description:
**Additional Location(s):** N/A

**Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance**

At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.

**About the role:**

Maintenance of research animal health and assist in laboratory needs.

**Work Mode**  
At Boston Scientific, we value collaboration and synergy. This role follows a hybrid work model, requiring employees to be in our local office at least three days per week.

**Relocation**  
Relocation assistance is not available for this position at this time.

**VISA**  
Boston Scientific will not offer sponsorship or take over sponsorship of an employment VISA for this position at this time.

**Your responsibilities will include:**

* Follow all Boston Scientific safety and security policies during shifts by maintaining a working knowledge of applicable regulations and complying with all applicable SOPs, regulations and other internal requirements.
* Ensure that all appropriate regulations, procedures and data collection protocols are being followed throughout the course of a study and delay studies, if necessary, until the manager and/or study director can be notified.
* Accurately maintain and backup all necessary records to ensure compliance with all applicable regulations, including animal treatment records, data forms, and drug logs, by carefully recording data, problems noted, resources consulted, and action taken.
* Clean and maintain assigned areas of the lab by assisting with kennel and animal care as needed and communicating any animal health status issues to attending DVM and study director/sponsor.
* Ensure all laboratory instruments are properly cleaned, sterilized, and packed for use.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of procedure and preparation rooms, ensuring all supplies are adequately stocked.
* Assist with inventory management, including verifying and restocking supplies as needed.
* Process clinical pathology samples and prepare them for shipping.
* Perform regular checks on animal data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
* Assist with the arrival and acclimatization of new animals to the facility.
* Conduct monthly weight checks on animals and record data accurately.
* Provide training and enrichment activities to support animal behavior and well-being.
* Perform light cleaning duties in kennels to maintain a clean and safe environment for animals.
* Perform administrative tasks such as scanning documents and supporting Study Directors (SD).
* Maintain up to date knowledge of all equipment, support instruments, test equipment, Boston Scientific products, and routine and advanced veterinary techniques by consulting appropriate journals and attending appropriate training.
* May assist with/conduct necropsies under the direction of the DVM/pathologist, by properly labeling and documenting specimens, photographing gross pathology, coordinating histopathologic exams, and logging histopathologic reports immediately upon completion of necropsy.
* May assist in pathology assessments by preparing, sending and receiving specimens to/from contract labs according to GLP guidelines.

**Required qualifications:**

* 1-2 years of experiences with a High School Diploma and/or equivalent combination of education/work experience

**Requisition ID: 608358**

**Minimum Salary: $ 37544**

**Maximum Salary: $ 63856**

The anticipated compensation listed above and the value of core and optional employee benefits offered by Boston Scientific (BSC) – see www.bscbenefitsconnect.com-will vary based on actual location of the position and other pertinent factors considered in determining actual compensation for the role. Compensation will be commensurate with demonstrable level of experience and training, pertinent education including licensure and certifications, among other relevant business or organizational needs. **At BSC, it is not typical for an individual to be hired near the bottom or top of the anticipated salary range listed above.**

Compensation for **non-exempt (hourly), non-sales roles** may also include variable compensation from time to time (e.g., any overtime and shift differential) and annual bonus target (subject to plan eligibility and other requirements).

Compensation for **exempt, non-sales roles** may also include variable compensation, i.e., annual bonus target and long-term incentives (subject to plan eligibility and other requirements).

**For MA positions**: It is unlawful to require or administer a lie detector test for employment. Violators are subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.

So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!

At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve.

Boston Scientific Corporation has been and will continue to be an equal opportunity employer. To ensure full implementation of its equal employment policy, the Company will continue to take steps to assure that recruitment, hiring, assignment, promotion, compensation, and all other personnel decisions are made and administered without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, gender expression, veteran status, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information or any other protected class.

Please be advised that certain US based positions, including without limitation field sales and service positions that call on hospitals and/or health care centers, require acceptable proof of COVID-19 vaccination status. Candidates will be notified during the interview and selection process if the role(s) for which they have applied require proof of vaccination as a condition of employment. Boston Scientific continues to evaluate its policies and protocols regarding the COVID-19 vaccine and will comply with all applicable state and federal law and healthcare credentialing requirements. As employees of the Company, you will be expected to meet the ongoing requirements for your roles, including any new requirements, should the Company’s policies or protocols change with regard to COVID-19 vaccination.

Among other requirements, Boston Scientific maintains specific prohibited substance test requirements for safety-sensitive positions. This role is deemed safety-sensitive and, as such, candidates will be subject to a prohibited substance test as a requirement. The goal of the prohibited substance testing is to increase workplace safety in compliance with the applicable law.

title: Assistant Store Manager, Apache Mall
description:
**Job ID:** 267806  
**Store Name/Number:** MN-Apache Mall (1716)  
**Address:** 333 Apache Mall Suite 669, Rochester, MN 55902, United States (US)  
**Hourly/Salaried:** Salaried (Exempt)  
**Job Type:** Full Time  
**Position Type:** Regular

**Job Function:** Stores - Leadership

**Company Overview:**

At Sephora we inspire our customers, empower our teams, and help them become the best versions of themselves. We create an environment where people are valued, and differences are celebrated. Every day, our teams across the world bring to life our purpose: to expand the way the world sees beauty by empowering the Extra Ordinary in each of us. We are united by a common goal - to **reimagine the future of beauty**.

**The Opportunity:** At Sephora, our people are the driving force behind our success. We believe that the best way to bring top-notch beauty products, services, tools, and experiences to our clients is by finding, training, and engaging the absolute best talent in the industry. Our teams invest heavily in our talent, both at our corporate headquarters and in Sephora stores. We strongly believe (and our actions prove it!) that our people are our best asset, and we work every day to arm them with the knowledge and tools not just to get the job done, but to feel inspired and fearless while doing it.  
  
**Your role at Sephora:** As an Assistant Store Manager, you will be responsible for supporting the Store Manager in overseeing the entire store operations, ensuring a high level of client service, and driving sales. You will assist in leading a team of dedicated associates, fostering a positive work environment that encourages growth and development.  
  
**Key Responsibilities:**  
Supporting Store Operations and Sales:

* Assist the Store Manager in overseeing daily store operations, ensuring a smooth and efficient client experience.
* Help develop and implement strategies to drive store sales and increase profitability.
* Assist in coordinating and overseeing sales and profitability, performance, service, and operations.

Team Leadership and Development:

* Assist in leading, coaching, and motivating a team of associates to meet or exceed sales targets.
* Conduct performance appraisals, manage employee development and provide ongoing feedback.
* Support the leadership team, ensuring effective collaboration and achievement of store goals.

Client Satisfaction and Service:

* Ensure high levels of client satisfaction through excellent service.
* Handle client complaints and provide appropriate solutions.
* Support client loyalty programs and services to ensure client loyalty and engagement.

Store Standards and Compliance:

* Maintain outstanding store condition and visual merchandising standards.
* Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures to maintain a safe and efficient work environment.
* Uphold Sephora brand excellence in-store, ensuring a consistent and high-quality client experience.

Resource Management:

* Assist in managing inventory levels to ensure product availability.
* Support the Store Manager in allocating resources and handling staffing, ensuring optimal productivity and performance.

**Qualifications/Experience:**

* Proven successful experience as a retail assistant manager.
* 3-5 years of experience managing a high volume, complex retail, or hospitality setting.
* Strong leadership skills and business acumen.
* Client management skills.
* Strong organizational skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* A knack for attracting, identifying, and inspiring employees.
* Flexible availability to work a retail schedule.
* Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds, bend/stretch to stock shelves, stand/walk the sales floor for entire shift and work in a fragrance filled environment & can handle and apply products to clients-with or without accommodation.
* Adherence to Sephora’s dress code and policies in the Sephora Employee Handbook

#LI-KR1

The annual base salary range for this position is $58,500.00 - $68,068.00 The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the applicant’s qualifications for the position; years of relevant experience; specific and unique skills; level of education attained; certifications or other professional licenses held; other legitimate, non-discriminatory business factors specific to the position; and the geographic location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will perform the job. Individuals employed in this position may also be eligible to earn bonuses. Sephora offers a generous benefits package to full-time employees, which includes comprehensive health, dental and vision plans; a superior 401(k) plan, various paid time off programs; employee discount/perks; life insurance; disability insurance; flexible spending accounts; and an employee referral bonus program.

**While at Sephora, you’ll enjoy…**

* **The people.** You will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work with.
* **The learning**. We invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.
* **The culture**. As a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000+ stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.

You can **unleash your creativity**, because we’ve got disruptive spirit. You can **learn and evolve**, because we empower you to be your best. You can **be yourself**, because you are what sets us apart. ***This*****, is the future of beauty. Reimagine your future, at Sephora.**

**Sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company.** We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.

Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.
company_description: We are on a beauty mission to make Sephora Canada the best place to work!

title: Field Service Technician
description:
Description:

**Who We Are**

ESPEC North America (ENA) is partner in environmental and accelerated reliability test chambers and solutions with a long history and deep expertise in making the world a better place through better quality, higher reliability products.

**Mission**

We continually aim to grow and evolve by building mutually responsive, innovative partnerships with our customers, vendors, and strategic allies, and creating opportunities for our team members. Our cornerstone is to be the most reliable and accessible supplier of testing solutions.

We're adding a **Field Service Technician** to our team in Knoxville, TN. This role comes with a fantastic benefits package, a company van, all required tools, and all travel expenses covered.

**Hours:** Full-time 40+ a week. **This position requires extensive travel.**

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Performs calibration service to all ENA and ESPEC Corp manufactured equipment while
* adhering to ISO/IEC 17025 Quality Management System and maintaining accuracy of customer
* data.
* Conducts on-site training for customers on the operation, start-up, and maintenance of newly installed equipment.
* Repairs and adjusts refrigeration systems, electrical, and control systems.
* Configures and calibrates controllers and recorders, demonstrating knowledge in their operation and application.
* Evacuates refrigeration systems as needed.
* Charges/recharges refrigeration systems and fills out refrigerant usage tickets.
* Reads and interprets refrigeration and electrical prints/drawings.
* Coordinates and supervises on-site activities when contractors are used to help on large installations.
* Records and approves contractor hours on large installations.
* Completes expense reports for all expenditures.
* Submits detailed service reports after each job, including travel/labor hours, work performed, job status, and customer signature.
* Implements engineering-approved system changes.
* Returns parts from the field.
* Presents him/herself professionally and acts in a courteous and helpful manner.
* Prepares for the next assignment by researching what must be done to complete the job.
* Reads manuals on unfamiliar equipment to gain a better understanding.
* Assists production as needed upon request
* Cleans work area, cleans and maintains service van, machines, tools, and equipment.
* Arrives at the pre-determined job site on the date and time provided by the Service Manager.
* Completes ongoing safety training.
* Operates efficiently and effectively with minimal direct supervision.
* Regular, physical attendance is required.
* Regional, Extended Domestic, and International travel required.
* Other duties as assigned.

Requirements:

* **Travel is required (all expenses paid).**
* Minimum of two years college or trade school or five years of experience in the industry.
* Experience brazing/soldering/welding ferrous and non-ferrous materials.
* Experience with plumbing.
* Customer service experience.
* Electrical controls troubleshooting.
* Refrigerant charging and recovery.
* Valid Drivers License.
* Must be able to lift 50 lbs.
* Basic computer skills.
* EPA Certification.

Description

At Knife River, we take care of our team because we know it’s our people who make us successful. We are one of the 10 largest construction materials producers/contractors in the Country, and we are a PEOPLE-first company. Our team members are the key to our success, and we are committed to giving them the tools, training, and time to do their jobs productively and safely each day. Our goal is to build strong teams that, in turn, build strong communities. We are also a publicly traded company on the NYSE with the ticker symbol KNF and part of the S&P MidCap 400 index.

This position will coordinate with project manager and operations manager to ensure that jobs are completed to specification.

This position starts out at $34.20 and up, depending on experience.

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**  
1. 5 years of related experience or training  
2. Ability to hold and maintain proper licensure and acceptable driving record. Minimum of a Class B CDL is required.
  
3. Must be able to obtain DOT medical card.  
4. Must be able to qualify as valid worker under FRA standards.  
5. Knowledge of machines and tools, including their designs, uses, repair and maintenance.  
6. Ability to work flexible shifts, including overtime, possible nights and some Saturdays.

**DUTIES AND/OR RESPONSIBILITIES**

1. Coordinate with project manager and operations manager to ensure that the jobs are completed to specification.  
2. Direct employees on jobsites to ensure tasks are completed to specifications.  
3. Track project progress and timelines.  
4. Managing project budget and resources.  
5. Ensure FRA, MSHA, OSHA, EPA, DNR, safety and environmental regulation compliance.  
6. Always work safely and take action to prevent any and all unsafe actions, processes, and behaviors.
  
7. Perform other duties as assigned.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITITES**  
1. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  
2. Strong organizational skills.  
3. Knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).  
4. Able to work independently and under time constraints.

Typical hours are driven by customer needs.

title: QUALITY CONTROL TECH
description:
**Job Category****:** Quality Control

**Requisition Number****:** QUALI002326

Posting Details

Posted: June 12, 2025

Full-Time

On-site

Locations

KAILUA-KONA, HI 96740, USA

Job Details

Description

A Quality Control Technician will safely collect samples, perform quality assurance tests, and report conformance of aggregates, cementitious materials, and concrete products to specifications/standards. A QC Tech will further collaborate with quarry team members on how to make adjustments to crushing equipment to maintain those standards.

**Minimum Requirements:**

* General education including arithmetic, grammar, computer, and lab science (high school graduate or GED equivalent with biology, chemistry, and/or physics).
* Valid Hawaii State driver's license.
* Maintain proper certifications, licensures, and acceptable driving record.
* Able to operate testing machines and equipment.
* High ethical and moral standards.

**Preferred Requirements:**

* 3+ years' experience in all aspects of testing in the general construction industry.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Safely collect material samples (aggregate, cementitious, and concrete products).
* Perform tests on construction materials in accordance with ASTM or ASSHTO methods.
* Record and evaluate test date to determine material compliance with specifications and report the test results to appropriate stakeholders.
* Perform daily housekeeping, maintain laboratory, and equipment.
* Perform concrete trial batches.
* Acquire ACI Concrete Field Testing Technician Grade 1 certification within 1 year.
* Assist QC department manager with bids and submittals.
* Provide field supervision/expedite on large or critical concrete pours.
* Assist with investigation of customer complaints about products and service.
* Perform other duties as required.
* Candidate must communicate effectively (listening, speaking, writing) and be able to work in high stress situations.
* Must be self-motivated, a team player, with good interpersonal skills.
* Ability to maintain positive customer relations and be respectful of others (customers and colleagues alike).
* Always work safely and take action to prevent any and all unsafe actions, processes, conditions, and behaviors.
* Once qualified, assist with CCPI/ACI Concrete Field Test Technician Grade 1 testing.
* Assist with research and development of new mixes and products.

**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:**

* Work in a variety of environments from air-conditioned office/lab to hot/cold, dusty/muddy, windy field conditions.
* Must be able to stand for long periods of time.
* Will require climbing/descending ladders and/or stairs and withstand heights.
* Required lifting and carrying equipment and containers of material weighing 60 lbs.
* Must be able to use a wheelbarrow loaded with up to 3 cubic feet (450 lbs.) of ready mix concrete.
* Operate aggregate, cementitious, concrete testing equipment.
* Computer literate.
* Able to work a flexible schedule including early mornings, evenings, weekends to accommodate operations requirements.
* Meet tight deadlines while maintaining quality results.

**Benefits:**

* Medical, dental, prescription, & vision insurance
* Flexible Spending accounts
* 401K with Company match
* Profit sharing
* 11 paid holidays
* Employee Assistance Program
* Safety Incentives
* Years of Service Recognition
* Vacation and sick pay

**How To Apply:**

West Hawaii Concrete is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other protected category under applicable state/federal law.  
  
We are a drug free work environment requiring pre-employment drug testing, background check, and functional capacity evaluation.

You may apply online at https://jobs.kniferiver.net

If unable to apply online, please mail completed application to:  
WHC, Ltd. (Attn: Susan)  
P.O. Box 1390  
Kailua-Kona, HI 96745

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Sr. Program Manager
description:
In our ‘always on’ world, we believe it’s essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

The Sr Program Manager of Managed Networks will manage the overall RUCKUS Managed Networks (RMN) business for two to three key customers (typically Service Provides). The role scope includes Program Leadership, Client Management, Issue Resolution, and overall program (share of wallet) growth. This role plays in technical and business strategy settings and requires planning and execution withing the RMN business. While not a sales role, there is an expectation of business development and client growth, working in conjunction with the sales team.

We are looking for a real go–getter, someone who can confidently and competently navigate complex service provider businesses (or similar entities) and influence technical and business outcomes. Good customer instincts, a bias for action, and excellent problem-solving skills are required.

Key Responsibilities

Roles and responsibilities will include but are not limited to

* **Program Leadership:** Lead and manage multiple complex, cross-functional programs from initiation to closure, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
* **Stakeholder Management:** Collaborate with senior leadership, product, engineering, and other stakeholders to define program scope, objectives, and deliverables.
* **Risk & Issue Management:** Identify potential risks and issues, create mitigation plans, and ensure timely resolution to avoid project delays.
* **Cross-functional Team Leadership:** Lead and coordinate diverse, cross-functional teams, ensuring effective communication and collaboration across departments.
* **Process Improvement:** Identify opportunities for process improvements and work to implement best practices across the program and organization.
* **Reporting & Metrics:** Establish program performance metrics, track progress, and report status to stakeholders regularly.
* **Change Management:** Drive change management strategies to ensure smooth transitions and successful adoption of new initiatives or processes.
* **Mentoring & Coaching:** Mentor and develop junior program managers or team members, fostering a high-performance culture.
* **Negotiating:** The ability to influence key stakeholders and drive consensus.

Qualifications

* **Education**: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. Work experience can replace education. PMP/Agile certification is a plus.
* **Experience**: 10+ years of managing complex customer issues, especially in wireless or network technology domains
* **Leadership Skills**: Demonstrated experience leading cross-functional teams, in a fast-paced environment.
* **Project Management Methodologies**: Strong understanding and experience with project management methodologies.
* **Stakeholder Management**: Proven ability to communicate effectively with senior leadership and key stakeholders.
* **Problem-Solving & Analytical Skills**: Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities to address complex challenges and risks.
* **Financial Acumen**: Experience in managing program budgets, cost estimation, resource allocation, and financial forecasting.
* **Risk & Issue Management**: Proven track record of identifying program risks, managing issues, and developing mitigation strategies to ensure timely delivery.
* **Communication Skills**: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present complex ideas clearly and effectively to all levels of the organization.
* **Change Management**: Experience leading change management initiatives and helping organizations adapt to new processes or technologies.
* **Tool Proficiency**: Strong proficiency with program management tools (e.g., MS Project, Jira, Asana, or similar).
* **Global Experience (since there is the possibility of expanding)**: Experience managing programs across multiple regions or geographies is a plus.
* **Negotiation Skills**: Strong negotiation skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive consensus.

**Perks & Benefits**

Our salary ranges consider a wide variety of factors, including but not limited to benchmarking by independent third-party consultants, skill sets, years of experience, training, education, geography, and other business needs. Depending on experience, the range can be higher for candidates with exceptional experience and a demonstrated history of successful performance.

The candidate will be rewarded with a comprehensive benefits package, including, medical, dental, and vision plans, life and accidental death insurance, a 401(k) plan, and participation in the Company’s Incentive Plan. Candidates starting with the Company will be eligible for eleven paid holidays in a full calendar year, two weeks of paid vacation (prorated based on start date), as well as other leave options.  
  
What happens after you apply: Learn how to prepare yourself for the next steps in our hiring process by visiting https://careers.commscope.com/how-we-hire.

**Why CommScope:**

CommScope is on a quest to deliver connectivity that empowers how we live, work, and learn. Our employees push the boundaries of communications technology that enables game-changing discoveries like 5G, the Internet of Things, and gigabit speeds for everyone, everywhere. With our unmatched expertise in copper, fiber, and wireless infrastructure, our global clients rely on us to outperform today and be ready for the needs of tomorrow.

If you want to grow your career alongside bright, passionate, and caring people who strive to create what's next…. come connect to your future at CommScope.

CommScope is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO), including people with disabilities and veterans. If you are seeking an accommodation for the application or interview process, please contact us to submit your request at talentacquisition@commscope.com. You can also learn more about CommScope’s accommodation process and EEO policy at https://jobs.commscope.com/eeo

title: Sr. Mgr, Data Center Sales Ops & Finance
description:
In our ‘always on’ world, we believe it’s essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.  
We're seeking a Sr. Manager – Data Center Sales Finance & Operations to join our team. Role will be located at our Claremont, NC facility.

As a key member of our Data Center team, you'll enable our Global Sales Team to reach targets by leveraging systems, technology, and data-driven insights. Your expertise will optimize sales processes, drive efficiency, and excellence. By analyzing contribution margin and expense-to-revenue analytics, you'll inform strategic decisions on sales resource allocation, incentivization, and process automation. Your work will create predictable revenue streams, align sales goals with business strategy, and foster a culture of data-driven decision-making.

**Duties & Responsibilities:** The candidate will work closely with sales, product, and executive leaders to lay out the vision and strategy for the next several years. Then, they work to achieve it one year at a time. They do this through strategic planning & focus on the following priorities:

* **Sales Process Management**: Develop, standardize, and optimize sales processes to improve efficiency and predictability. This includes managing the sales pipeline and workflow, ensuring that all sales activities align with the company's goals. Includes territory, sales capacity, and quota planning.
* **Data Analysis and Reporting**: Analyze data to gain insights into sales performance trends and areas for improvement. Generate actionable reports that inform strategic decisions and help in setting realistic sales targets and quotas.
* **CRM Management**: Oversee the maintenance and optimization of the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system - Microsoft Dynamics and Power BI. Ensure data integrity, implement CRM best practices, and train sales staff on effective CRM utilization.
* **Sales Forecasting**: Provide accurate sales forecasts by analyzing historical sales data and market trends. Collaborate with sales leaders to plan and allocate resources effectively.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Operations, or related field with 5 - 10 years of experience in sales finance, operations, process management or similar field.
* Proven track record of driving sales growth through process optimization, data analysis and cross-functional collaboration.
* Advanced proficiency in MS Office (Excel, formulas, pivot tables, graphs) and experience with sales operations tools (CRM software, sales analytics platforms, data visualization tools).
* Excellent project management, analytical, problem-solving, leadership and communication skills.
* Experience working with sales teams, understanding sales processes, and identifying areas for improvement.
* Strong data analysis and reporting skills with ability to create actionable insights.

**Perks & Benefits**

Our salary ranges consider a wide variety of factors, including but not limited to benchmarking by independent third-party consultants, skill sets, years of experience, training, education, geography, and other business needs. Depending on experience, the range can be higher for candidates with exceptional experience and a demonstrated history of successful performance. The expected salary range for this position is $118,000- $153,000.

The candidate will be rewarded with a comprehensive benefits package, including, medical, dental, and vision plans, life and accidental death insurance, a 401(k) plan, and participation in the Company’s Incentive Plan. Candidates starting with the Company will be eligible for eleven paid holidays in a full calendar year, two weeks of paid vacation (prorated based on start date), as well as other leave options.

title: Parts and Service Manager
description:
### **About Us**

Outdoor Equipment Co. is a premier Powersports, Marine and Outdoor Equipment dealership serving Michigan. We offer a comprehensive range of products, including top brands like Kawasaki, Toro, Stihl, Bad Boy, Husqvarna, Tahoe pontoons and more. Our commitment to quality and customer satisfaction drives our reputation as a trusted provider of outdoor solutions.

### **Position Overview**

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced **Parts and Service Manager** to oversee our parts department and service operations in Houghton Lake. This role is pivotal in ensuring efficient parts inventory management, timely service delivery, and exceptional customer experiences.

### **Key Responsibilities**

#### **Parts Department Management**

**Inventory Oversight:** Maintain optimal stock levels of parts for brands such as Kawasaki, Toro, Stihl, and others.

**OrderingProcurement:** Coordinate with suppliers to order parts and manage backorders.

**Sales Support:** Assist customers in identifying and purchasing the correct parts for their equipment.

**Record Keeping:** Ensure accurate documentation of parts transactions and inventory movements.

#### **Service Operations**

**Team Leadership:** Supervise and train service technicians to ensure high-quality repairs and maintenance.

**Scheduling:** Manage service appointments to maximize efficiency and minimize downtime.

**Quality Control:** Review completed service orders for accuracy and completeness.

**Customer Communication:** Keep customers informed about service status and any additional work required.

#### **Administrative Duties**

**Reporting:** Generate and analyze reports on parts sales, service revenue, and customer satisfaction.

**Budget Management:** Monitor departmental budgets and implement cost-saving measures.

**Compliance:** Ensure all operations adhere to company policies and industry regulations.

### **Qualifications**

**Experience:** Minimum of 3 years in parts and service management within the powersports or outdoor equipment industry.

**Knowledge:** Familiarity with brands offered at OECo, including Kawasaki, Toro, Stihl, and others.

**Skills:** Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills.

**Technical Aptitude:** Ability to understand and troubleshoot mechanical issues.

**Education:** High school diploma required; associate degree or higher preferred

### **Why Join OECo?**

**Competitive Compensation:** Attractive salary and performance-based incentives.

**Comprehensive Benefits:** Health, dental, and vision insurance, retirement plans, and more.

**Career Growth:** Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company.

**Community Impact:** Be part of a company that values community involvement and customer satisfaction.

Description

**ROLE OVERVIEW:**

**DUTIES AND/OR RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Supervise drivers associated with trucking operations. Collaborate with other departments to determine trucking needs/requirements, work with HR for onboarding of new drivers, work with Dispatch Supervisor to review previous processes and review with the Trucking Operations Manager improvement possibilities to create an efficient effective trucking process

* Assist with project and source required fleet analyze historical fleet usage, project future variations, and compile availability data.

* Troubleshoot and problem solve situations/problems (material quality, equipment operation/repair, etc.). Monitor and discuss production problems with co-workers and managers/supervisors.

* ITO contracts – review weekly schedules with budget, analyze new and upcoming requirements, then produce an improved contract and pay rate schedule.

* Responsible to safely supervise and coordinate activities of workers engaged in trucking operations.

* Ensure equipment moves are completed.

* Communicate effectively (verbal, listening, written); Self-motivated, team-player with good interpersonal skills; ability to maintain positive customer relations & act courteous/respectful of others.

* Assist with Permitting needs or equipment moves.

* Proficient with DOT rules and regulations.

* Maintain and implement applicable software system and programs.

* Troubleshoot and problem solve situations/problems (equipment operations/repairs, etc.)

* Ensure OSHA, EPA, DNR, safety and environmental regulation compliance.

* Performs other duties as assigned.

**COMPENSATION:**

$80,000 - $95,000 per year

**BENEFITS:**

Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance

Heath Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts

401K with Company Match

Profit Sharing

Paid/Sick Time Off

8 Paid Holidays

Short-term Disability & Life Insurance

Employee Assistance Program

Years of Service Recognition

Subject to pre-employment drug testing and background checks.

All applications are completed online. If you’re having issues completing the application, you can stop at our office for assistance.

title: Territory Sales Account Manager 1
description:
In our ‘always on’ world, we believe it’s essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

CommScope is looking for an Territory Account Manager as part of its Connectivity and Cable Solutions (CCS) Business Unit to assist with contract negotiations while driving sales goals within our network.

**What to Expect:**

This is an individual contributor field sales role, responsible for selling CommScope products, services, or solutions into the Illinois territory. The ideal candidate will be located in Ohio, Michigan, Illinois

**You Will Make an Impact By:**

* Prioritizing sales and customer relationships to meet assigned financial objectives while achieving product sales/solutions goals
* Recommending the selection and development of distributors to respective regions
* Achieving continued advancement in the marketplace

**Required Qualifications for Consideration:**

* High School Diploma and 5+ years of proven sales experience.
* 2+ years of experience supporting and participating in team sales initiatives assembling and communicating pertinent information for assigned accounts.
* 2+ years of experience owning the entire sales cycle with outstanding customer-facing and presentation skills.
* Expert ability to establish and nurture positive relationships with existing customers and grow existing revenue streams.

**You Will Excite Us If You:**

* A completed bachelor’s degree
* Have familiarity with CommScope and our product set.
* Have experience in enterprise sales with a deep understanding of enterprise sales methodology.

Our salary ranges consider a wide variety of factors, including but not limited to benchmarking by independent third-party consultants, skill sets, years of experience, training, education, geography, and other business needs. This position's expected total compensation (base salary and commission range).

title: Territory Account Manager- Michigan
description:
In our ‘always on’ world, we believe it’s essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

RUCKUS Networks builds and delivers purpose-driven networks that perform in the tough, unique environments of the industries we serve. Leveraging network assurance and enterprise-wide automation driven by AI and machine learning (ML), we empower our customers to deliver exceptional experiences for every employee, guest, customer, student, and resident who counts on those networks to connect with their digital lives.

**How You'll Help Us Connect The World:**

RUCKUS is searching for a **Territory Account Manager** to strategically manage its business for the **Midwest territory**. This critical role drives revenue, increases market share, develops strong customer and partner relationships, and develops new business. In this role, you will execute the sales go-to-market strategy and work with channel partners to apply a hands-on approach to driving sales and channel functions. Candidate residence within the territory is required, and the Iowa area is highly preferred.

**Requirements:**

  

* Experience working with IT and/or networking and wireless products with the ability to tap into technology to provide valued added business outcomes.
* Establishes a professional working relationship (up to the executive level) with clients and prospects to develop a core understanding of the unique business needs.
* Prospect and nurture growth opportunities using the account planning process; actively manages planning process through scheduled reviews and updates.
* Build and drive the execution of a territory account plan that includes working with partners and internal specialists to increase win rate.
* Demonstrated experience selling complex solutions, value selling, and/or consultative sales techniques.
* Cultivate relationships with our channel partners to bring channel-centric go-to-market approach for our customers.
* Demonstrates in depth knowledge of the full sales cycle and the ability to follow a structured sales process.
* Proficient in the understanding of forecast methodologies and provide weekly updates.
* Excellent time management skills, and work with high levels of autonomy and self-direction.
* Ability to manage excellent Sales Force hygiene.
* Thorough understanding and ability to meet KPIs.

**Required Qualifications:**

  

* 8+ years of proven track record in sales, technical sales, or a related field.
* Technical aptitude of IP networking and wireless products, software solutions, and service offerings as well as competitive offerings.
* A proven self-starter who is open to coaching and mentoring.
* A positive track record of delivering and overachieving revenue goals.
* Experience presenting technical solutions to technical and non-technical audiences including C-level executives in small and large group settings.
* Proficient in the understanding of MEDDICC and SFDC forecast methodologies.
* Bachelor, or equivalent, degree preferred.
* Fluency in english language is a must.

title: Systems Engineer- ProAV
description:
In our ‘always on’ world, we believe it’s essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

RUCKUS is a leader in high-performance wired and wireless solutions and a trusted partner in the pro AV space.

With our extensive ecosystem partnerships, RUCKUS delivers the right solutions focused on what matters most to the pro AV value chain. Our broad portfolio of Wi-Fi 6 and Wi-Fi 7 wireless solutions, coupled with our high-performance switching portfolio, sets us apart from the pack and helps ensure we deliver what customers need.

**How You'll help us to connect the world:**

The ProAV Systems Engineer is a trusted technical advisor supporting pre-sales efforts for RUCKUS AV networking solutions across commercial and residential markets.

Work closely with Account Managers, this role engages AV partners, system integrators, and channel teams to deliver expert guidance, solution design, demos, and technical presentations.

With deep knowledge of networking and AV technologies, the engineer leads consultative discussions, proof-of-concept trials, and training while staying ahead of industry trends.

The ideal candidate is a proactive and technically skilled Solutions Architect with strong industry expertise, excellent communication abilities, and a track record of success in customer or partner-facing roles. Preference will be given to candidates familiar with RUCKUS wireless and switching portfolio and related technologies.

This position is remote, requires 50% or more travel, and the candidates can be baed out of TX, OK, MO, KS, Utah, FL, NC, VA, MD, PA, GA or be willing to relocate at their own expense.

**Responsibilities:**

  

* Pre-sales engineering network and AV design, network switching design planning, radio frequency passive and/or active planning, bill of material creation, sales opportunity engagement, and technical training individually or in larger group settings.
* Identifying and driving the development of a territory account plan based on awareness of the business economics and trends of the industries, including vertical markets
* Have a working knowledge of RUCKUS Networks wireless, wired and software solutions.
* Act as a trusted technical advisor to customers and partners with the ability to differentiate and competitively position RUCKUS solutions.
* Assist the Territory and/or Partner Account Manager in driving revenue and selling solutions to achieve target ProAV solution goals.

**Required Qualifications:**

  

* Undergraduate or graduate degree (BS/BA minimum) along with 5 years pre-sales or equivalent experience working with AV solutions, routing, switching and Wi-Fi technologies.
* Professional or associate level networking and AV industry certification such as CCNA, BPIPA, JNCIA, Cisco, Aruba, RUCKUS, CWNA, CTS, CTS-D, CTS-I, ANP, or other AV industry certifications, etc. is preferred.
* In-depth knowledge and direct experience designing, selling, deploying, and troubleshooting AV technologies like AV over IP, including codecs, protocols, video displays, video and audio streaming and conferencing, and AV control systems.
* Strong ability to support and manage the process of troubleshooting complex problems.
* Excellent communicatio along with highly effective technical presentation skills

**You will excite us if you have:**

* + - A proficient understanding of pre-sales engineering, IP networking, AV systems design and deployments, technical sales processes, and critical account management
    - Advanced understanding of problem solving, understanding business drivers and how to map these to a customer environment, including identification of improvement areas in network design
    - Direct knowledge of current AV systems, associated IT elements and their installation (including AMX, Crestron, Extron, Control4, Just Add Power, audio DSP, Video conferencing, and other vendor solutions)

title: Attendant, Tool Crib
description:
In our ‘always on’ world, we believe it’s essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

**CommScope, Catawba, NC site has an opening for Tool Crib Attendant**

Everyone communicates. It’s the essence of the human experience. How we communicate is evolving. Technology is reshaping the way we live, learn and thrive. The epicenter of this transformation is the network—our passion. Our experts are rethinking the purpose, role and usage of networks to help our customers increase bandwidth, expand capacity, enhance efficiency, speed deployment and simplify migration. From remote cell sites to massive sports arenas, from busy airports to state-of-the-art data centers— we provide the essential expertise and vital infrastructure your business needs to succeed. The world’s most advanced networks rely on CommScope connectivity.

**Overview**

The Tool Crib Attendant is responsible for maintaining the tool crib and any items, which may be used in the plant for personal protection, machine repair, cleaning and sanitation, lubrications. Additionally, to receive and issuing these items to the plant floor or support personnel. The items in the stockroom are placed on shelves with heavier items placed strategically for removal. Lighter items are placed on the extremes either lowest or highest. Some shelves are quite high, and ladder is required for getting to these items. Heavier items are moved by hand truck and/or pallet jacks or cherry pickers. The aisles are arranged such that these mechanized lifting devices can be used extensively in this department.

Schedule: M-F 8 hours 6:30am – 2:30pm, or as required by manager.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

Maintains accurate stock part levels in all locations. Accurately process daily transaction sheets. Generates purchase requisitions. Identify, locate and issue stockroom items and/or tools. Administrative support responsibilities as assigned. Works closely with maintenance for work order stock fulfillment. May perform pickups and deliveries to outside vendors.

**Education / Experience / Skills**

* High School Diploma or equivalent required
* Technical ability to comprehend electrical and mechanical component industry names and basic uses
* Ability to differentiate assemblies vs component level
* Detail oriented, ability to count effectively and accurately
  + Units of measures
* Good computer skill required including Microsoft Excel and Word.
  + Ability to create and work with basic spreadsheets
* Ability to obtain forklift certification required
* SAP experience preferred
* Prior experience in a stockroom environment preferred
* Ability to lift 25lbs
* Previous experience in a maintenance environment preferred

Why CommScope:

CommScope is on a quest to deliver connectivity that empowers how we live, work, and learn. Our employees push the boundaries of communications technology that enables game-changing discoveries like 5G, the Internet of Things, and gigabit speeds for everyone, everywhere. With our unmatched expertise in copper, fiber, and wireless infrastructure, our global clients rely on us to outperform today and be ready for the needs of tomorrow.  
  
If you want to grow your career alongside bright, passionate, and caring people who strive to create what's next…..come connect to your future at CommScope.

title: Principal Software Engineer- WiFi
description:
RUCKUS Networks, part of CommScope, specializes in delivering high-performance networking solutions while focusing on creating purpose-driven networks that perform exceptionally well in challenging environments. RUCKUS Networks leverages advanced technologies like Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) to enhance network performance and reduce total cost of ownership .

Our Industry leading WiFi team is hiring Principal Engineer to join our team in Sunnyvale, CA. In this role, you will drive the architecture, design, and development of cutting-edge, Enterprise / carrier-grade wireless access points, enabling enterprises and carriers to stay ahead of the rapidly growing demand for high-bandwidth applications.

#### **How You'll help us to connect the world:**

  

* Design and develop WiFi features that align with evolving standards, focusing on high performance, low latency, and guaranteed service delivery.
* Collaborate with chip vendors to drive innovation, enhance SDKs, and support multi-platform, multi-standard solutions.
* Optimize wireless performance for challenging environments, including high-density deployments and challenging RF conditions.
* Conduct performance benchmarking, debugging, and tuning of the WiFi systems.
* Collaborate across teams to manage project deliverables, dependencies, milestones, and product optimization.
* Collaborate and Lead technical reviews and architectural discussions to guide the team in adopting the best solutions.
* Partner with system engineers and product managers to meet customer requirements.

**Required Qualifications:**

  

* Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Networking or Wireless and 8+ years of relevant experience.
* In-depth knowledge of WiFi access point (AP) architecture and WiFi standards.
* Experience in guiding architectural and design changes in WiFi AP products.
* Expertise in embedded systems, kernel, and device drivers.
* Strong coding experience in C/C++, Python for embedded systems development.
* Proven experience with SDK integration across multiple platforms with different vendors
* Strong understanding of WiFi communication protocols (IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, 802.11ax, 802.11be ).
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment, pushing the boundaries of technology.
* Strong problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment.

**THIS IS HYBRID OPPORTUNITY. LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY AND NO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES PLEASE.**

description:
