title: Sr. Operations Analyst
description:
In our 'always on' world, we believe it's essential to have a genuine connection with the work you do.

Our team is growing ! We are looking for an Operations Analyst within logistics who is responsible for analyzing and improving the efficiency of logistics operations. This role involves collecting and interpreting data related to supply chain processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing solutions to enhance operational performance.

**100% onsite and in office 5 days per week.**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Growth Support:** Support business growth in the Datacenter Fiber business by acting as a conduit in Global Logistics and Transportation with our key business partners in manufacturing, Operations, Planning, BU and Customer Service.
* **Operational Support:** Coordinate and improve the movement of goods between both southbound and northbound between the 3 Manufacturing sites in Mexico and the DC in the US. Utilising SAP reporting and analytical tools to streamline and automate the process.
* **Data Analysis:** Collect and analyze all data related to logistics operations, including transportation, warehousing, picking, packing and receiving productivity, and inventory management.
* **Process Improvement:** Identify inefficiencies in the 3PL logistics processes and develop strategies to improve them. This may involve optimizing routes, reducing costs, and improving delivery times.
* **Reporting:** Prepare detailed reports on logistics performance, including key performance indicators (KPIs) such as delivery times, on time performance (OTP), and productivity reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.
* **Invoicing Support**: Create purchase requisitions as needed for business support.
* **Collaboration:** Build cross functional relationships with your key stakeholders, such as procurement, 3PL staff, customer service, Operations, Planning and IT, to ensure seamless logistics operations. With key focus and attention to management and followup on intransit products for hyperscale customers.
* **3PL Management:** Serve as backup support to 3PL Distribution Manager and address any issues that arise with FedEx as needed.
* **Technology Utilization:** Utilize logistics software and tools such as SAP to monitor and manage logistics activities. This may include warehouse management systems (WMS).

**Compliance:** Ensure that all logistics activities comply with relevant regulations and standards

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree preferred (supply chain, logistics, operations management) with at least 5 years of related experience (open to considering experience in lieu of education)
* **Excellent Verbal and Written Communication Skills:** Ability to present findings clearly and collaborate effectively with team members.
* **Analytical Thinking:** Ability to analyze complex data sets, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.
* **Technical Proficiency:** Ability to work with different programs such as SAP, and MS Office including Excel.
* **Problem Solving:** Ability to identify operational issues and assist in developing effective solutions.
* **Attention to Detail:** High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.
* Bilingual in Spanish a plus (preferred)
* **Travel** – possible at times (less than 10%)

The candidate will be rewarded with a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision plans, life and accidental death insurance, a 401(k) plan, and participation in the Company’s Incentive Plan. Candidates starting with the Company will be eligible for eleven paid holidays in a full calendar year, paid vacation (prorated based on start date), and other leave options.

**What Happens After You Apply:**

Learn how to prepare yourself for the next steps in our hiring process by visiting https://jobs.commscope.com/content/How-We-Hire/?locale=en\\_US

**Why CommScope?**

CommScope is on a quest to deliver connectivity that empowers how we live, work, and learn. Our employees push the boundaries of communications technology that enables groundbreaking discoveries like 5G, the Internet of Things, and gigabit speeds for everyone, everywhere. With our unmatched expertise in copper, fiber, and wireless infrastructure, our global clients rely on us to outperform today and be ready for the needs of tomorrow.

If you want to grow your career alongside forward-thinking, hardworking, and caring people who strive to create what's next…..come connect to your future at CommScope.

CommScope is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO), including people with disabilities and veterans. If you are seeking an accommodation for the application or interview process, please contact us to submit your request at talentacquisition@commscope.com.
company_description: We are pushing the boundaries of communications technology. We are leaders in innovating 5G, private networks & Gigabit speeds everywhere – we're always anticipating what’s next. Join us!

description:

Full Time

40

  

**Work Schedule**

***Standard working schedule: 8:30am – 5:00pm***

***Must be willing to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the department.***

  

**Basis**

12 months

  

**Job Search Category**

Student Services

About USC

**About University of South Carolina**

From the Upstate to the Lowcountry, the University of South Carolina system is transforming the lives of South Carolinians through the impact of our eight institutions and 20 locations throughout the state. More than 50,000 students are enrolled at one of eight institutions, including the research campus in Columbia and comprehensive four-year universities in Aiken, Upstate and Beaufort. In addition, our Palmetto College campuses in Salkehatchie, Union, Lancaster and Sumter enable students to earn associate or bachelor’s degrees through a combination of in-person, online or blended learning. All of our system institutions place strong emphasis on service — helping to build healthier, more educated communities in South Carolina and beyond.

Benefits for FTE Positions

The University of South Carolina (USC), through the State of SC and Public Employee Benefit Authority (PEBA), offers employees a valuable benefits package, including health and life insurance, generous paid leave and retirement programs. To learn more about USC benefits, access the "Working at USC" section on the Applicant Portal at https://uscjobs.sc.edu. Research Grant or Time-limited positions may be eligible for all, some, or no benefits, based on the grant or project funding.

Position Description

**Advertised Job Summary**

**Fitness Coordinator**

* Are you passionate about group exercise, personal training, and innovative fitness programming?
* Do you enjoy building meaningful relationships with students, faculty, and staff, and thrive on cross-campus collaboration to deliver impactful programs, workshops, and training opportunities?
* Do you take pride in creating dynamic fitness experiences that inspire and engage others?
* Do you have experience advising and mentoring students—and want to be part of a supportive team that’s committed to helping students build career readiness and leadership skills?

***The Fitness Coordinator plays a vital role in Campus Recreation by being an active member of the fitness team and supporting various fitness-related programs, operations, and equipment management. This role involves supervising student employees, offering both informal and structured fitness programs, maintaining the equipment inventory, and fostering a positive and friendly work environment that promotes collaboration, teamwork, professionalism, and equity among staff, students, and patrons.***

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Ensure effectiveness of daily operations of supported areas which may include scheduling, customer service, data entry, documentation, records management, and assisting in the specific needs of the area.
* Support the development of students’ academic and personal goals.
* Provide opportunities for student engagement within the USC community through all phases of employment.
* Responsible for the continuous care of the University’s facilities and grounds, ensuring safety, cleanliness and continued operability.
* Complete planning, analysis and control operations responsible for the management of funds.

**Perks:**

* Generous annual and sick leave accruement, along with 13 paid holidays.
* An engaging and collaborative on-campus environment. Our location is in South Carolina’s capitol city, surrounded by amenities, so you will love where you work!
* Opportunities for professional development, including tuition assistance.
* Eligible for enrollment in the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program
* Working at a globally recognized, high-impact research university committed to a superior student experience.

**https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BALBcUSl7ck**

  

**Job Related Minimum Required Education and Experience**

Requires a bachelor’s degree in a job related field and 3 or more years of job related experience, which may be substituted by an equivalent combination of job related certification, training, education, and/or experience.

  

**Required Certification, Licensure/Other Credentials**

Must possess a current American Red Cross First Aid/CPR/AED certification or acquire within 90 days of hire date.  
  
Current applicable fitness certification(s) (Group Exercise Instructor, Personal Training or Strength and Conditioning) from a recognized/accredited national organizations (ACE, AFAA, NASM, ACSM) are preferred.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**

Master’s degree in Exercise Science, Recreation, Facility Management, Student Services Experience or related field, 1 year related experience.

  

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities**

Skilled in student supervision and fitness programming organization, as well as the ability to instruct a variety of fitness programs. Ability to supervise student employees and complete detailed reports. Strong customer service and conflict resolution skills. Ability to make sound decisions and implement emergency action plans when needed. Ability to successfully implement creative, state of the art fitness programs. Ability to teach a variety of fitness programs to participants and provide training / instruction to student employees.

Job Duties

Yes

15

Financial Operations: Complete planning, analysis and control operations responsible for the management of funds. Ensure compliance with university policies, and state and federal laws and regulations.

  

**Essential Function**

Yes

10

Other Duties as Assigned

Yes

***Positions are advertised for a minimum of five (5) business days on our job website. After five (5) business days, positions can be closed at the discretion of the department at any time. This employment site is updated on a regular basis. The length of the recruitment and screening process may vary from position to position, depending upon a variety of factors. Should review of your qualifications result in a decision to pursue your candidacy, you will be contacted by phone or email.***

title: Aggregate Dispatcher/Scale Operator - Sauk Rapids (Seasonal)
description:
**Job Category****:** Administration

**Requisition Number****:** AGGRE002287

Posting Details

Posted: June 2, 2025

Full-Time

On-site

Locations

SAUK RAPIDS, MN 56379, USA

Pay or shift range: $22 USD to $24 USD
  
  
The estimated range is the budgeted amount for this position. Final offers are based on various factors, including skill set, experience, location, qualifications and other job-related reasons.

Job Details

Description

At Knife River, we take care of our team because we know it’s our people who make us successful. We are one of the 10 largest construction materials producers/contractors in the Country, and we are a PEOPLE-first company. Our team members are the key to our success, and we are committed to giving them the tools, training, and time to do their jobs productively and safely each day. Our goal is to build strong teams that, in turn, build strong communities. We are also a publicly traded company on the NYSE with the ticker symbol KNF and part of the S&P MidCap 400 index.

As an Aggregate Dispatcher, you are responsible to safely assign equipment and personnel for completion of duties or deliveries to ensure on time and efficient use of aggregate resources by dispatching trucks and personnel in a timely manner to ensure the targeted service level and cost. Scale Operator responsibilities involve weighing trucks, assisting with customer needs, and monitoring pit functions.

This is a seasonal position, you can use your winters off to travel, hunt, fish or for other activities you enjoy while your benefits continue year-round.

Salary range: $22.00 - $24.00 per hour

Hours per week: 40+

**Duties and/or Responsibilities:**

* Assigns appropriate equipment and personnel for completion of duties and deliveries.
* Keeps supervisor and drivers informed of tasks and situations so the schedule can be updated.
* Directs activities of drivers and confers with customers, plant production and yard personnel.
* May issue equipment to drivers.
* Tracks and reports time off/attendance of drivers and personnel
* Utilize remote truck scales to produce weight slips and tickets at pit sites.
* Quotes prices and receives orders for company products.
* Prepares invoices, delivery tickets, and related shipping documents.
* Receives cash payments, run credit card and crosschecks.
* Answers phone to take/alter customer's order and complete all required information. Ensure the customer understands all relevant company policies, additional products over amount ordered, and our driver's responsibilities.
* Verify the order back to the customer to ascertain the accuracy of the information. Inform the customer of warnings concerning product hazards, load limits, vehicle weights and limitations.
* Properly file the order and special instructions and give adequate notice to ensure proper materials are available.
* Weigh trucks (internal & external customers) and prepare ticket for driver.
* Maintain accurate records of materials & quantity.
* Enter necessary information into computer system for inventory, billing and/or time keeping purposes.
* Communicate effectively (verbal, listening, written) and work with difficult people under high stress situations . Self-motivated, team-player with good interpersonal skills; ability to maintain positive customer relations and act courteous/respectful of others.
* Troubleshoot and problem solve situations/problems (material quality, equipment operation/repair, etc.). Monitor and discuss production problems with co-workers and managers/supervisors
* Ensure OSHA, EPA, DNR, safety and environmental regulation compliance.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* General education, grammar and arithmetic, GED or high school diploma or equivalent.
* One year of telephone service or order taking in a business environment.
* Concrete and Aggregate product training and dispatch experience preferred
* Ability to work 50+ hours per week during construction season including occasional Saturday morning

**Full-time employees are eligible for the following benefits:**

* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* Health Savings and Flexible Spending Account
* 401K with Company Match
* Profit Sharing
* Paid/Sick Time Off
* 8 Paid Holidays
* Short-term Disability & Life Insurance
* Employee assistance Program
* Years of Service Recognition

**Part-time employees are eligible for the following benefits:**

* 401K with Company Match
* Paid/Sick Time Off
* 8 Paid Holidays
* Years of Service Recognition

**How To Apply:**  
Knife River is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other protected category under applicable state/federal law.  
  
Subject to pre-employment drug testing and background checks.  
  
If unable to apply online, please mail completed application to:

4787 Shadow Wood Drive NE, Sauk Rapids, MN 56379.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

Job Details

Description

At Knife River, we take care of our team because we know it’s our people who make us successful. We are one of the 10 largest construction materials producers/contractors in the Country, and we are a PEOPLE-first company. Our team members are the key to our success, and we are committed to giving them the tools, training, and time to do their jobs productively and safely each day. Our goal is to build strong teams that, in turn, build strong communities. We are also a publicly traded company on the NYSE with the ticker symbol KNF and part of the S&P MidCap 400 index.

As a parts counter you are responsible to procure replacement parts and materials necessary for equipment repairs in the most economical and timely manner possible.  
Maintain warehouse stock levels and cleanliness. Implement methods of handling parts and materials safely and easily. Work as a team to ensure successful outcomes to shop repairs.

Salary range: $20.00 - $25.00

Hours per week: 40+

**Duties and/or Responsibilities:**

* Purchases, stores, and issues spare parts for motor vehicles or equipment.
* Takes inventory of parts and equipment and maintains inventory levels.
* Creates and completes computerized purchase orders.
* Order parts via telephone, email, fax, or online ordering.
* Reconcile packing lists and invoices with part received/prices quoted.
* Stores purchased parts and issues parts to workers upon request.
* Dispatch parts runners as necessary.
* Operate forklift as needed to load and unload cargo.
* Communicate effectively (verbal, listening, written) and work with difficult people under high stress situations. Self-motivated, team-player with good interpersonal skills; ability to maintain positive customer relations & act courteous/respectful of others.
* Must be self-motivated and a team player able to work with minimum supervision.
* Must have good interpersonal skills and the ability to maintain positive customer relations and be courteous and respectful of others.
* Troubleshoot and problem solve situations/problems (material quality, equipment operation/repair, etc.). Monitor and discuss production problems with co-workers and managers/supervisors.
* Monitor and discuss parts related issues with co-workers and management.
* Must wear required personal protective equipment.
* Answer telephone and if necessary, transfer caller to the correct recipient.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* Ensure OSHA safety and environmental regulation compliance.
* Some heavy lifting required, up to 50 pounds at a time.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* General education, grammar and arithmetic, GED or high school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous parts experience, mechanical experience, prefer truck and/or heavy equipment, and computer experience.
* Provide and maintain proper licensure and acceptable driving record.

**Full-time employees are eligible for the following benefits:**

* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* Health Savings and Flexible Spending Account
* 401K with Company Match
* Profit Sharing
* Paid/Sick Time Off
* 8 Paid Holidays
* Short-term Disability & Life Insurance
* Employee assistance Program
* Years of Service Recognition

**Part-time employees are eligible for the following benefits:**

* 401K with Company Match
* Paid/Sick Time Off
* 8 Paid Holidays
* Years of Service Recognition

**How To Apply:**

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other protected category under applicable state/federal law.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
The Data Center, Cloud & MTDC Infrastructure team is expanding and adding several System Engineers (SE) to directly support internal and external customers by providing technical assistance and being an active member of the sales team to represent the company's solutions. These are remote positions, with preference in Virginia.

**How You'll Help Us Connect The World**

In this role, you will be responsible for pre-sale and post-sales support on product information, installations, and quality troubleshooting. The SE is also responsible for enabling our sellers and partners.

  

* Work closely with sales and marketing to provide pre-sale and post-sale application engineering support to provide additional value to our strategic/key Data Center customers. This may include traveling to customer facilities with sales and marketing personnel when additional technical expertise is required.
* Create and update solutions presentations for end-user customers and Consultants, focusing on enhancing sales of CommScope’s Data Center product lines through discussions of current systems technologies.
* Contribute new material back to the larger technical community for broader use.
* Act as liaison between Global Scale customers and manufacturing/engineering by forwarding customer technical requests and coordinating communication and follow-up with customers, Technical Managers, and Account Managers on results of requests. Interact with Enterprise System Engineers to gather and provide feedback to product line management and product engineering on current market trends and design features that will improve the marketability of the product line.
* Work closely with engineering and product line management for the design and development of new Data Center products with a particular focus on application support. Develop on-site warranty certification inspection documentation to ensure that CommScope guidelines have been followed during the installation.
* Provide training for installation partners and end-users in accordance with installation instructions and guidelines.
* Contribute to Data Center, Cloud & AI Solutions product literature maintenance by identifying inconsistencies and errors. Support sales and marketing with any media activities. This may include writing articles for publications, assisting with advertising, or preparing technical documentation such as design guides.

**Required Qualifications for Consideration**

* 8+ years of relevant experience (10 years preferred) with structured cabling, design, and installation in mid to large Data Centers
* Working knowledge of Data Center functional areas (MDA, HDA, EDA, ZDA, EF) and familiarity with data center industry trends
* Ability to travel up to 30% , including international travel
* Excellent communication and presentation skills

**You Will Excite Us If You Have**

* Preferred certifications include BICSI RCDD, BICSI DCDC or other Data Center design certifications
* Demonstrated experience with local structured cabling standards (e.g. ANSI/TIA 568, ISO 11801, ANSI/TIA-942-A)
* Bachelor/Master’s Degree in Electronics, Telecommunication, Computer or appropriate field or equivalent job experience.
* Good understanding of LAN/WAN systems and physical media requirements, including wireless applications.

**What happens after you apply?**

Learn how to prepare yourself for the next steps in our hiring process by visiting https://careers.commscope.com/how-we-hire

**Why CommScope**

CommScope is pushing the boundaries of communications technology. For more than 40 years, we’ve been leaders in innovating 5G, private networks and Gigabit speeds everywhere – we're always anticipating what’s next. Developments such as the Internet of Things, seamless connectivity, Cloud and 5G introduce new requirements and demand creative thinking. With our unmatched expertise in copper, fiber, and wireless infrastructure, our global clients rely on us to outperform today and be ready for the needs of tomorrow.

CommScope is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including people with disabilities and veterans. To learn more visit careers.commscope.com/eeo

title: Library Manager I
company: County of Henrico Department of Libraries
description:
**About Us**

Henrico County, a progressive employer of choice, provides job seekers with the promise of fair and competitive compensation; a close-knit atmosphere with low employee turnover; and a benefits package that helps secure financial stability.

Established in 1611, Henrico County has deep historical roots. Henrico County borders the City of Richmond to the west, north and east and constitutes approximately a third of the Richmond metropolitan areas. Henrico County is among the top-rated counties in the nation and was one of the first localities to adopt the County Manager Form of Government. Citizens of Henrico County are represented by an elected Board of Supervisors representing five magisterial districts.

Henrico County General Government currently has more than 30 agencies. Department Heads are appointed by the County Manager, with the exception of the elected constitutional officers. Henrico County is an equal opportunity employer and, when you join us, you will be surrounded by fellow associates who come from all walks of life, all types of cultural backgrounds and all ages.

The Henrico County Library system consists of five area and four branch libraries, Mobile Library Services and Library Administrative Offices. These libraries are located throughout the county, a widely diverse county of 245.06 square miles with 28 miles separating our most distant libraries. The Library System is committed to providing excellent customer service through expert staff, state of the art facilities, and innovative technology

For more information, please visit our website at www.henricolibrary.org.

**General Statement of Duties**

  
  

Closing Date: This position closes on Tuesday, July 01, 2025.

Manages a branch library or serves as Assistant Manager of an area library or manages an administrative support function in support of Countywide library operations, programming and services (e.g. collection management, materials management, community relations, youth services, etc.); under limited supervision, provides leadership, overall administration and technical expertise for assignment; performs related duties as required.

**Essential Duties**

Henrico County Public Libraries seeks an experienced and highly-motivated Library Manager I to serve as the Branch Manager at the North Park Branch Library. This posting may be used to fill additional Library Manager I positions at other library locations.

  

This position will be responsible for all functions necessary for smooth and successful operation at a branch library including leadership of staff, thorough knowledge of library collections, technology, and HCPL policies and procedures. The ideal candidate will be an advocate for excellent customer service and will demonstrates leadership and strategic vision for their assigned location.

* Works on public service desk.
* Analyzes data, service, and facility needs.
* Sets short and long term goals.
* Monitors materials, supply, and personnel budgets.
* Manages building, equipment, and maintenance requests.
* Conducts effective hiring processes, performance appraisals, and disciplinary actions.
* Applies County Personnel Policies and Procedures and consults with County Human Resources staff as needed.
* Refers concerns to Area Library Manager/Library Administration as appropriate.
* Communicates and advocates assigned location's IT infrastructure needs to the Department's IT Manager to ensure appropriate prioritization of needs.
* Requires excellent political astuteness to appropriately represent the Library and County in internal and external interactions, communicating directly with the public, library staff, administrators, Friends of the Library, and county employees from a variety of agencies.
* Serves on the HCPL Leadership Team.

**Requirements include:**

* Advocate for excellent customer service and innovative programming.
* Extensive knowledge of the principles and practices of library and information science.
* Knowledge of and ability to apply management and supervisory principles and techniques.
* Ability to lead and inspire superior performance from staff.
* Ability to plan and creatively problem solve.
* Considerable knowledge of budgeting and financial recordkeeping.
* Ability to maintain courteous and effective relations with employees and the general public.
* Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to interpret and explain library services, policies, and procedures.

**Minimum Qualifications**

  
  

Master of Library Science and four (4) years of relevant library work experience, with two (2) years of relevant supervisory experience; OR any equivalent combination of experience and training which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities.

  
  

**Additional Information**

* The expected hiring range will be at the lower end of the listed pay scale.
* This posting may be used to fill additional Library Manager I positions at other library locations.
* A criminal history record check and fingerprinting is conducted on all persons conditionally offered employment, including a conditional offer of initial employment, or a conditional offer to promote, demote, or laterally transfer an employee.
* May require a valid driver's license to perform assigned duties at various locations within the County.
* Possession of a Librarian's Certificate from the Virginia Board for the Certification of Librarians.
* Night and weekend work is required, including Sunday hours on rotation.

**How To Apply**

  
  

Closing Date: This position closes on Tuesday, July 01, 2025.

You apply for positions with Henrico County general government through our on-line applicant system, which is available 24-hours a day, 7-days a week with an Internet connection. Please access our job site portal though https://henrico.gov/services/jobs or click on the Jobs link in the upper right hand corner of our main County page at https://henrico.gov/.

**Minimum Salary**

79144

  
  

**Maximum Salary**

145590

  
  

**Currency**

USD

**Main Organization**

General Government

  

General Government

  

**Employment Status**

Permanent Fulltime

  

Permanent Full-time

title: Systems I/II/Engineer
description:
**Job Category****:** Information Technology

**Requisition Number****:** SYSTE002268

Posting Details

Posted: May 23, 2025

Full-Time

Locations

BISMARCK, ND 58503, USA

Job Details

Description

At Knife River, we take care of our team because we know it’s our people who make us successful. We are one of the 10 largest construction materials producers/contractors in the Country, and we are a PEOPLE-first company. Our team members are the key to our success, and we are committed to giving them the tools, training, and time to do their jobs productively and safely each day. Our goal is to build strong teams that, in turn, build strong communities. We are also a publicly traded company on the NYSE with the ticker symbol KNF and part of the S&P MidCap 400 index. Please consider joining our growing team today!

This role provides complex level design of the Enterprise IT functions including system wide security, critical infrastructure, applications, data, cloud and on-premises environments, business partners and contractors. Leads complex projects and coaches and mentors other team members and ensures the success of enterprise-level application and infrastructure rollouts. Determines and develops architectural approaches and solutions, conducts business reviews, documents current systems and develops recommendations of how to proceed with the applications. Responsible for development of the essential core design of features meeting the needs across various applications throughout the organization.

**LOCATION: Bismarck, ND or in a geographic location near a Knife River location.**

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer information systems or a related field or equivalent experience; and
* 4+ years of Information Technology experience with proven record of increasing work responsibility and leadership.

**Key Skills and Competencies:**

* Ability to adapt and balance the needs of four diverse business units with distinct technology requirements. Effective analysis and project management.
* Independent judgement and creative thinking.
* In-depth knowledge of principles, practices and procedures relating to business applications with specialized skills in many areas.
* Specialized training and in-depth knowledge of company applications.
* Proven analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent listening, verbal and written communications skills.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external customers.
* Demonstrated a broad knowledge of data sources, data flow, system interactions, computer equipment and software applications in the development, enhancement, and implementation of enterprise systems on premise and in the cloud.
* Understanding of and ability to apply controls to support the enterprise security framework (CIS 20 CSCs)
* Experience selecting and implementing security technology to support an enterprise security framework.
* Understanding of and ability to maintain confidentiality of all company information.
* Effective team building and communications skills.

**Other Requirements:**

* May be required to maintain a valid driver's license.
* Requires travel: Minimal (up to 10%).

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Certifications related to Critical Infrastructure, Security or Cloud.
* Experience supporting an Enterprise environment.
* Microsoft Azure Administration
* Citrix Cloud Administration
* VMWare Administration
* Active Directory (ADDS, DNS, DHCP, Group Policy)

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Develops, manages and maintains an enterprise architecture aligned to support business strategy for multiple environments including test, development, production and disaster recovery, with focus in Microsoft Azure cloud environment.
* Determines and develops secure architectural approaches and solutions, conducts business reviews, documents current systems and develops recommendations of how to proceed with the application of security controls and network connectivity whether they are on-premises or in the cloud.
* Leads complex infrastructure and security projects and assists other others with planning, analysis, design, programming and testing tasks of complex software systems as required. Provides direction for and creates documentation to describe program development, logic and application interfaces.
* Monitors enterprise events related to infrastructure and infrastructure security events. Takes responsibility for ensuring incidents are effectively escalated, managed and resolved with full communication of status, plans and actions to management and business regions.
* Reviews, analyzes, evaluates and modifies existing, new or proposed business processes and system applications and related devices to determine feasibility and cost effectiveness of enhancements.
* Provides production support to address application errors encountered during processing. Such support may require on-call duties extending beyond normal business hours. On-call duties are shared with other team members on a rotating basis as determined by the manager.
* Oversees the development, preparation of test plans, test data and documentation. Performs required testing to ensure the system functions in accordance with the business requirements established by the user.
* Develops program specifications and provide direction through all phases of the life cycle for a project team consisting of system analysts, programmers, users, contract programmers and consultants. Performs project administration and control to effectively communicate project status to management.
* Responsible for identification, development, implementation, maintenance and integration of data security measures.
* Keeps abreast of emerging technologies related to assigned areas of responsibility and seek ways to improve application processing efficiencies.
* Assists in training and coordinating work with other developers in order to expand the knowledge base of the entire team.
* Responsible for defining the overall architecture of a computer system, security, and associated applications in order to fulfill business requirements. Such design includes a breakdown of the system components, how these components interact together and generally what technologies they employ. Acts as a highest-level technical expert, addressing problems of systems configuration, system integration, compatibility and maintenance.
* Contributes to the preparation of capital and O&M budgets for Enterprise IT. Supports business unit budgeting process.
* Provides a lead role in a team environment and prioritize resources and needs.
* Performs other tasks and special projects as assigned.

**How To Apply:**  
Knife River is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other protected category under applicable state/federal law.  
  
Subject to pre-employment drug testing and background checks.  
  
If unable to apply online, please mail completed application to:  
Knife River Corporation  
Box 5568  
Bismarck, ND 58506

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

We are one of the 10 largest construction materials producers/contractors in the Country, and we are a PEOPLE-first company. description:
**Job Category****:** Manager

**Requisition Number****:** AREAM002249

Posting Details

Posted: May 19, 2025

Full-Time

Hybrid

Locations

SAUK RAPIDS, MN 56379, USA

Pay or shift range: $85,000 USD to $100,000 USD
  
  
The estimated range is the budgeted amount for this position. Final offers are based on various factors, including skill set, experience, location, qualifications and other job-related reasons.

Job Details

Description

At Knife River, we take care of our team because we know it’s our people who make us successful. We are one of the 10 largest construction materials producers/contractors in the Country, and we are a PEOPLE-first company. Our team members are the key to our success, and we are committed to giving them the tools, training, and time to do their jobs productively and safely each day. Our goal is to build strong teams that, in turn, build strong communities. We are also a publicly traded company on the NYSE with the ticker symbol KNF and part of the S&P MidCap 400 index.

This position provides daily supervision and work direction leading the daily operations of a multiple ready-mix sites in accordance with Knife River policies and applicable laws to ensure production of shippable product to meet customer demand in a timely and cost-effective manner. The position’s responsibilities include oversite of the following for assigned sites: driver/distribution activities, production and production personnel, site preventive & reactive maintenance, budgeting and staffing needs. A unique opportunity using leadership and coaching skills in fast pace ready mix operations.

Salary range: $85,000 - $100,000

Hours per week: 40+

**Duties and/or Responsibilities:**

* Demonstrates a commitment to communicating, improving and adhering to safety policies in all work environments and areas.
* Practice and promote safety in such way as including but not limited to, assessing risks before starting tasks, only performing authorized activities, utilizing appropriate PPE and mentoring others to do as well.
* Ensure an understanding and compliance with company policies and procedures and hold employees accountable for such.
* Responsible for ensuring contractor safety through proper training and monitoring of activities while on site.
* Provide leadership in the daily supervision of all site employees.
* Oversight of site driver distribution KPI’s and coaching for performance to ensure drivers meet and exceed delivery KPI expectations.
* Regularly prepares requested reports on production output, plant downtime, safety metrics (lost time, near miss or safety incidents), inventory and other reporting required to make decisions regarding the business.
* Promptly and thoroughly investigate safety incidents, adhering to all incident reporting protocols to include drug testing, reporting of incidents and timely communication to the Safety Department, and as required.
* Works with team to identify, troubleshoot and resolve production problems.
* Responsible for maintaining inventory required to ensure production goals, and customer demands are met in a timely manner.
* Generates ideas and implements changes in processes, and the use of equipment to increase efficiency, improve safety and quality and improve employee morale.
* Maintain cleanliness and good housekeeping practices throughout all sites.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor's degree preferred or 10 years of applicable experience in ready mix or other construction materials operations.
* Supervisory experience in operations, preferably in the construction or mining industry with a solid understanding of safety regulation, quality control, preventive maintenance and crew leadership. Demonstrated ability to direct, coach and train associates. Able to plan, monitor, and schedule work.

**Preferred Requirements:**

* **Field of Study Preferred**: Construction Management or Business.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**

* Strong leadership & coaching skills.
* Exude excellent interpersonal communication skills.
* Strong knowledge of manufacturing processes.
* Able to multi-task and prioritize to meet deadlines.
* Show a willingness to learn and flexible to adapt to various work assignments within the region.
* Demonstrate excellent analytical skills.
* Demonstrate a commitment to communicating, improving and adhering to health, safety and environmental policies in all work environments and areas.
* Promote a culture of safety and exhibit these behaviors.
* Successful candidates must adhere to all safety protocols and proper use of Knife River approved Personal Protection Equipment & PPE, including but not limited to respirators. title: Principal Manager - Marketing Capabilities
description:
**Additional Location(s):** US-MN-Maple Grove; US-MN-Arden Hills

**Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance**

At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.

**About the role:**  
We are seeking a Principal Marketing Manager to join our Marketing Capabilities team, focused on developing and managing strategic and impactful marketing capabilities initiatives that empower divisional teams across Boston Scientific. This role will lead the identification, development, and management of the upstream elements of our new Marketing Blueprint framework. You will guide teams through the early phases of strategic marketing to ensure excellence in customer-centric planning, market assessment, value proposition development, product development, and go-to-market planning.

While this is an individual contributor role, you will play a highly influential part in shaping strategy and enabling execution by collaborating across divisions, engaging with senior stakeholders, and leading key initiatives. This is a unique opportunity to impact marketing strategy at scale by working across divisions and product lines to identify areas of strength, uncover capability gaps, and drive measurable improvements in marketing performance and productivity.

**Work Mode**  
Boston Scientific follows a hybrid work model, requiring team members to be on-site at least three days per week to foster strong collaboration and synergy.

**Your responsibilities will include:**

* Lead the rollout and continuous evolution of the upstream stages of the Boston Scientific Marketing Framework to strengthen insight-led strategies and resource prioritization.
* Manage the enterprise-wide marketing framework across the Learn, Assess, and Decide phases, including identifying market needs, building business cases, and selecting differentiated offerings with go-to-market strategies.
* Collaborate with divisional and regional product marketing teams, as well as cross-functional stakeholders, to assess marketing maturity and support strategic planning initiatives.
* Partner with Marketing Capabilities and divisional teams to standardize and deploy best practices, tools, and frameworks consistently across global marketing functions.
* Identify and document marketing case studies to support capability building and apply frameworks to planning, launches, and lifecycle management activities.
* Define, track, and report on KPIs for upstream marketing adoption, performance, and strategic impact, while identifying continuous improvement opportunities.

**Required qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study.
* 7+ years of experience in MedTech marketing, with deep understanding of upstream strategy, product marketing, and go-to-market planning
* Demonstrated experience in customer segmentation, opportunity evaluation, product validation, and development of value propositions
* Experience contributing to outcomes within a matrixed global organization; experience in medical devices or similar regulated industries is beneficial but not required
* Proven ability to analyze complex information, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and contribute to decision-making processes without direct authority
* Effective written and verbal communication skills, along with experience in facilitation and managing projects through completion

**Preferred qualifications:**

* Familiarity working across a few different therapy categories
* MBA or relevant advanced degree

**Requisition ID:** 608432

**Minimum Salary: $****103700**

**Maximum Salary: $****197000**

The anticipated compensation listed above and the value of core and optional employee benefits offered by Boston Scientific (BSC) – see www.bscbenefitsconnect.com-will vary based on actual location of the position and other pertinent factors considered in determining actual compensation for the role. Compensation will be commensurate with demonstrable level of experience and training, pertinent education including licensure and certifications, among other relevant business or organizational needs. **At BSC, it is not typical for an individual to be hired near the bottom or top of the anticipated salary range listed above.**

Compensation for **non-exempt (hourly), non-sales roles** may also include variable compensation from time to time (e.g., any overtime and shift differential) and annual bonus target (subject to plan eligibility and other requirements).

Compensation for **exempt, non-sales roles** may also include variable compensation, i.e., annual bonus target and long-term incentives (subject to plan eligibility and other requirements).

**For MA positions:** It is unlawful to require or administer a lie detector test for employment. Violators are subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.

So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!

At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve.

Boston Scientific Corporation has been and will continue to be an equal opportunity employer. To ensure full implementation of its equal employment policy, the Company will continue to take steps to assure that recruitment, hiring, assignment, promotion, compensation, and all other personnel decisions are made and administered without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, gender expression, veteran status, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information or any other protected class.

Please be advised that certain US based positions, including without limitation field sales and service positions that call on hospitals and/or health care centers, require acceptable proof of COVID-19 vaccination status. Candidates will be notified during the interview and selection process if the role(s) for which they have applied require proof of vaccination as a condition of employment. Boston Scientific continues to evaluate its policies and protocols regarding the COVID-19 vaccine and will comply with all applicable state and federal law and healthcare credentialing requirements. As employees of the Company, you will be expected to meet the ongoing requirements for your roles, including any new requirements, should the Company’s policies or protocols change with regard to COVID-19 vaccination.
company_description: Boston Scientific is dedicated to transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients around the world.

title: Benefits Systems Consultant I
description:
Job Description

#### **Job ID**

BENEF013558

#### **Employment Type**

Regular

#### **Work Style**

hybrid

#### **Location**

Alpharetta,GA,United States

#### **Travel**

Up to 25%

#### **Role**

Benefits Systems Consultant I

Company Overview

With 80,000 customers across 150 countries, UKG is the largest U.S.-based private software company in the world. And we’re only getting started. Ready to bring your bold ideas and collaborative mindset to an organization that still has so much more to build and achieve? Read on.

  

At UKG, you get more than just a job. You get to work with purpose. Our team of U Krewers are on a mission to inspire every organization to become a great place to work through our award-winning HR technology built for all.

  

Here, we know that you’re more than your work. That’s why our benefits help you thrive personally and professionally, from wellness programs and tuition reimbursement to U Choose — a customizable expense reimbursement program that can be used for more than 200+ needs that best suit you and your family, from student loan repayment, to childcare, to pet insurance. Our inclusive culture, active and engaged employee resource groups, and caring leaders value every voice and support you in doing the best work of your career. If you’re passionate about our purpose — people —then we can’t wait to support whatever gives you purpose. We’re united by purpose, inspired by you.  
Job Summary:  
  
The System Consultant 1 (Post-Live) will be called on to perform various roles during the course of the post-live cycle for our customers all while maintaining World Class Customer Service. The individual will be responsible for a variety of tasks that include working with customers on their Open Enrollment Renewals and completing basic Post-Live configuration/system update projects. Their main responsibility will be to complete light configuration, act as a back-stage resource on non-complex projects and complete non-complex Renewal projects.  
  
Duties and Responsibilities:  
  
Work with internal teams to establish project scope, gather configuration requirements, and set system goals for configuration projects.  
  
Collaborate with Sr. & Lead System Consultants to complete system configuration updates  
  
Communicate with customers and internal partners on outstanding technical requests.  
  
Projects are closed within set timelines and appropriate documentation maintained and uploaded to Salesforce.  
  
Complete light configuration projects under the oversight of Senior and Lead System Consultants as a backstage resource.  
  
Other projects and tasks as assigned by Manager.  
  
Required Qualifications:  
  
Organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills.  
  
Ability to manage priorities and workflow in a dynamic environment.  
  
Communication, interpersonal, and follow-up skills are critical for success.  
  
Ability to appropriately set and manage expectations.  
  
Preferred Qualifications:  
  
Minimum 1 year of customer service experience.  
  
Proficient using the Microsoft Office Suite of software to include Outlook, Word, and Excel.  
  
Health & Welfare 1+ years’ experience.

Where we’re going

UKG is on the cusp of something truly special. Worldwide, we already hold the #1 market share position for workforce management and the #2 position for human capital management. Tens of millions of frontline workers start and end their days with our software, with billions of shifts managed annually through UKG solutions today. Yet it’s our AI-powered product portfolio designed to support customers of all sizes, industries, and geographies that will propel us into an even brighter tomorrow!

Equal Opportunity Employer

UKG is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, disability, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, and other legally protected categories.

View The EEO Know Your Rights poster

UKG participates in E-Verify.

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Disability Accommodation in the Application and Interview Process

For individuals with disabilities that need additional assistance at any point in the application and interview process, please email UKGCareers@ukg.com.

  

The pay range for this position is $50,400 to $72,400, however, base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for a short-term incentive and a long-term incentive as part of total compensation. Information about UKG’s comprehensive benefits can be reviewed on our careers site at https://www.ukg.com/careers

title: DISPATCHER II
description:
**Job Category****:** Supervisor

**Requisition Number****:** DISPA002181

Posting Details

Posted: May 2, 2025

Full-Time

On-site

Locations

Aiea, HI 96701, USA

Pay or shift range: $79,000 USD to $82,000 USD
  
  
The estimated range is the budgeted amount for this position. Final offers are based on various factors, including skill set, experience, location, qualifications and other job-related reasons.

Job Details

Description

**GENERAL SUMMARY**

As a Dispatcher, you will direct and dispatch the delivery of ready-mix concrete for the present-day schedule, coordinates the schedules of future orders. Supervises, directs and controls work of all mixer drivers and plant personnel to ensure continuous and efficient delivery of material to all customers. Promotes good customer relations. This position requires second step thinking, prioritizing and sound decision making in order to meet delivery deadlines.

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**

* High School Diploma
* Must possess a valid driver’s license and maintain an acceptable driving record.
* Basic math and computer knowledge
* Familiar with Oahu streets, highways and traffic
* Willing and able to work a flexible schedule

**PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS**

* 2 years of experience in the concrete industry
* Business or technical degree
* ACI Level 1 Certification

**DUTIES AND/OR RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Coordinates and controls delivery of ready-mix concrete for current days schedule.
* Receives orders and schedules future ready-mix concrete deliveries.
* Supervises and directs the work of batch plant operators, loader operators and ready-mix drivers.
* Communicates with the Concrete Operations Manager and Maintenance Department to ensure that equipment work orders are current.
* Utilizes all information passed from the Sales Department for maximum results.
* Processes and posts required information on delivery tickets to ensure accurate invoice billing.
* Receives and balances all transactions for COD sales.
* Consistently administers the Collective Bargaining Agreement.
* Always works safely and takes action to prevent any and all unsafe actions, processes, and behaviors.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES**

* Ability to communicate at multiple levels.
* Committed to a high level of customer service.
* Understands industry standards associated with the ready-mix business.

Full-Time

On-site

Locations

BURNET, TX 78611, USA

Job Details

Description

At Knife River, we take care of our team because we know it’s our people who make us successful. We are one of the 10 largest construction materials producers/contractors in the Country, and we are a PEOPLE-first company. Our team members are the key to our success, and we are committed to giving them the tools, training, and time to do their jobs productively and safely each day. Our goal is to build strong teams that, in turn, build strong communities. We are also a publicly traded company on the NYSE with the ticker symbol KNF and part of the S&P MidCap 400 index.

This is a full time, year-round position that comes with great benefits!

As an Electrician you are responsible to safely install, troubleshoot and repair electrical systems and electrical components on asphalt plants, aggregate plants, quarries and equipment.

**Duties and/or Responsibilities:**

* Responsible to safely install and repair electrical systems and electrical components at asphalt plants and aggregate equipment, following electrical code, manuals, schematic diagrams, blueprints and other specifications using hand tools, power tools and electrical equipment.
* Installs power supply wiring and conduit for newly installed machines and equipment following blueprints and electrical codes using hand tools and voltage tester.
* Diagnoses malfunctioning apparatus using test equipment and replaces damaged or broken wires using hand tools.
* Diagnoses and repairs or replaces faulty electronic components such as circuit boards, soft starts, PLC5, VFD2 & remote-control systems
* May diagnose and replace faulty mechanical, hydraulic and pneumatic components of machines and equipment.
* Replaces faulty electrical components of machine and positions sensing devices using hand tools. Replaces electric motor bearings and rewires motors.
* Communicate effectively (verbal, listening, written) and work with difficult people under high stress situations. Self-motivated, team-player with good interpersonal skills; ability to maintain positive customer relations & act courteous/respectful of others.
* Troubleshoot and problem solve situations/problems (material quality, equipment operation/repair, etc.).
* Monitor and discuss production problems with co-workers and managers/supervisors. Provide and maintain proper licensure & acceptable driving record.
* Ensure OSHA, MSHA, EPA, DNR, safety and environmental regulation compliance.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  

**Minimum Qualifications:**

As a successful Electrician you will have:

* Minimum 2-year degree from accredited college or university in related field.
* Minimum 2 years' experience in electrical field.
* Class A Journeyworker minimum, Master preferred.
* Provide and maintain proper licensure, medical card and applicable driving record.
* An understanding of electrical theory and application.

**Notice:**

Because of the nature of work at Knife River, the person in this position may be expected to work any shift and at various locations based on company needs and the duties of the position may change at any time and may not be identified in this job description. The content of the job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. It is not intended to be construed as a contract or an all-inclusive list of all responsibilities, duties, and/or skills and abilities required of all personnel so classified.

  

**Veterans:**

At Knife River, we are committed to helping our military transition to civilian life. We are constantly looking to add veterans to our workforce and want to make the transition as smooth as possible. There are many jobs within the military that are transferable to the Electrician position. Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Job Details

Description

We have an excellent opportunity for a Controller in Stockton, California!  
  
Responsible for maintaining adequate and proper ledger accounts of all assets, liabilities and transactions for four operating companies and ensures that audits are performed as directed. Prepares and reports financial results that conform to generally accepted accounting principles and internal control requirements. Interacts with managers, supervisors, sales personnel and department heads.

Job Duties:

* Manages the accounting department, including staffing needs and career development.
* Prepares and/or reviews journal entries and accounting transactions affecting general ledger accounts; audits the account balances and oversees the preparation of monthly financial statements.
* Supervises adequate accounting records of all assets, liabilities, and transactions of the company.
* Assists in determining depreciable rates. Assists fleet managers and operations personnel with various equipment and PP&E analysis and reporting requirements.
* Prepares and interprets financial statements, cost data, and management reports of the company. Assists other executives, managers and supervisors in analyzing financial results, as needed.
* Supervises and/or directs the coordination of other external reports to government agencies and third parties as required.
* Directs processes ensuring accounting controls for asset protection and financial and management information reporting.
* Ensures that bank statements and other general ledger accounts are reconciled.
* Manages various external audits (sales tax, property tax, etc.)
* Directs the coordination of special projects or activities within operating departments.
* Manage audits with internal and/or independent external auditors.
* Assists with the integration of completed acquisitions.
* Always work safely and take action to prevent any and all unsafe actions, processes, and behaviors.
* Must maintain confidentiality to the highest degree and have superior analytical abilities and team building skills.
* Must maintain the highest level of moral and ethical standards.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance
* Five years related experience preferably in the construction materials industry.
* Three years of experience in supervisory role.
* Strong analytical and financial skills.
* High ethical and moral standards.
* Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills.
* Advanced computer skills using spreadsheet, presentation, databases & accounting software.
* Advanced knowledge and application of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
* Accounting experience in general ledger accounting and auditing; financial forecasting and budgeting and financial reporting.
* Exposure to and experience with Sarbanes Oxley compliance requirements desirable.
* Professional communication skills including written and verbal for internal and external customers.
* Ability to work independently, prioritize and manage tasks to meet deadlines and expectations with minimal supervision

Preferred Qualifications:

* CPA Certificate preferred.
* Accounting experience in the construction industry.

Job Details

Description

At Pacific Northwest Oil, we take care of our team because we know it’s our people who make us successful. Our team members are the key to our success, and we are committed to giving them the tools, training, and time to do their jobs productively and safely each day. Our goal is to build strong teams that, in turn, build strong communities. We are also a publicly traded company on the NYSE with the ticker symbol KNF and part of the S&P MidCap 400 index.

**Job Summary:**

This position is responsible for operating an asphalt distributor truck safely and efficiently. Under the direction of the dispatcher,
  
the driver will be responsible to deliver and apply product to customer specifications on appropriate projects located in California
  
and Out-of-State. As the position is weather and construction season dependent, there may be a period of layoff.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:**

1. Operates a heavy-duty diesel truck equipped with an asphalt tank and spray bar to deliver asphalt and emulsion to customers in
  
California and Out-of-State.  
2. Conduct all pre and post trip safety inspections and paperwork.  
3. Must work with company dispatcher to receive daily project assignments.  
4. Must fill truck tank using proper loading procedures with asphalt oil, emulsion or other product.  
5. Transport tank load to assigned project in the safest and most efficient travel route.  
6. Must operate truck instruments to distribute tank load on road or other appropriate surfaces as directed by customer order.  
7. Where appropriate, may apply material with hand wand walking over area where material is applied.  
8. Driver must maintain clean, proper and good working order the truck, tanker and other equipment.
  
9. The driver must inform the dispatcher or mechanic of needed roadside or overnight repairs to the truck to keep it in compliance
  
with company policy and/or state or federal regulation.  
10.Ensure all measurements of road or job have been taken and are verified before departing project.  
11.Drivers must keep a daily driver’s log and monitor for hours of running and communicate with dispatch.
  
12. Drivers must complete all required paperwork including accounting, timecards, safety or equipment reports.  
13. Must work safely and take action to prevent any and all unsafe actions, processes, and behaviors.
  
14. Perform other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Must be willing to work in all weather conditions
* Must possess a valid class A state driver’s license and have an acceptable driving record.
* Must pass a pre-employment drug screening and background check.
* Job requires steady to intermittent physical activity including standing, stooping kneeling, climbing, walking on uneven ground.
* 2 years class A driver with manual transmission experience.

We have an excellent opportunity for Screed Operators in our Central Idaho Division location, and we encourage applicants in the Coeur d’Alene, ID and Spokane, WA area to apply!

  

**Duties and/or Responsibilities:**

* Uses safe work procedures that comply with safety policies and regulations. (Federal, state, local and company policies).
* Perform daily equipment, walk around and site inspections to identify and correct any unsafe conditions and keep equipment properly maintained.
* Safely and properly perform maintenance on paving machine.
* Safely and properly operate adjusting mechanism of paving machine. Bolts extensions to screed to adjust width as needed.
* Heat screed at beginning of shift.
* Observes distribution of paving material along screed and controls direction of screed.
* Clean screed at end of shift.
* Communicate effectively (verbal, listening, written) and work with difficult people under high stress situations. Self-motivated, team-player with good interpersonal skills; ability to maintain positive customer relations and act courteous/respectful of others.
* Troubleshoot and problem solve situations/problems (material quality, equipment operation/repair, etc.). Monitor and discuss production problems with co-workers and managers/supervisors.
* Ensure OSHA, EPA, DNR, safety and environmental regulation compliance.
* Job requires steady to intermittent and repetitive physical activity including: standing, stooping, kneeling, climbing, walking on uneven ground, lifting, carrying, pushing, shoveling, and raking.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
  

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* One year or more experience operating screed equipment  
  + Has knowledge of the aspects of paving operations
  + A high school diploma or general education degree (GED) is preferred

  + Valid driver’s license
  + Must be able to work day shifts and night shifts. Shifts may vary according to project demands
  + Must be able to work in all weather conditions
  + Must be willing to travel if job requires
  + Must pass a pre-employment drug screen
  

**How To Apply:**  
Knife River is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other protected category under applicable state/federal law.

**Requisition Number****:** SPREA001686

Posting Details

Full-Time

On-site

Locations

Morgan Hill, CA 95037, USA

Job Details

Description

At Pacific Northwest Oil, we take care of our team because we know it’s our people who make us successful. Our team members are the key to our success, and we are committed to giving them the tools, training, and time to do their jobs productively and safely each day. Our goal is to build strong teams that, in turn, build strong communities. We are also a publicly traded company on the NYSE with the ticker symbol KNF and part of the S&P MidCap 400 index.

**Job Summary:**

This position is responsible for operating an asphalt distributor truck safely and efficiently. Under the direction of the dispatcher,
  
the driver will be responsible to deliver and apply product to customer specifications on appropriate projects located in California
  
and Out-of-State. As the position is weather and construction season dependent, there may be a period of layoff.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:**

1. Operates a heavy-duty diesel truck equipped with an asphalt tank and spray bar to deliver asphalt and emulsion to customers in
  
California and Out-of-State.  
2. Conduct all pre and post trip safety inspections and paperwork.  
3. Must work with company dispatcher to receive daily project assignments.  
4. Must fill truck tank using proper loading procedures with asphalt oil, emulsion or other product.  
5. Transport tank load to assigned project in the safest and most efficient travel route .  
6. Must operate truck instruments to distribute tank load on road or other appropriate surfaces as directed by customer order.  
7. Where appropriate, may apply material with hand wand walking over area where material is applied.  
8. Driver must maintain clean, proper and good working order the truck, tanker and other equipment.
  
9. The driver must inform the dispatcher or mechanic of needed roadside or overnight repairs to the truck to keep it in compliance
  
with company policy and/or state or federal regulation.  
10.Ensure all measurements of road or job have been taken and are verified before departing project.  
11.Drivers must keep a daily driver’s log and monitor for hours of running and communicate with dispatch .
  
12. Drivers must complete all required paperwork including accounting, timecards, safety or equipment reports.  
13. Must work safely and take action to prevent any and all unsafe actions, processes, and behaviors.
  
14. Perform other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Must be willing to work in all weather conditions
* Must possess a valid class A state driver’s license and have an acceptable driving record.
* Must pass a pre-employment drug screening and background check.
* Job requires steady to intermittent physical activity including standing, stooping kneeling, climbing, walking on uneven ground.
* 2 years class A driver with manual transmission experience.

**How To Apply:**  
Pacific Northwest Oil is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other protected category under applicable state/federal law.

**Paper Applications:**

Mail to: Attention Hiring Manager; PNO, 3310 E Miner Ave, Stockton, CA 95205

Subject to pre-employment drug testing and background checks.

Licenses & Certifications

**Required**

Double Endorsement

Tanker Endorsement

Driver's License Class A
